name: Bull Penis Chilaquiles
author: Kat Kinsman
method: Cut open the penises lengthwise, remove and discard the urethra and trim any excess skin, rinse thoroughly
Add the penises, salt, vegetables and fruit, and 1/4 cup water to the Instant Pot and pressure cook on high for 30 minutes
Perform a manual release and pour out excess liquid
Add cilantro, thyme, oregano and saute until the mixture is slightly thickened
Beat two eggs, stir in to the penises and sauce
Add as many chips as you'd like along with chicken stock
Saute until the chips are softened
Scoop the chips, vegetables, fruit, and penises, into a bowl
Top with sliced egg tofu and flowering chives
description:
It was almost like Chekhov's bull penis in its inevitability. I'd spotted the foam trays of "pizzle" in the offal section of Fei Long, my favorite pan-Asian market, and done the inevitable snickering and Tweeting, but I knew somewhere deep within that it was only a matter of time before I took the bull by the horns and figured out a way to stick it in the Instant Pot. Most penis-based recipes make no bones about the fact that it takes an awfully long time to cook down, but when you apply the right kind of pressure, it all comes together pretty quickly. 
 Recipe taken from: https://myrecipes.com

name: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal
author: System
method: Combine 90 g oats and 350 mL water with a pinch of salt in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer until oats are soft, about 5 minutes.
Stir in one diced apple, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 15 g brown sugar.
Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve warm.
description: A warm, comforting bowl of oatmeal enriched with the natural sweetness of apples and a hint of cinnamon. Perfect for a hearty breakfast.

name: Avocado Lime Shrimp Salad
author: System
method: Mix 500 g peeled shrimp with 15 mL olive oil, juice of 1 lime, and 1 tsp chili powder. Grill until cooked.
Combine grilled shrimp with 2 diced avocados, 1 diced tomato, and 100 g mixed greens in a salad bowl.
Dress with juice of another lime and 30 mL chopped cilantro. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
description: Fresh and zesty, this salad combines creamy avocado with tangy lime and succulent shrimp, dressed in a light cilantro-lime vinaigrette.

name: Almond Joy Smoothie
author: System
method: Blend 240 mL coconut milk, 30 mL almond butter, 1 frozen banana, and 30 mL cocoa powder until smooth.
Pour into glasses and top with 15 g shredded coconut and 15 g chocolate chips.
description: Enjoy the flavors of your favorite candy bar in a smoothie with this blend of almond butter, chocolate, and coconut.

name: Asian Beef Lettuce Wraps
author: System
method: Cook 500 g ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir in 1 diced bell pepper, 50 g diced water chestnuts, 30 mL soy sauce, and 15 mL hoisin sauce. Cook for 5 minutes.
Spoon the beef mixture into leaves of 1 head of butter lettuce. Top with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
description: These light and healthy wraps feature savory beef seasoned with Asian flavors, all tucked into crisp lettuce leaves.

name: Apricot Glazed Chicken Thighs
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Arrange 8 chicken thighs on a baking sheet.
In a bowl, mix 120 mL apricot preserves, 15 mL soy sauce, and 1 clove garlic minced. Brush onto chicken.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Optionally, broil for 2-3 minutes to crisp the skin.
description: Sweet apricot preserves meld perfectly with soy sauce and garlic, creating a delicious glaze that makes these chicken thighs irresistibly tasty.

name: Apple Pecan Chicken Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 300 g cooked, cubed chicken breast, 1 diced apple, 100 g chopped pecans, 100 g celery sliced, and 100 g grapes halved.
Mix 120 mL mayonnaise, 30 mL honey, and 15 mL lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss the salad with the dressing and chill before serving.
description: This delightful salad mixes sweet apples and grapes with the crunch of pecans and celery, all brought together with a creamy honey-lemon dressing.

name: Asparagus and Lemon Pasta
author: System
method: Boil 400 g of pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL of olive oil over medium heat. Add 300 g of chopped asparagus and sauté until tender.
Stir in the zest and juice of 1 lemon, and 100 mL of cream. Season with salt and pepper.
Toss the pasta with the asparagus sauce. Serve garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: Bright and refreshing, this pasta dish features tender asparagus and a creamy lemon sauce, making it a perfect spring meal.

name: Apricot Balsamic Chicken
author: System
method: Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Brown in a skillet with 15 mL olive oil.
Remove chicken and add 120 mL balsamic vinegar and 120 mL apricot preserves to the pan. Reduce by half.
Return chicken to the pan, coat with the glaze, and cover. Simmer until chicken is cooked through.
Serve chicken sliced with a sprinkle of fresh basil.
description: Tender chicken breasts glazed with a sweet and tangy apricot balsamic sauce, this dish is both delicious and visually appealing.

name: Ancho Chili Beef Stew
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg beef chunks in 30 mL oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 2 chopped onions, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 2 diced carrots. Cook until soft.
Return beef to the pot with 1 L beef broth, 30 g ancho chili powder, and 1 diced tomato. Simmer for 2 hours.
Thicken with a mixture of 15 mL cornstarch and 30 mL water if desired. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
description: This hearty stew, with its robust flavors of ancho chili and tender beef, is a comforting dish perfect for cold evenings.

name: Apple Walnut Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 200 g mixed salad greens, 1 sliced apple, 100 g chopped walnuts, and 50 g crumbled blue cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL apple cider vinegar, 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL honey, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Serve immediately.
description: Crisp apples and rich walnuts provide a delightful texture and flavor contrast in this fresh salad, perfect for a light lunch or a side dish.

name: Artichoke Dip
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a mixing bowl, combine 240 g canned artichoke hearts (drained and chopped), 120 g cream cheese, 60 g sour cream, and 60 g mayonnaise.
Stir in 100 g grated Parmesan cheese and 1 minced garlic clove. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes until bubbly and golden. Serve warm with bread or chips.
description: Creamy and tangy, this baked artichoke dip is loaded with cheese and makes a perfect party starter served with crisp bread or chips.

name: Asian Pear Slaw
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 2 thinly sliced Asian pears, 200 g shredded cabbage, 50 g shredded carrots, and 50 g thinly sliced red onions.
In a small bowl, whisk together 30 mL rice vinegar, 15 mL sesame oil, 15 mL soy sauce, and 15 g sugar.
Pour the dressing over the slaw and toss to combine. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
description: A crunchy, refreshing slaw featuring Asian pears with a light, tangy dressing, ideal as a side dish or a healthy snack.

name: Avocado Breakfast Toast
author: System
method: Toast 4 slices of whole grain bread until golden and crispy.
In a bowl, mash 2 ripe avocados with the juice of 1 lime, salt, and pepper.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
Optionally, top with 2 poached eggs, sprinkle with red pepper flakes, and serve immediately.
description: Creamy mashed avocado on toasted bread, optionally topped with a silky poached egg, makes for a fulfilling and healthy breakfast option.

name: Apple Pecan Crisp
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large bowl, toss 4 sliced apples with 30 mL lemon juice, 30 g granulated sugar, and 1 tsp cinnamon.
Transfer to a baking dish. In another bowl, mix 100 g rolled oats, 100 g flour, 100 g brown sugar, 100 g chopped pecans, and 120 g melted butter.
Sprinkle the oat mixture over the apples. Bake for 45 minutes until topping is golden and apples are bubbly.
description: A delightful dessert of tender, spiced apples topped with a crispy oat and pecan layer, perfect for a cozy night in.

name: Apricot Glazed Pork Chops
author: System
method: Season 4 pork chops (each 200 g) with salt and pepper.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat and brown the pork chops on both sides.
In a small bowl, mix 120 mL apricot jam with 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL Dijon mustard. Brush this glaze over the pork chops.
Cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes, until pork chops are cooked through. Serve garnished with fresh parsley.
description: These pork chops are glazed with a sweet and tangy apricot sauce, providing a perfect balance of flavors that elevate this simple dish.

name: Almond Crusted Halibut
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Mix 100 g crushed almonds, 30 g bread crumbs, 1 tsp thyme, and salt and pepper in a shallow dish.
Brush 4 halibut fillets (each 150 g) with 30 mL melted butter, then dredge in the almond mixture.
Place on a greased baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and fish flakes easily with a fork.
description: Delicate halibut fillets encrusted with a crispy almond coating, baked to perfection, offering a sophisticated yet easy-to-prepare dish.

name: Apple Beetroot Salad
author: System
method: Roast 400 g beetroot, peeled and diced, at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes or until tender.
In a large bowl, combine roasted beetroot, 2 diced apples, 50 g crumbled feta, and 50 g walnuts.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp honey, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad, toss to coat, and serve chilled.
description: A vibrant, earthy salad featuring the natural sweetness of apples and beetroot, complemented by feta and walnuts for added texture and richness.

name: Anchovy Olive Tapenade
author: System
method: In a food processor, blend 50 g anchovies, 150 g pitted olives, 2 cloves garlic, and 30 mL capers until smooth.
While blending, slowly add 60 mL olive oil until the mixture emulsifies.
Stir in 1 tbsp chopped parsley. Season with pepper and serve with crusty bread.
description: A robust tapenade made from salty anchovies and olives, perfect as a spread for bruschetta or as a condiment with Mediterranean dishes.

name: Avocado Cucumber Soup
author: System
method: Blend 3 peeled avocados, 1 peeled and diced cucumber, juice of 2 limes, and 240 mL plain yogurt until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Serve cold, garnished with a swirl of yogurt and a sprinkle of chopped dill.
description: A refreshing and creamy cold soup that combines the richness of avocado with the crispness of cucumber, enhanced with a tang of lime.

name: Apple Smoked Barbecue Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg pork ribs with a mix of 30 g smoked paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, and salt and pepper.
Smoke over applewood at 225°F (107°C) for 4 hours or until tender.
Glaze with 120 mL barbecue sauce mixed with 60 mL apple cider vinegar during the last 30 minutes of cooking. Serve hot.
description: Tender ribs smoked to perfection with a hint of applewood, slathered in a homemade apple-infused barbecue sauce for an irresistible finish.

name: Almond Butter Banana Bread
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a loaf pan.
In a bowl, mix 200 g all-purpose flour, 5 g baking powder, and 1 g salt.
In another bowl, cream together 100 g almond butter, 100 mL vegetable oil, and 150 g sugar. Beat in 2 eggs and 3 mashed bananas.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and pour into prepared pan. Bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
description: Rich and nutty almond butter adds a twist to traditional banana bread, making it even more moist and flavorful.

name: Asian Ginger Beef Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Thinly slice 500 g beef sirloin and marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, and 15 g grated ginger for 30 minutes.
In a wok, heat 15 mL vegetable oil over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry until browned.
Add 1 sliced bell pepper and 1 sliced onion, stir-fry for an additional 5 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL oyster sauce and heat through. Serve over cooked rice.
description: Sizzling slices of sirloin beef, infused with ginger and Asian seasonings, make this stir-fry a quick and tasty weeknight dinner option.

name: Avocado Caprese Salad
author: System
method: Slice 2 large ripe avocados and 4 medium tomatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices.
Layer avocado and tomato slices with 200 g fresh mozzarella, also sliced, on a platter.
Drizzle with 30 mL balsamic glaze and 30 mL olive oil.
Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and 15 g fresh basil leaves. Serve immediately.
description: A fresh twist on the classic Caprese, incorporating creamy avocado slices for a richer flavor and texture.

name: Aromatic Herb Roasted Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Rub a whole 1.5 kg chicken with a mix of 15 mL olive oil, 5 g salt, 5 g pepper, 5 g thyme, 5 g rosemary, and 5 g sage.
Stuff the chicken cavity with 1 halved lemon and a bunch of herbs.
Roast in the oven for 90 minutes or until the juices run clear. Let rest before carving.
description: This roast chicken is not only succulent and flavorful with a crisp skin, but it's also fragrant with a bouquet of herbs, making it a perfect Sunday dinner option.

name: Apple Maple Glazed Salmon
author: System
method: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Mix 60 mL maple syrup, 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g minced garlic in a bowl.
Place 4 salmon fillets (each 150 g) on a greased foil sheet. Brush with half of the glaze.
Grill for 7 minutes, then flip, apply the rest of the glaze, and grill for another 7 minutes or until cooked through.
description: Rich salmon fillets are enhanced with a sweet and tangy apple maple glaze, creating a perfect harmony of flavors that's ideal for a light, healthy meal.

name: Artichoke Lemon Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g pasta according to package instructions. Drain, reserving 100 mL of the pasta water.
In a skillet, sauté 200 g canned artichoke hearts (drained and quartered) and 2 minced garlic cloves in 30 mL olive oil.
Add the zest and juice of 1 lemon, 50 mL capers, and reserved pasta water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Toss the pasta with the artichoke sauce. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, and garnish with 30 g grated Parmesan.
description: A light and zesty dish, this pasta combines tangy lemon and capers with hearty artichokes, topped with Parmesan for a satisfying meal.

name: Apricot Almond Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Roll out 200 g puff pastry and place in a tart pan. Prick the base with a fork.
Spread 100 g almond paste over the pastry. Top with 300 g sliced apricots.
Bake for 35 minutes until the pastry is golden and the apricots are tender.
Brush with 30 mL warmed apricot jam for a glossy finish. Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: This tart combines sweet apricots and rich almond paste in a flaky puff pastry crust, glazed with apricot jam for a delightful finish.

name: Asian Cucumber Salad
author: System
method: Thinly slice 3 large cucumbers and 1 red onion. Place in a large bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk together 60 mL rice vinegar, 30 mL sesame oil, 15 mL soy sauce, and 10 g sugar.
Pour dressing over cucumber and onion. Toss to coat.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with 5 g toasted sesame seeds.
description: A refreshingly crisp salad featuring thin slices of cucumber and onion, dressed in a light Asian-inspired vinaigrette, perfect for a summer side dish.

name: Almond Spice Cookies
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream together 100 g butter and 150 g sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in 1 egg and 5 mL almond extract.
In another bowl, whisk together 200 g flour, 5 g baking powder, 5 g cinnamon, and 1 g nutmeg.
Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the wet until a dough forms.
Roll into balls, place on a baking sheet, and flatten slightly.
Bake for 12 minutes or until edges are golden. Cool on a wire rack.
description: These aromatic cookies are a delightful treat, infused with the warm flavors of spices and almond, perfect for pairing with tea or coffee.

name: Avocado and Strawberry Spinach Salad
author: System
method: In a large salad bowl, combine 200 g fresh spinach, 1 sliced avocado, 150 g halved strawberries, and 50 g sliced almonds.
In a small bowl, whisk together 30 mL balsamic vinegar, 15 mL honey, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.
description: The perfect blend of sweet and savory, this salad features ripe strawberries, creamy avocado, and crunchy almonds atop fresh spinach, dressed with a honey-balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Anise Flavored Mushroom Risotto
author: System
method: In a large pan, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic, sauté until soft.
Add 300 g sliced mushrooms and cook until browned. Stir in 5 mL anise extract and cook for 1 minute.
Add 400 g arborio rice, stir to coat with oil. Gradually add 1.2 L chicken broth, stirring constantly, until the rice is al dente and creamy.
Stir in 50 g grated Parmesan cheese and 15 g butter. Season with salt and pepper, and serve garnished with chopped parsley.
description: This risotto takes a unique twist with the addition of anise, enhancing the earthy flavors of mushrooms with a hint of licorice, creating a complex and creamy dish.

name: Alfredo Zucchini Noodles
author: System
method: Spiralize 4 large zucchinis into noodles and set aside.
In a pan, melt 30 g butter and sauté 1 minced garlic clove until fragrant.
Add 240 mL heavy cream and 100 g grated Parmesan cheese, whisking until melted and smooth.
Toss zucchini noodles in the Alfredo sauce and heat through for about 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with more Parmesan and chopped parsley.
description: Light yet indulgent, these zucchini noodles are coated in a creamy Alfredo sauce for a low-carb alternative to traditional pasta dishes.

name: Asian Spiced Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg pork ribs with a mixture of 30 g brown sugar, 5 g Chinese five-spice, and salt and pepper.
Place in a roasting pan, cover with foil, and bake at 150°C (300°F) for 3 hours.
Uncover, brush with 120 mL hoisin sauce, and grill for 10 minutes until caramelized.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
description: Fall-off-the-bone pork ribs coated in a sweet and spicy Asian-inspired sauce, finished with a crisp caramelized glaze.

name: Avocado Quinoa Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g quinoa according to package instructions. Fluff and cool.
In a large bowl, mix quinoa with 2 diced avocados, 100 g cherry tomatoes halved, and 50 g crumbled feta cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL lemon juice, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over salad.
Toss everything together and garnish with 15 g chopped cilantro.
description: A hearty and healthy salad packed with the nutty flavors of quinoa, creamy avocado, and the bright freshness of lemon dressing.

name: Apple Spiced Pork Loin
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Season 1 kg pork loin with a mix of 5 g salt, 5 g pepper, 5 g cinnamon, and 1 g nutmeg.
In a skillet, brown the pork on all sides in 30 mL olive oil.
Transfer to a roasting pan, surround with 2 sliced apples and 200 mL apple cider. Roast for 1 hour.
Let rest before slicing. Serve with pan juices.
description: Juicy pork loin roasted with apples and autumn spices, creating a comforting dish perfect for a festive dinner.

name: Artichoke and Spinach Dip
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
In a bowl, combine 240 g chopped canned artichoke hearts, 150 g frozen spinach (thawed and drained), 120 g cream cheese, 60 g sour cream, and 60 g mayonnaise.
Mix in 100 g grated Parmesan and 1 clove minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with more Parmesan, and bake for 25 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Serve hot with toasted baguette slices.
description: A creamy, cheesy dip that combines artichokes and spinach with a rich Parmesan topping, ideal for parties or as a satisfying appetizer.

name: Anchovy and Garlic Pizza
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F). Roll out 200 g pizza dough and place on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread 60 mL tomato sauce over the dough. Top with 50 g anchovies, 2 sliced garlic cloves, and 100 g mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with red pepper flakes and fresh basil leaves before serving.
description: This pizza combines the bold flavors of anchovies and garlic on a classic mozzarella and tomato base, spiced up with red pepper flakes.

name: Apple Cider Braised Chicken Thighs
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown 8 chicken thighs on both sides.
Remove chicken and set aside. Add 1 sliced onion and 2 cloves garlic to the skillet; sauté until soft.
Deglaze the pan with 240 mL apple cider and add 5 g thyme. Return chicken to the pan.
Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chicken garnished with fresh parsley.
description: Tender chicken thighs slowly braised in apple cider with thyme, creating a deliciously rich and comforting dish.

name: Almond Mocha Smoothie
author: System
method: Blend 1 frozen banana, 30 g almond butter, 120 mL cold coffee, 120 mL almond milk, and 15 g cocoa powder until smooth.
Serve immediately, topped with a sprinkle of chocolate shavings and a few whole almonds for crunch.
description: A refreshing and energizing smoothie that blends the rich flavors of coffee and chocolate with creamy almond butter.

name: Apricot Stuffed Pork Tenderloin
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Butterfly 1 kg pork tenderloin. Spread 100 g softened apricot preserves inside and sprinkle with 5 g thyme.
Roll up the tenderloin and tie with kitchen string. Season the outside with salt and pepper.
Sear all sides in a hot skillet with 15 mL olive oil, then roast in the oven for 25 minutes.
Let rest before slicing. Serve with a drizzle of the pan juices.
description: Elegant and flavorful, this pork tenderloin is stuffed with sweet apricot preserves and aromatic thyme, making it a perfect centerpiece for a special meal.

name: Asiago Cheese Bread
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
In a large bowl, combine 500 g bread flour, 5 g yeast, 5 g sugar, and 5 g salt.
Add 300 mL warm water and knead until a smooth dough forms. Let rise for 1 hour.
Fold in 100 g grated Asiago cheese and form into a loaf. Let rise for another 30 minutes.
Bake for 35 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack.
description: Homemade bread enriched with the nutty flavor of Asiago cheese, perfect for a decadent side to any meal or simply enjoyed with butter.

name: Apple Ginger Chutney
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 3 diced apples, 50 g minced ginger, 1 diced red onion, 100 g brown sugar, and 120 mL apple cider vinegar.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 40 minutes, until thickened.
Cool completely before serving. Can be stored in airtight containers in the refrigerator.
description: A tangy and sweet chutney that pairs perfectly with cheeses, meats, or as a unique sandwich spread.

name: Almond Crusted Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a bowl, mix 100 g crushed almonds, 50 g breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
Dip each of 4 cod fillets in beaten egg, then in the almond mixture.
Place on a greased baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
description: Delicate cod fillets with a crispy almond crust, providing a nutty texture and flavor that enhances the mild fish.

name: Avocado Banana Smoothie
author: System
method: Blend 1 ripe avocado, 2 peeled bananas, 240 mL milk, and 15 mL honey until smooth.
Serve immediately, topped with a sprinkle of chia seeds for extra texture and nutrients.
description: A creamy and nutritious smoothie combining avocado and banana, sweetened naturally with honey, perfect for a quick breakfast or a refreshing snack.

name: Aubergine Parmesan
author: System
method: Slice 2 large aubergines into 1 cm thick rounds. Salt lightly and set aside for 30 minutes. Rinse and pat dry.
Dip aubergine slices in flour, then beaten eggs, and finally in a mixture of 100 g breadcrumbs and 50 g grated Parmesan.
Fry in batches in 120 mL olive oil until golden on each side. Drain on paper towels.
Layer aubergine with 240 mL marinara sauce and 100 g sliced mozzarella in a baking dish. Repeat layers.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30 minutes. Serve hot.
description: Layers of crispy aubergine, rich tomato sauce, and gooey mozzarella cheese make up this classic Italian favorite.

name: Asparagus Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic, sauté until translucent.
Add 500 g chopped asparagus and cook for 5 minutes. Pour in 1 L vegetable broth and simmer for 15 minutes.
Puree the soup with an immersion blender until smooth. Stir in 120 mL cream, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with crumbled feta and chopped dill.
description: A creamy, smooth soup made from fresh asparagus, enriched with a touch of cream and topped with feta for added flavor.

name: Apple Cinnamon French Toast
author: System
method: In a bowl, whisk together 2 eggs, 120 mL milk, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Dip 8 slices of brioche bread in the egg mixture, coating both sides.
Cook on a buttered skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Top with sautéed apples (2 apples, sliced and cooked with 15 g butter and 30 g brown sugar) and a drizzle of maple syrup.
description: Rich and custardy French toast spiced with cinnamon and topped with caramelized apples, perfect for a decadent breakfast or brunch.

name: Avocado Chickpea Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 1 drained can of chickpeas, 2 diced avocados, 1 diced red bell pepper, and 100 g crumbled feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together 30 mL lemon juice, 30 mL olive oil, and 1 tsp dried oregano. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine. Chill before serving.
description: A hearty and healthy salad featuring creamy avocados, protein-rich chickpeas, and vibrant bell peppers, dressed in a zesty lemon vinaigrette.

name: Almond and Pear Clafoutis
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Butter a tart dish.
Arrange 3 sliced pears in the dish. Sprinkle with 50 g sliced almonds.
Whisk together 3 eggs, 120 mL milk, 50 g flour, 50 g sugar, and 1 tsp almond extract. Pour over the pears.
Bake for 35 minutes until set and golden. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: A rustic French dessert, this clafoutis combines soft pears and crunchy almonds in a sweet custard, ideal for a light dessert or brunch dish.

name: Apricot Chicken Curry
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Brown 500 g cubed chicken breast.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp curry powder, cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in 200 g chopped dried apricots and 300 mL coconut milk. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and garnish with chopped cilantro.
description: A unique curry that melds the sweetness of apricots with the savory depth of curry spices, creating a creamy, comforting dish.

name: Artichoke and Olive Tapas
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil and sauté 200 g drained canned artichoke hearts until golden.
Add 100 g sliced green olives and 2 cloves of minced garlic, cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and a sprinkle of dried parsley. Serve warm with crusty bread.
description: A simple yet flavorful tapas dish featuring sautéed artichokes and olives, perfect for an appetizer or a small plate in a Mediterranean meal.

name: Asparagus and Prosciutto Bundles
author: System
method: Blanch 16 asparagus spears in boiling water for 2 minutes, then shock in ice water.
Wrap each bundle of 4 spears with 1 slice of prosciutto. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Grill on medium heat for 5 minutes, turning once, until the prosciutto is crispy.
Serve with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese.
description: Crispy prosciutto wraps around tender asparagus spears, creating a perfect blend of flavors and textures for an elegant side dish or appetizer.

name: Apple and Walnut Stuffed Pork Chops
author: System
method: Make a deep slit in each of 4 pork chops to create a pocket. Season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Mix 1 diced apple, 50 g chopped walnuts, 30 g breadcrumbs, and a pinch of sage. Stuff the mixture into the pork chops.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Brown the pork chops on both sides.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake at 175°C (350°F) for 25 minutes or until cooked through.
description: Juicy pork chops filled with a sweet and nutty stuffing of apples and walnuts, baked to perfection for a comforting meal.

name: Avocado and Mango Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 2 diced avocados, 1 diced mango, 100 g mixed greens, and 50 g sliced red onion.
Whisk together 30 mL lime juice, 30 mL olive oil, 1 tsp honey, and salt and pepper to taste.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
description: A refreshing salad bursting with the tropical flavors of mango and creamy avocado, tossed in a sweet lime dressing.

name: Anchovy Butter Grilled Steak
author: System
method: Prepare anchovy butter by mixing 100 g softened butter with 5 minced anchovies, 1 clove garlic, and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Season 4 steaks (each 200 g) with salt and pepper. Grill to desired doneness.
Top each steak with a dollop of anchovy butter just before serving.
description: Steak grilled to perfection, enhanced with a savory anchovy butter that melts into a rich, flavor-packed sauce.

name: Almond Gazpacho
author: System
method: Soak 100 g blanched almonds in water for 2 hours, then drain.
Blend almonds with 1 chopped cucumber, 1 chopped green bell pepper, 1 clove garlic, 120 mL water, and 30 mL sherry vinegar until smooth.
Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve cold, garnished with grape halves and a drizzle of olive oil.
description: A refreshing and nutty twist on traditional gazpacho, this cold soup is made with almonds and fresh vegetables, perfect for hot days.

name: Arugula and Peach Salad
author: System
method: In a large salad bowl, combine 150 g arugula, 2 sliced peaches, and 50 g crumbled goat cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL balsamic vinegar, 15 mL honey, and 30 mL olive oil.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad, toss to combine, and top with 30 g toasted pine nuts.
description: A vibrant salad featuring peppery arugula, sweet peaches, and creamy goat cheese, all brought together with a honey-balsamic dressing.

name: Apricot and Pistachio Biscotti
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
In a bowl, mix 250 g flour, 150 g sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Stir in 2 beaten eggs, 100 g chopped dried apricots, and 50 g chopped pistachios.
Form the dough into a log, place on a baking sheet, and bake for 30 minutes. Slice and bake again for 10 minutes.
description: Crunchy biscotti loaded with sweet apricots and nutty pistachios, perfect for dipping in your morning coffee or as a sweet snack.

name: Aloo Gobi Masala
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic, cook until golden. Stir in 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp coriander, and 1 tsp cumin powder.
Add 300 g diced potatoes and 300 g chopped cauliflower. Cook covered over low heat for 20 minutes.
Stir occasionally, adding water if it starts to stick. Season with salt and garnish with chopped cilantro.
description: A classic Indian dish featuring potatoes and cauliflower robustly flavored with turmeric, coriander, and cumin, serving as a hearty vegetarian main or side.

name: Asian Pear and Watercress Salad
author: System
method: In a salad bowl, combine 2 thinly sliced Asian pears, 150 g watercress, and 50 g thinly sliced red onions.
Whisk together 30 mL rice vinegar, 15 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, and 10 g sugar for the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and top with 30 g toasted sesame seeds just before serving.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad with sweet Asian pears and peppery watercress, dressed in a tangy sesame vinaigrette.

name: Avocado Toast with Radish
author: System
method: Toast 4 slices of whole grain bread until golden and crisp.
Mash 2 ripe avocados with a fork and season with salt and a squeeze of lime juice.
Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.
Top each slice with thinly sliced radishes, a sprinkle of chili flakes, and a few drops of olive oil before serving.
description: Creamy avocado spread on crispy toast, topped with crisp radishes for a peppery bite, perfect for a quick and healthy breakfast or snack.

name: Apple Mustard Glazed Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Place in a baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix 60 mL apple cider vinegar, 30 mL Dijon mustard, and 30 g brown sugar. Pour over chicken.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, basting halfway through, until chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Juicy chicken breasts baked with a tangy apple mustard glaze, providing a delightful balance of sweet and sharp flavors.

name: Almond Butter Chicken Satay
author: System
method: Cut 500 g chicken breast into strips. Marinate for 1 hour in a mixture of 60 mL soy sauce, 30 mL lime juice, and 15 g curry powder.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Thread chicken onto skewers.
Grill chicken for 5-7 minutes on each side until cooked through.
Serve with a sauce made by blending 100 g almond butter, 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL honey, and 60 mL warm water.
description: Grilled chicken satay skewers served with a creamy almond butter sauce, blending the nutty richness of almond with classic satay spices.

name: Asian Style Beef Noodles
author: System
method: Cook 400 g noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
In a wok, heat 15 mL sesame oil. Stir-fry 300 g sliced beef until browned.
Add 100 g sliced bell peppers and 50 g shredded carrots; stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Mix in noodles, 30 mL soy sauce, and 30 mL oyster sauce; cook for another 2 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
description: Hearty noodles tossed with tender beef and crisp vegetables in a savory soy and oyster sauce, topped with sesame seeds for a touch of crunch.

name: Apricot and Almond Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Roll out 200 g puff pastry and place in a tart pan.
Spread 100 g almond cream over the pastry. Top with 200 g sliced apricots.
Bake for 30 minutes until the pastry is golden and filling is set.
Brush with 30 mL apricot jam for a glossy finish. Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A beautiful tart with a buttery crust, filled with lush almond cream and topped with sweet apricots, perfect for a light dessert or afternoon tea.

name: Anise Panna Cotta
author: System
method: In a saucepan, dissolve 15 g gelatin in 60 mL cold water and let bloom for 5 minutes.
Add 500 mL heavy cream, 100 g sugar, and 5 mL anise extract; heat gently until hot but not boiling.
Pour into molds and chill for at least 4 hours until set.
Serve with a compote of mixed berries.
description: A silky smooth panna cotta flavored with anise for a hint of licorice, complemented by a sweet and tangy berry compote.

name: Avocado Cilantro Lime Rice
author: System
method: Cook 300 g rice according to package instructions.
In a blender, combine 1 ripe avocado, 30 mL lime juice, 30 mL olive oil, and 30 g fresh cilantro until smooth.
Mix the avocado blend into the cooked rice. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve warm, garnished with extra cilantro leaves and lime wedges.
description: Fluffy rice enriched with a creamy avocado sauce, tangy lime, and aromatic cilantro, making for a refreshing side dish or light main course.

name: Artichoke Frittata
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
In a skillet, sauté 1 diced onion and 2 cloves garlic in 15 mL olive oil until translucent.
Add 200 g canned artichoke hearts (drained and chopped) and cook for 5 minutes.
Whisk together 6 eggs, 60 mL milk, salt, and pepper. Pour over artichokes.
Cook for a few minutes until the edges start to set. Transfer to oven and bake for 20 minutes or until set.
description: A hearty frittata filled with artichokes, onion, and garlic, baked to perfection. Ideal for any meal of the day.

name: Asparagus Lemon Risotto
author: System
method: In a large pan, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped shallot and 1 clove garlic, cook until soft.
Add 350 g arborio rice, stir until glossy. Pour in 150 mL white wine, simmer until absorbed.
Add 1 L vegetable broth gradually, stirring continuously, until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in 200 g chopped asparagus, zest of 1 lemon, and 50 g Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
description: Creamy risotto with tender asparagus and a fresh burst of lemon, topped with Parmesan cheese for a luxurious finish.

name: Ancho Chili Chocolate Cake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease and flour a 9-inch cake pan.
Mix 200 g all-purpose flour, 200 g sugar, 50 g cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp ancho chili powder, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, whisk together 2 eggs, 240 mL milk, 120 mL vegetable oil, and 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Combine wet and dry ingredients and pour into the cake pan.
Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool and frost with chocolate ganache.
description: A rich chocolate cake with a hint of ancho chili to add a subtle warmth and depth, frosted with a smooth chocolate ganache for a decadent treat.

name: Apple and Brie Crostini
author: System
method: Slice a baguette into 16 rounds, brush with olive oil, and toast under the broiler until golden.
Top each slice with a piece of Brie cheese and a few thin slices of apple.
Broil again until the cheese is melted. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with thyme leaves before serving.
description: Crisp baguette slices topped with creamy Brie and crisp apple slices, a delightful combination of flavors enhanced by a hint of honey and thyme.

name: Aromatic Basil Pesto Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g pasta according to package instructions. Drain, reserving 100 mL of pasta water.
Blend 50 g fresh basil, 50 g Parmesan cheese, 50 g pine nuts, 2 cloves garlic, 120 mL olive oil, and salt until smooth.
Toss pasta with pesto and enough reserved water to reach desired consistency.
Serve with additional grated Parmesan and fresh basil leaves.
description: Fresh and vibrant basil pesto tossed with al dente pasta, a simple yet flavorful dish that's perfect for a quick dinner or entertaining guests.

name: Avocado and Tomato Bruschetta
author: System
method: Toast 8 slices of ciabatta bread until golden and crisp.
In a bowl, combine 2 diced avocados, 2 diced tomatoes, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper.
Spoon the mixture onto the toasted bread, drizzle with a bit more balsamic vinegar, and sprinkle with chopped basil before serving.
description: A refreshing twist on traditional bruschetta, featuring ripe avocados and juicy tomatoes atop crisp ciabatta, finished with a balsamic glaze.

name: Apricot Glazed Turkey Meatballs
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
In a bowl, mix 500 g ground turkey, 1 minced onion, 1 beaten egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, salt, and pepper.
Form into 16 meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes. In a saucepan, heat 120 mL apricot preserves with 30 mL soy sauce until bubbly.
Glaze meatballs with the apricot sauce and return to oven for 5 minutes to set the glaze.
description: Juicy turkey meatballs with a sweet and tangy apricot glaze, perfect as a party appetizer or served over rice for a satisfying meal.

name: Almond Flour Pancakes
author: System
method: In a bowl, whisk together 200 g almond flour, 5 g baking powder, 1 g salt, 2 beaten eggs, 120 mL milk, and 30 mL vegetable oil until smooth.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown on the other side.
Serve with maple syrup and fresh berries.
description: Fluffy and light almond flour pancakes, a gluten-free alternative to traditional pancakes, perfect for a healthy breakfast.

name: Avocado Lime Cheesecake
author: System
method: Blend 200 g digestive biscuit crumbs with 100 g melted butter. Press into the bottom of a springform pan and chill.
Puree 3 ripe avocados with 300 g cream cheese, 100 g sugar, juice of 2 limes, and 5 g gelatin dissolved in 30 mL warm water.
Pour the mixture over the crust and chill for at least 4 hours or until set.
Top with whipped cream and lime zest before serving.
description: A creamy and tangy cheesecake that blends the rich texture of avocado with the sharp zest of lime, set atop a buttery biscuit base.

name: Asian Shrimp and Snow Pea Stir Fry
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL sesame oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 400 g shrimp (peeled and deveined) and stir-fry for 2 minutes until pink.
Add 200 g snow peas and 1 sliced bell pepper; stir-fry for an additional 3 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL soy sauce and 30 mL oyster sauce; cook for 1 minute more.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
description: Quick and easy shrimp stir-fried with crisp snow peas and bell peppers in a savory sauce, ideal for a nutritious weeknight dinner.

name: Apple Pecan Arugula Salad
author: System
method: In a large salad bowl, combine 150 g arugula, 2 diced apples, and 50 g toasted pecans.
Whisk together 30 mL apple cider vinegar, 15 mL honey, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently. Serve immediately, topped with shaved Parmesan cheese.
description: A fresh and lively salad featuring peppery arugula, crisp apples, and nutty pecans, all tossed in a sweet and tangy dressing.

name: Banana Blueberry Smoothie
author: System
method: Blend 2 ripe bananas, 150 g fresh blueberries, 240 mL almond milk, and 15 mL honey until smooth.
Serve immediately, topped with a few whole blueberries and a sprinkle of chia seeds.
description: A smooth and creamy drink packed with the natural sweetness of bananas and blueberries, enriched with the nutty flavor of almond milk.

name: BBQ Chicken Pizza
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F). Roll out 200 g pizza dough and place on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread 120 mL barbecue sauce over the dough. Top with 200 g cooked, shredded chicken, 1 sliced red onion, and 100 g mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.
description: A deliciously hearty pizza topped with smoky barbecue chicken, sharp red onion, and gooey mozzarella, perfect for a casual dinner or gathering.

name: Beef Bourguignon
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg cubed beef brisket in 30 mL olive oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, cook 200 g sliced mushrooms, 200 g pearl onions, and 100 g diced bacon until onions are translucent.
Return beef to the pot. Add 750 mL red wine and enough beef broth to cover, bring to a simmer.
Add 1 bouquet garni, cover, and simmer for 2 hours.
Thicken the sauce with a beurre manié if desired. Adjust seasoning and serve.
description: A classic French stew made with tender beef, red wine, mushrooms, and pearl onions, enriched with the flavors of bacon and herbs.

name: Blueberry Muffins
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Mix 250 g all-purpose flour, 100 g sugar, 5 g baking powder, and 1 g salt in a large bowl.
In another bowl, whisk together 1 egg, 120 mL milk, and 90 mL vegetable oil. Gently fold in 150 g fresh blueberries.
Divide batter among muffin cups and bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
description: Soft and fluffy muffins bursting with juicy blueberries, perfect for a quick breakfast or an afternoon snack.

name: Basil Pesto Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Spread 30 mL homemade basil pesto under the skin of 4 chicken breasts.
Place chicken in a baking dish, season with salt and pepper, and drizzle with 15 mL olive oil.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with extra pesto on the side.
description: Juicy oven-baked chicken breasts enhanced with the fresh flavors of basil pesto, a simple yet elegant dish suitable for any day of the week.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
author: System
method: Peel and cube 1 kg butternut squash. Sauté in a pot with 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic in 30 mL olive oil until onion is translucent.
Add 1 L vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes until squash is tender.
Puree the mixture with an immersion blender until smooth. Stir in 120 mL cream, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream and a sprinkle of smoked paprika.
description: A creamy, comforting soup made with sweet butternut squash and a hint of garlic, perfect for warming up on a chilly day.

name: Broccoli Cheddar Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Roll out 200 g pie crust and fit into a 9-inch pie plate. Prick bottom with a fork.
Blanch 200 g chopped broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, drain.
Whisk together 3 eggs, 180 mL milk, 100 g grated cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper. Stir in broccoli.
Pour into crust and bake for 35 minutes, or until set. Let cool before serving.
description: A savory quiche filled with tender broccoli and rich cheddar cheese, encased in a buttery crust, ideal for brunch or a light dinner.

name: Baked Brie with Honey and Almonds
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Place a 200 g wheel of Brie in a small baking dish. Top with 30 mL honey and 30 g sliced almonds.
Bake for 10 minutes, or until the cheese is slightly melted and the honey is bubbly.
Serve warm with crackers or sliced baguette.
description: Creamy Brie cheese baked until gooey, drizzled with honey and sprinkled with almonds, creating a luxurious and simple appetizer.

name: Beetroot and Goat Cheese Salad
author: System
method: Roast 400 g peeled and diced beetroot at 200°C (392°F) for 30 minutes, or until tender.
Allow to cool, then mix with 150 g mixed salad greens, 100 g crumbled goat cheese, and 50 g walnuts.
Whisk together 30 mL balsamic vinegar, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over the salad and toss to coat.
description: A vibrant salad featuring earthy beetroots, creamy goat cheese, and crunchy walnuts, dressed with a classic balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Buffalo Chicken Wrap
author: System
method: Cook 500 g chicken breast strips in a skillet until no longer pink. Toss with 60 mL buffalo sauce.
Lay out 4 flour tortillas, and distribute the chicken evenly among them.
Top with 100 g shredded lettuce, 50 g diced tomatoes, and 50 g blue cheese crumbles.
Roll up the tortillas tightly, slice in half, and serve.
description: Spicy buffalo chicken paired with crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes, and pungent blue cheese, all wrapped in a soft flour tortilla for a quick and tasty meal.

name: Basil and Tomato Focaccia
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Mix 500 g bread flour, 300 mL warm water, 10 g yeast, 5 g sugar, and 5 g salt to form a dough. Let rise for 1 hour.
Press dough into an oiled baking sheet. Top with 200 g sliced tomatoes, 30 g fresh basil leaves, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Bake for 20 minutes, until golden and puffed. Sprinkle with sea salt before serving.
description: Aromatic focaccia bread topped with fresh tomatoes and basil, drizzled with olive oil and baked until crisp and fluffy.

name: Broiled Branzino with Herbs
author: System
method: Preheat the broiler. Clean and pat dry 4 branzino fish.
Inside each cavity, place a mixture of fresh herbs (basil, parsley, thyme), sliced lemon, and a clove of garlic.
Brush the fish with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and broil for 10 minutes, flipping once.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional lemon slices and fresh herbs.
description: Elegant whole branzino, broiled to perfection with a fragrant herb stuffing, offering a light and healthy main dish.

name: Balsamic Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: Peel and slice 500 g carrots into sticks.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add carrots and sauté until beginning to soften.
Add 30 mL balsamic vinegar and 15 g brown sugar. Cook until carrots are tender and glazed.
Season with salt and sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.
description: Sweet and tangy carrots glazed with balsamic vinegar, a perfect side dish that pairs well with any main course.

name: Bacon Wrapped Dates
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Pit 20 dates and stuff each with an almond. Wrap each date with a half slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Arrange on a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes, or until the bacon is crisp.
Serve warm as an appetizer.
description: Savory bacon wraps sweet, almond-stuffed dates, creating a delightful combination of flavors and textures, perfect for parties.

name: Butternut Squash and Sage Risotto
author: System
method: Peel and cube 500 g butternut squash, roast in the oven at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes.
In a saucepan, sauté 1 chopped onion in 30 mL olive oil until translucent. Add 350 g arborio rice, stir until glossy.
Gradually add 1 L hot vegetable broth, stirring continuously, until rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in roasted squash, 50 g grated Parmesan, and 10 g chopped fresh sage. Season with salt and pepper.
description: Creamy risotto with sweet roasted butternut squash and fragrant sage, a comforting dish that's perfect for a cozy dinner.

name: Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry
author: System
method: Slice 500 g beef sirloin into thin strips. Marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, and 1 minced garlic clove for 30 minutes.
In a wok, heat 15 mL vegetable oil over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry until browned.
Add 300 g broccoli florets and stir-fry for an additional 5 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL oyster sauce and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve over steamed rice.
description: Tender beef strips and fresh broccoli florets tossed in a savory sauce, this classic stir fry is quick and full of flavor.

name: Black Bean Veggie Burgers
author: System
method: Mash 400 g drained black beans in a bowl until mostly smooth.
Stir in 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 grated carrot, 1 minced onion, and 1 beaten egg. Season with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp cumin.
Form into 4 patties and chill for 30 minutes to firm up.
Fry patties in 15 mL olive oil over medium heat for 5 minutes each side or until crisp.
Serve on burger buns with lettuce, tomato, and avocado.
description: Hearty and flavorful veggie burgers made from black beans and a blend of veggies, spiced up with cumin for a perfect meat-free meal.

name: Banana Nut Bread
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Grease and flour a loaf pan.
In a bowl, cream together 100 g butter and 200 g sugar. Beat in 2 eggs and 4 mashed bananas.
Mix in 250 g flour, 5 g baking soda, and 1 g salt. Fold in 100 g chopped walnuts.
Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
description: Moist and flavorful banana bread studded with crunchy walnuts, a comforting and satisfying treat for all occasions.

name: Baked Cod with Lemon Butter
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F). Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish.
In a saucepan, melt 50 g butter with the juice of 1 lemon, 1 clove garlic minced, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Pour the lemon butter over the cod. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with steamed asparagus.
description: Delicate cod fillets baked with a rich lemon butter sauce, a simple yet elegant dish that's perfect for a healthy dinner.

name: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
author: System
method: Trim and halve 500 g Brussels sprouts.
In a skillet, cook 100 g chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the same skillet, add Brussels sprouts and sauté in bacon fat over medium heat until golden, about 8 minutes.
Stir in the cooked bacon, season with salt and pepper, and serve warm.
description: Crispy bacon and caramelized Brussels sprouts combine for a savory side dish that pairs perfectly with any main course.

name: Buttermilk Fried Chicken
author: System
method: Soak 8 chicken thighs in 500 mL buttermilk mixed with 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt, and pepper for at least 4 hours.
Dredge chicken in 200 g flour mixed with 1 tsp baking powder.
Fry in 500 mL vegetable oil at 175°C (350°F) until golden and cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
description: Juicy, tender chicken coated in a crispy, flavorful breading, deep-fried to golden perfection—a comfort food classic.

name: Banana Cream Pie
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Prepare 1 pie crust in a 9-inch pie plate.
Slice 3 ripe bananas and layer in the crust. Prepare custard with 500 mL milk, 100 g sugar, 3 egg yolks, and 5 g vanilla extract. Pour over bananas.
Bake for 30 minutes. Cool and top with whipped cream before serving.
description: A luscious pie filled with layers of bananas and smooth vanilla custard, topped with fluffy whipped cream—a delightful treat.

name: Beef Stroganoff
author: System
method: Slice 500 g beef tenderloin into thin strips. Brown in a skillet with 15 mL vegetable oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 1 sliced onion and 200 g sliced mushrooms. Cook until tender.
Return beef to skillet. Stir in 240 mL sour cream and 30 mL Dijon mustard. Heat through but do not boil.
Serve over cooked egg noodles, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Tender strips of beef and mushrooms in a rich and creamy sauce, served over noodles for a classic, comforting meal.

name: Bacon and Egg Breakfast Tacos
author: System
method: Cook 8 slices of bacon until crisp. Drain and chop.
Scramble 6 eggs with 30 mL milk, salt, and pepper.
Warm 4 corn tortillas. Divide scrambled eggs and bacon among tortillas.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese and salsa before serving.
description: A fun and tasty twist on classic breakfast ingredients, wrapped in a soft tortilla for a delicious start to the day.

name: Blue Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
author: System
method: Remove stems from 16 large button mushrooms. Chop stems and sauté with 1 minced garlic clove in 15 mL olive oil.
Mix sautéed stems with 100 g crumbled blue cheese, 30 g breadcrumbs, and salt and pepper.
Stuff mushroom caps with the mixture. Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 15 minutes.
Garnish with chopped chives before serving.
description: Savory mushrooms filled with a rich and tangy blue cheese stuffing, baked to perfection for a delightful appetizer or side.

name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, melt 30 g butter. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, sauté until translucent.
Add 500 g chopped broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. Pour in 750 mL vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 10 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth. Return to pot, stir in 240 mL cream and 100 g grated cheddar cheese until melted and smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with extra cheese.
description: A creamy and comforting soup packed with broccoli and enhanced with cheesy goodness, perfect for a chilly day.

name: Blackened Salmon
author: System
method: Mix 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp thyme, 1 tsp oregano, salt, and pepper to create the blackening spice.
Generously coat 4 salmon fillets with the spice mixture.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over high heat. Add salmon and cook for 3 minutes per side.
Serve immediately, with lemon wedges and a side of steamed vegetables.
description: Spicy and flavorful blackened salmon, seared to perfection, offers a smoky crust with tender, juicy meat inside.

name: Basil Tomato Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 2 cloves minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add 400 g chopped tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in 30 g chopped fresh basil, salt, and pepper.
Toss the pasta with the tomato sauce. Serve garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A quick and easy dish featuring al dente pasta tossed with a fresh tomato basil sauce, topped with Parmesan.

name: Beet and Feta Salad
author: System
method: Roast 4 medium beets at 200°C (392°F) until tender, about 1 hour. Peel and slice.
Arrange beets on a platter with 200 g mixed greens. Crumble 100 g feta cheese over the top.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL vinegar, salt, and pepper. Drizzle over the salad.
Garnish with 20 g toasted walnuts and serve.
description: A vibrant salad with earthy beets, sharp feta cheese, and crunchy walnuts, dressed in a simple vinaigrette—perfect for a healthy lunch.

name: Buffalo Cauliflower Bites
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F).
Cut 1 large head of cauliflower into florets. Toss with 30 mL olive oil and bake for 20 minutes.
Mix 60 mL hot sauce with 15 mL melted butter. Toss baked cauliflower in the sauce.
Return to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes. Serve with blue cheese dressing.
description: Spicy and tangy buffalo sauce coats crispy cauliflower bites, creating a vegetarian alternative to classic buffalo wings.

name: Baked Garlic Parmesan Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Mix 50 g grated Parmesan cheese, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Brush 4 chicken breasts with 30 mL melted butter. Dredge in the Parmesan mixture.
Place on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with a lemon wedge.
description: Juicy chicken breasts coated with a crispy garlic Parmesan crust, baked to golden perfection—a family favorite.

name: Balsamic Roasted Brussel Sprouts
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Halve 500 g Brussels sprouts and toss with 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes.
Drizzle with 30 mL balsamic glaze and roast for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve warm, topped with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese.
description: Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, these Brussels sprouts are elevated with a sweet balsamic glaze and a touch of Parmesan.

name: Baked Ziti with Ricotta
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Cook 500 g ziti pasta according to package instructions; drain.
Mix pasta with 500 mL marinara sauce, 250 g ricotta cheese, and 100 g shredded mozzarella.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with more mozzarella, and bake for 25 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
description: Creamy ricotta and mozzarella blend smoothly with ziti pasta and tangy marinara, baked to a perfect golden finish.

name: Butter Pecan Ice Cream
author: System
method: Toast 100 g chopped pecans in a dry skillet over medium heat until fragrant; set aside.
Combine 500 mL heavy cream, 250 mL whole milk, 150 g sugar, and 1 tsp vanilla extract in a saucepan. Heat until sugar dissolves.
Chill the mixture thoroughly, then churn in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions.
During the last few minutes of churning, add toasted pecans. Freeze until firm.
description: Rich buttery ice cream loaded with toasted pecans, a luxurious treat that's both creamy and crunchy.

name: Beef Chili
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg ground beef; drain fat.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 diced bell peppers, and 3 minced garlic cloves. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Stir in 800 g canned diced tomatoes, 400 g canned kidney beans (drained), 1 L beef broth, 30 g chili powder, and 1 tsp cumin.
Simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, topped with shredded cheddar cheese and sour cream.
description: A hearty and spicy beef chili, loaded with beans and vegetables, simmered to perfection, ideal for warming up on a cold day.

name: Bacon and Leek Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Saute 200 g chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and add 1 chopped leek to bacon fat; cook until tender.
In a bowl, whisk together 4 eggs, 240 mL cream, cooked bacon, sauteed leek, salt, and pepper.
Pour into a prepared pie crust and bake for 35 minutes or until set.
Allow to cool slightly before slicing. Serve warm.
description: A savory quiche with crispy bacon and sweet leeks nestled in a creamy egg filling, encased in a flaky pastry crust.

name: Blueberry Oat Bars
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
Mix 200 g rolled oats, 100 g flour, 100 g brown sugar, and 100 g melted butter to form a crumbly mixture.
Press half the oat mixture into a greased baking pan. Spread 200 g blueberry preserves on top.
Crumble remaining oat mixture over the preserves. Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.
description: Sweet and tangy blueberry preserves sandwiched between layers of crumbly oat mixture, perfect for a snack or dessert.

name: Banana Foster French Toast
author: System
method: In a shallow dish, whisk together 3 eggs, 180 mL milk, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Dip 8 slices of brioche bread in the egg mixture, coating both sides.
Cook on a buttered griddle over medium heat until golden on each side.
For the topping, sauté 4 sliced bananas in 50 g butter and 100 g brown sugar until caramelized.
Serve French toast hot, topped with caramelized bananas and a drizzle of rum sauce.
description: Decadent French toast topped with sweet caramelized bananas and a rich rum sauce, a luxurious breakfast or brunch option.

name: Braised Beef Ribs
author: System
method: Season 1 kg beef ribs with salt and pepper. Brown in a hot skillet with 15 mL olive oil.
Transfer ribs to a slow cooker. Add 250 mL red wine, 500 mL beef broth, 1 chopped onion, 3 cloves minced garlic, and 1 sprig rosemary.
Cook on low for 8 hours until the meat is tender and falls off the bone.
Serve ribs with a reduction of the cooking liquid and a side of mashed potatoes.
description: Tender, slow-cooked beef ribs braised in a rich red wine and beef broth, infused with rosemary and garlic, offering deep, robust flavors.

name: Buffalo Mozzarella Caprese
author: System
method: Slice 200 g buffalo mozzarella and 2 large ripe tomatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices.
Arrange alternating slices of mozzarella and tomato on a platter.
Drizzle with 30 mL olive oil and 15 mL balsamic vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with 10 g fresh basil leaves.
description: A classic Italian salad showcasing the simple freshness of buffalo mozzarella and ripe tomatoes, enhanced with basil and a balsamic drizzle.

name: Beet Gazpacho
author: System
method: Roast 3 peeled beets at 200°C (392°F) until tender, about 45 minutes. Cool and chop.
Blend beets with 1 chopped cucumber, 1 chopped red bell pepper, 2 cloves garlic, 500 mL vegetable broth, and 30 mL red wine vinegar until smooth.
Chill for at least 2 hours. Serve cold, garnished with diced cucumber and a dollop of sour cream.
description: A refreshing and vibrant cold soup made with roasted beets and fresh vegetables, perfect for a light summer meal or starter.

name: Blue Cheese and Pear Pizza
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F). Roll out 200 g pizza dough and place on a pizza stone.
Spread 120 mL crème fraîche over the dough. Top with 1 thinly sliced pear, 100 g crumbled blue cheese, and 50 g arugula.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and crisp.
Drizzle with 15 mL honey before serving.
description: A gourmet pizza combining the sharpness of blue cheese with the sweetness of pears, topped with arugula and a honey drizzle.

name: Bourbon Glazed Pork Chops
author: System
method: Season 4 pork chops with salt and pepper.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Brown pork chops on both sides and remove.
Add 60 mL bourbon to the skillet to deglaze, then stir in 30 mL brown sugar and 15 mL soy sauce. Return pork chops to the skillet.
Cook until the sauce is reduced and the pork is glazed and cooked through.
Serve with mashed potatoes and steamed green beans.
description: Tender pork chops enhanced with a rich bourbon glaze, a perfect combination of sweet and savory for an elegant dinner.

name: Balsamic Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Cut 500 g chicken breast into cubes. Marinate in a mixture of 60 mL balsamic vinegar, 30 mL olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove, salt, and pepper for 1 hour.
Thread chicken onto skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Serve with a side salad and grilled vegetables.
description: Juicy grilled chicken skewers marinated in a balsamic vinaigrette, perfect for a healthy and delicious barbecue meal.

name: Bacon Maple Breakfast Rolls
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Lay out 12 strips of bacon on a baking sheet. Brush with 30 mL maple syrup. Bake until crisp, about 20 minutes.
Prepare dough for rolls. Once rolled, place a strip of bacon in each roll before baking as directed.
Serve warm, drizzled with additional maple syrup.
description: Sweet and savory breakfast rolls filled with crispy maple-glazed bacon, ideal for a decadent weekend brunch.

name: Black Bean Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 3 minced garlic cloves; sauté until soft.
Stir in 800 g canned black beans (undrained), 1 L vegetable broth, and 5 g ground cumin. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Puree half the soup in a blender, then return it to the pot. Heat through.
Serve garnished with sour cream, chopped green onions, and cilantro.
description: A hearty and flavorful soup made with black beans and aromatic vegetables, spiced with cumin and topped with creamy sour cream.

name: Baked Banana Chips
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 100°C (212°F).
Slice 4 bananas into thin chips, spread on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 2 hours, flipping halfway through, until crispy.
Sprinkle lightly with sea salt before serving.
description: Crispy and healthy banana chips baked to perfection with a hint of sea salt, a perfect snack for any time of day.

name: Broiled Grapefruit with Honey
author: System
method: Preheat broiler. Halve 2 grapefruits and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Place grapefruit halves on a baking sheet, cut side up, and broil for 5 minutes.
Drizzle with honey and serve warm with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
description: Warm, caramelized grapefruit enhanced with a touch of honey and cinnamon, a delightful blend of sweet and tangy flavors.

name: Blackberry Basil Mojito
author: System
method: Muddle 100 g blackberries with 10 g fresh basil leaves and 2 tbsp sugar in a cocktail shaker.
Add 60 mL white rum and 30 mL lime juice, shake with ice.
Strain into two glasses filled with ice, top with soda water.
Garnish with basil leaves and blackberries.
description: A refreshing twist on the classic mojito, infused with the sweet tang of blackberries and aromatic basil.

name: Butternut Squash Lasagna
author: System
method: Peel and slice 1 kg butternut squash thinly. Roast slices at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes.
Layer roasted squash, 500 g ricotta, 300 g mozzarella, and 200 g cooked spinach between sheets of lasagna in a baking dish.
Pour 500 mL bechamel sauce over the top, sprinkle with 100 g Parmesan.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 40 minutes. Let rest before serving.
description: Layers of creamy ricotta, melty mozzarella, nutritious spinach, and sweet butternut squash, all encased in pasta and bechamel sauce.

name: Blue Corn Nachos
author: System
method: Spread 300 g blue corn tortilla chips on a baking tray.
Top with 200 g shredded cheddar cheese, 100 g diced tomatoes, and 50 g sliced jalapeños.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 10 minutes until cheese is melted.
Serve with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa.
description: Crispy blue corn chips layered with melted cheddar, spicy jalapeños, and fresh tomatoes, accompanied by classic dips.

name: Beef Wellington
author: System
method: Season 1 kg beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. Sear in hot skillet with 15 mL oil until browned all over.
Roll puff pastry out to size, spread with 100 g mushroom duxelles. Place beef in the center, wrap tightly.
Brush with beaten egg, bake at 200°C (392°F) for 30 minutes.
Rest before slicing. Serve with red wine sauce.
description: A luxurious dish featuring a tender seared beef tenderloin, coated in a rich mushroom duxelles and wrapped in a golden puff pastry.

name: Baked Brie with Fig Jam
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Place a 200 g wheel of Brie in a small baking dish. Top with 60 mL fig jam.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until the cheese is slightly melted.
Serve warm with crusty bread or crackers.
description: Creamy Brie topped with sweet fig jam, baked until gooey and delicious, perfect for an elegant appetizer.

name: Barbecue Pulled Pork
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg pork shoulder with a mix of brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Place in a slow cooker with 250 mL barbecue sauce and cook on low for 8 hours.
Shred the pork with two forks and stir back into the sauce.
Serve on hamburger buns with coleslaw.
description: Tender, slow-cooked pork shoulder, shredded and mixed with barbecue sauce for a savory, melt-in-your-mouth sandwich filling.

name: Butter Lettuce Salad with Avocado
author: System
method: Combine 2 heads of butter lettuce, 1 sliced avocado, and 50 g sliced radishes in a salad bowl.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, 1 tsp dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss gently.
Serve immediately, optionally topped with crumbled goat cheese.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad featuring butter lettuce, creamy avocado, and spicy radishes, dressed in a light lemon-mustard vinaigrette.

name: Banoffee Pie
author: System
method: Combine 200 g crushed digestive biscuits with 100 g melted butter and press into a pie dish to form the crust.
Spread 400 g caramel over the crust. Slice 4 bananas and arrange over the caramel.
Whip 500 mL cream with 20 g sugar until stiff peaks form. Spread over the bananas.
Chill for 2 hours. Sprinkle with grated chocolate before serving.
description: A sweet indulgence, this pie layers bananas and rich caramel on a buttery biscuit base, topped with fluffy whipped cream and chocolate.

name: Balsamic Glazed Beetroot
author: System
method: Peel and cube 4 medium beetroots. Roast at 200°C (392°F) for 30 minutes.
Simmer 60 mL balsamic vinegar and 20 g brown sugar in a saucepan until reduced by half.
Toss roasted beetroots in the balsamic reduction. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with crumbled feta and chopped parsley.
description: Earthy beetroots enhanced with a sweet and tangy balsamic glaze, topped with feta for a delicious contrast.

name: Beer Battered Fish Tacos
author: System
method: Whisk together 120 g flour, 1 tsp baking powder, salt, and pepper. Gradually add 240 mL beer, whisking until smooth.
Dip 500 g cod fillets into batter. Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Break into chunks and serve in corn tortillas with cabbage slaw and lime crema.
description: Crispy, golden fish fresh from the fryer, wrapped in soft tortillas with slaw and a zesty lime crema, a perfect quick meal.

name: Baked Blueberry Oatmeal
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
In a bowl, mix 240 g rolled oats, 480 mL milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 100 g fresh blueberries, and 50 g brown sugar.
Pour into a greased baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve warm, optionally topped with more blueberries and a drizzle of honey.
description: Hearty baked oatmeal enriched with juicy blueberries and sweetened naturally, a wholesome breakfast option.

name: Broccoli Almond Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until translucent.
Add 500 g chopped broccoli and 100 g sliced almonds, sauté for 5 minutes.
Pour in 1 L vegetable broth and simmer until broccoli is tender, about 15 minutes.
Puree the soup until smooth. Season with salt and pepper, and serve hot.
description: A creamy, nourishing soup combining the distinct flavors of broccoli and almonds, blended to a smooth perfection.

name: Blackened Catfish
author: System
method: Combine 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp onion powder, 1 tsp cayenne, 1 tsp thyme, salt, and pepper to make a seasoning blend.
Generously coat 4 catfish fillets with the seasoning.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over high heat. Cook catfish for 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve with a side of coleslaw and lemon wedges.
description: Spicy and flavorful blackened catfish, perfectly seasoned and cooked to a crispy finish, a southern delicacy.

name: Basil Lemonade
author: System
method: In a pitcher, muddle 20 g fresh basil leaves with 100 g sugar.
Add the juice of 6 lemons and 1 L water, stir until sugar dissolves.
Chill in the refrigerator. Serve over ice, garnished with additional basil leaves.
description: A refreshing twist on traditional lemonade, infused with fresh basil for a unique herbal note.

name: BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches
author: System
method: Shred 500 g canned jackfruit. In a skillet, sauté jackfruit in 15 mL olive oil until lightly browned.
Add 240 mL barbecue sauce and simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve on hamburger buns with pickles and coleslaw.
description: Vegetarian sandwiches featuring jackfruit, which mimics the texture of pulled pork, smothered in BBQ sauce for a smoky flavor.

name: Baked Camembert with Walnuts
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Place a 250 g wheel of Camembert in a small baking dish. Top with 50 g chopped walnuts and a drizzle of 15 mL honey.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until the cheese is soft and melting.
Serve with sliced baguette and apple slices.
description: A luxurious melted Camembert topped with crunchy walnuts and sweet honey, an elegant and irresistible appetizer.

name: Bruschetta with Roasted Garlic
author: System
method: Roast a head of garlic, wrapped in foil, at 200°C (392°F) for 35 minutes.
Squeeze the roasted garlic cloves into a bowl, mash with a fork, and mix with 30 mL olive oil.
Toast 8 slices of baguette. Spread the garlic mixture on each slice, top with diced tomatoes and basil.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve.
description: Classic bruschetta enhanced with the deep, sweet flavors of roasted garlic, topped with fresh tomatoes and basil.

name: Bacon Corn Chowder
author: System
method: In a large pot, render 200 g chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the bacon fat, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 diced potatoes for 5 minutes.
Add 500 g corn kernels and 1 L chicken broth. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Purée half the soup, then return to pot. Stir in 240 mL cream, bacon, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives.
description: A hearty chowder packed with sweet corn, tender potatoes, and crispy bacon, enriched with cream for a comforting meal.

name: Baked Apple Cider Donuts
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F). Grease a donut pan.
Mix 250 g flour, 100 g sugar, 5 g baking powder, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, whisk 2 eggs, 120 mL apple cider, and 60 mL melted butter. Combine with dry ingredients.
Fill the donut pan and bake for 10 minutes. Cool and dust with powdered sugar.
description: Soft, cake-like donuts baked with apple cider and spices, finished with a sweet dusting of powdered sugar.

name: Bulgur Wheat Greek Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g bulgur wheat as per package instructions. Let cool.
Combine bulgur with 100 g chopped cucumbers, 100 g cherry tomatoes, 50 g sliced black olives, and 50 g feta cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, and 1 tsp dried oregano. Pour over salad.
Toss well and chill before serving.
description: A refreshing and hearty salad featuring bulgur wheat mixed with classic Greek salad ingredients and a zesty dressing.

name: Beef Bulgogi
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g thinly sliced beef sirloin in a mixture of 60 mL soy sauce, 30 mL sesame oil, 20 g sugar, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 grated Asian pear for 1 hour.
Heat a grill pan over high heat. Grill beef in batches until caramelized, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve with steamed rice and kimchi.
description: A popular Korean dish featuring marinated beef grilled to perfection, served with rice and kimchi for a complete meal.

name: Basil Pesto Stuffed Mushrooms
author: System
method: Remove stems from 16 large white mushrooms and finely chop the stems. Sauté stems with 1 minced garlic clove in 15 mL olive oil.
Mix sautéed stems with 120 g basil pesto and 50 g grated Parmesan cheese.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the mixture. Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 15 minutes.
Serve warm, garnished with additional Parmesan.
description: Delicious mushrooms filled with a rich basil pesto and Parmesan stuffing, baked until golden and bubbly.

name: Blue Cheese Dip
author: System
method: Combine 150 g crumbled blue cheese, 120 mL sour cream, 60 mL mayonnaise, and 1 minced garlic clove in a bowl.
Mash together until well blended but still chunky. Stir in 1 tbsp chopped chives.
Chill for 1 hour to allow flavors to meld. Serve with carrot sticks and celery.
description: A creamy and tangy blue cheese dip, perfect with fresh vegetables or as a condiment for wings.

name: Banana Peanut Butter Smoothie
author: System
method: Blend 2 ripe bananas, 60 mL creamy peanut butter, 240 mL almond milk, and 1 tbsp honey until smooth.
Serve immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon.
description: A smooth and nutritious smoothie that combines the rich flavors of banana and peanut butter, sweetened naturally with honey.

name: Braised Leeks
author: System
method: Trim and clean 4 large leeks, cutting them into 10 cm lengths. Sauté in 15 mL olive oil until golden.
Add 240 mL vegetable broth, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes until leeks are tender.
Uncover, increase heat to reduce the broth slightly. Season with salt and pepper, and serve drizzled with vinaigrette.
description: Tender leeks slowly braised until soft, served with a reduction of their cooking broth and a light vinaigrette.

name: Black Bean Quesadillas
author: System
