method: Mash 400 g canned black beans with 1 tsp cumin and 1 minced garlic clove.
Spread onto 4 large flour tortillas, sprinkle with 200 g shredded Cheddar, top with another tortilla.
Cook in a skillet over medium heat until the cheese melts and the tortillas are golden, flipping once.
Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.
description: Crispy tortillas filled with spiced black beans and melted cheese, an easy and satisfying meal or snack.

name: Baked Cod with Crispy Garlic
author: System
method: Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish. Season with salt and pepper.
Mix 60 mL olive oil, 4 minced garlic cloves, and 30 g breadcrumbs. Spoon over cod.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 12-15 minutes until the fish is cooked through and topping is golden.
Garnish with lemon wedges and parsley before serving.
description: Tender cod fillets baked with a crunchy garlic breadcrumb topping, a perfect dish for a healthy, flavorful dinner.

name: Berry Banana Breakfast Bars
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F).
In a bowl, combine 200 g oat flour, 100 g rolled oats, 3 mashed bananas, 100 g mixed berries, and 50 mL honey.
Press mixture into a lined baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until set.
Cool completely and cut into bars.
description: Wholesome breakfast bars made with natural ingredients like oats, bananas, and berries, sweetened with honey for an energizing start.

name: Bacon Wrapped Asparagus
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F).
Wrap a slice of bacon around 3 asparagus spears. Secure with a toothpick.
Arrange on a baking sheet. Roast for 15-20 minutes until bacon is crispy.
Serve immediately, garnished with a squeeze of lemon.
description: Crispy bacon wrapped tightly around fresh asparagus spears, roasted to perfection for a delicious and elegant side dish or appetizer.

name: Creamy Cauliflower Soup
author: System
method: Chop 1 large cauliflower into florets, sauté in 15 mL olive oil until golden.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic, cook until translucent.
Pour in 1 L vegetable broth and simmer until cauliflower is tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the soup until smooth, stir in 120 mL cream, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chives.
description: A velvety smooth soup made from cauliflower, enriched with cream and seasoned for a light yet satisfying dish.

name: Chicken Cacciatore
author: System
method: Season 4 chicken thighs with salt and pepper, brown in 15 mL olive oil.
Remove chicken, add 1 chopped bell pepper, 1 onion, and 200 g sliced mushrooms, sauté until soft.
Return chicken to the pan, add 500 mL tomato sauce, 120 mL red wine, cover and simmer for 45 minutes.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve over cooked pasta.
description: A hearty Italian dish featuring chicken simmered in a rich tomato sauce with vegetables and red wine, served over pasta.

name: Caramelized Onion Tart
author: System
method: Thinly slice 3 large onions and cook in 30 mL butter over low heat until deeply caramelized, about 30 minutes.
Spread onions over a prebaked tart shell, top with 100 g grated Gruyere cheese.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 20 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Serve warm, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: A delicious tart made with sweet caramelized onions and rich Gruyere cheese, perfect for a light meal or sophisticated appetizer.

name: Curried Coconut Chicken
author: System
method: Cut 500 g chicken breast into chunks. Brown in 15 mL coconut oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp curry powder, cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in 400 mL coconut milk and add 1 chopped red bell pepper, simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve over steamed rice, garnished with cilantro.
description: Tender chicken simmered in a creamy coconut curry sauce with aromatic spices, a flavorful dish that pairs perfectly with rice.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
author: System
method: Cream together 150 g butter with 200 g sugar. Beat in 2 eggs and 5 mL vanilla extract.
Mix in 300 g flour, 5 g baking soda, and 5 g salt. Stir in 200 g chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet. Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 10 minutes.
Let cool on a wire rack before serving.
description: Classic chocolate chip cookies with a chewy center and crispy edges, loaded with chocolate chips.

name: Crab Stuffed Mushrooms
author: System
method: Remove stems from 16 large mushrooms, finely chop the stems and sauté with 1 clove minced garlic in 15 mL olive oil.
Mix sautéed stems with 200 g crab meat, 50 g breadcrumbs, and 30 mL cream. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the crab mixture. Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 15 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Elegant mushrooms filled with a rich crabmeat stuffing, baked until golden and served with a garnish of fresh parsley.

name: Cinnamon Swirl Bread
author: System
method: Prepare dough from 500 g flour, 250 mL milk, 5 g yeast. Let rise until doubled.
Roll out dough, spread with 30 g melted butter, sprinkle with 50 g sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon.
Roll up, place in a loaf pan, and allow to rise. Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 35 minutes.
Cool and slice. Serve as is or toasted with butter.
description: Homemade bread with a sweet cinnamon swirl, perfect for breakfast or a comforting snack.

name: Caramel Apple Pie
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Layer 500 g sliced apples in a pie crust. Top with a mixture of 100 g sugar, 5 g cinnamon, and 120 mL caramel sauce.
Cover with a lattice crust. Bake for 50 minutes.
Serve warm or cool, drizzled with extra caramel.
description: A decadent twist on traditional apple pie, featuring sweet apples, rich caramel, and a flaky crust.

name: Chili Lime Cucumber Noodles
author: System
method: Use a spiralizer to turn 4 large cucumbers into noodles.
Whisk together 30 mL lime juice, 15 mL olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 tsp chili flakes, and salt.
Toss cucumber noodles with dressing. Chill for 30 minutes.
Serve garnished with chopped cilantro and sesame seeds.
description: Light and refreshing cucumber noodles tossed in a zesty chili lime dressing, a perfect side dish or healthy meal.

name: Creamed Corn with Parmesan
author: System
method: In a skillet, melt 30 g butter. Add 500 g corn kernels, cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in 120 mL cream, 50 g grated Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with extra Parmesan and black pepper.
description: A rich and creamy side dish featuring sweet corn elevated with Parmesan cheese and cream, perfect alongside any main course.

name: Coconut Curry Shrimp
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, sauté until soft.
Stir in 1 tbsp curry powder and 500 g peeled shrimp, cook until shrimp are pink.
Pour in 400 mL coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve over steamed rice, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: Succulent shrimp cooked in a creamy coconut curry sauce, infused with garlic and onion, served over a bed of rice.

name: Cheddar Cheese Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, melt 30 g butter over medium heat. Add 1 diced carrot, 1 diced celery stalk, and 1 diced onion; cook until softened.
Stir in 30 g flour to form a roux, cook for 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in 500 mL chicken broth and 250 mL milk, bring to a simmer.
Add 200 g grated cheddar cheese, stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with crumbled bacon and green onions.
description: A creamy and comforting cheddar cheese soup, enriched with vegetables and topped with savory bacon, perfect for a cold day.

name: Crispy Chickpea Salad
author: System
method: Rinse and drain 400 g canned chickpeas. Toss with 15 mL olive oil, spread on a baking sheet, and roast at 200°C (392°F) until crispy, about 20 minutes.
Combine chickpeas with 100 g chopped cucumbers, 100 g cherry tomatoes, and 50 g feta cheese in a bowl.
Dress with 30 mL lemon juice and 15 mL olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A vibrant salad featuring crispy roasted chickpeas, fresh vegetables, and feta cheese, dressed in a simple lemon vinaigrette.

name: Cinnamon Apple Chips
author: System
method: Core and thinly slice 4 large apples. Sprinkle with 1 tsp ground cinnamon.
Arrange slices in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake at 100°C (212°F) for 2 hours, turning halfway through, until dried and crisp.
Cool before serving.
description: Healthy and natural snack made from thinly sliced apples, baked with a dusting of cinnamon until crisp.

name: Citrus Ceviche
author: System
method: Mix 500 g chopped raw fish (like tilapia) with juice of 2 limes, 1 lemon, and 1 orange. Chill for 3 hours until fish appears cooked.
Add 1 diced red onion, 1 chopped tomato, and a handful of chopped cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled with avocado slices and tortilla chips.
description: A light, refreshing dish featuring raw fish cured in citrus juices, complemented with fresh vegetables and herbs.

name: Chipotle Chicken Tacos
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g chicken breast strips in a blend of 30 mL chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, 15 mL lime juice, and garlic for 1 hour.
Cook chicken in a skillet over medium heat until done.
Serve in corn tortillas with diced onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
description: Spicy and smoky chicken cooked with chipotle peppers, served in soft tortillas with fresh toppings.

name: Cream Puffs
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Boil 120 mL water with 50 g butter. Stir in 70 g flour, cook until a ball forms. Cool slightly, mix in 2 eggs.
Drop dough by spoonfuls onto a baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes until puffed and golden.
Fill with whipped cream and dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: Delicate pastry shells made from choux dough, baked until puffy and golden, filled with sweet whipped cream.

name: Chickpea Veggie Burgers
author: System
method: Mash 400 g canned chickpeas in a bowl. Mix in 50 g grated carrots, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, and spices to taste.
Form into patties and fry in 15 mL olive oil until each side is golden brown.
Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, and your favorite burger sauce.
description: Hearty and flavorful veggie burgers made from chickpeas and vegetables, a satisfying alternative to meat.

name: Coconut Crusted Tilapia
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
Mix 100 g shredded coconut with 50 g breadcrumbs and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Dip 4 tilapia fillets in beaten egg, then dredge in the coconut mixture.
Bake on a lined baking sheet for 15 minutes or until golden and cooked through.
Serve with a wedge of lime and a side of mango salsa.
description: A tropical twist on tilapia, encrusted in coconut and baked to crispy perfection, paired with vibrant mango salsa.

name: Curried Cauliflower Steaks
author: System
method: Slice 1 large head of cauliflower into 2 cm thick steaks.
Brush each steak with a mixture of 30 mL olive oil and 1 tbsp curry powder.
Roast in the oven at 220°C (428°F) for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Serve hot, drizzled with yogurt sauce and garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: Thick slices of cauliflower seasoned with curry and roasted until tender, served with a cool, creamy yogurt sauce.

name: Cajun Chicken Pasta
author: System
method: Season 500 g chicken breast strips with Cajun seasoning. Sauté in 15 mL olive oil until cooked through.
Remove chicken, add 1 sliced bell pepper and 1 sliced onion to the same pan, cook until soft.
Return chicken to pan, add 240 mL cream and 200 g cooked fettuccine. Toss until heated through.
Serve garnished with grated Parmesan and chopped parsley.
description: Spicy Cajun-seasoned chicken tossed with creamy pasta and sautéed peppers and onions, a satisfying and flavorful dish.

name: Cucumber Gazpacho
author: System
method: Blend 3 peeled and chopped cucumbers with 1 small chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, and 240 mL vegetable broth until smooth.
Stir in 120 mL yogurt, juice of 1 lemon, salt, and pepper. Chill for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold, garnished with diced cucumber and fresh dill.
description: A refreshing and light soup made from blended cucumbers and yogurt, infused with garlic and lemon, perfect for hot days.

name: Cherry Clafoutis
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F). Butter a baking dish and sprinkle with sugar.
Distribute 300 g pitted cherries evenly in the dish.
Whisk together 3 eggs, 100 g sugar, 80 g flour, 240 mL milk, and 1 tsp vanilla extract. Pour over cherries.
Bake for 35 minutes until set and golden. Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.
description: A traditional French dessert featuring sweet cherries baked in a custard-like batter, dusted with powdered sugar.

name: Cilantro Lime Rice
author: System
method: Cook 200 g rice as per package instructions.
When rice is cooked, stir in juice of 2 limes, 15 mL olive oil, and 30 g chopped cilantro.
Season with salt and serve warm.
description: Fluffy rice enhanced with the fresh flavors of lime and cilantro, a perfect side dish for Mexican and Asian cuisines.

name: Caramel Pecan Cheesecake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F).
Combine 200 g crushed graham crackers with 50 g melted butter and press into the bottom of a springform pan.
Beat 500 g cream cheese with 150 g sugar until smooth. Add 3 eggs one at a time, then stir in 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Pour over crust, bake for 50 minutes. Cool and top with 120 mL caramel sauce and 100 g chopped pecans.
Chill for 4 hours before serving.
description: A decadent cheesecake with a graham cracker crust, topped with rich caramel and crunchy pecans.

name: Chilled Avocado Soup
author: System
method: Blend 2 ripe avocados, 240 mL chicken broth, juice of 1 lime, and 1 clove garlic until smooth.
Stir in 120 mL cream, season with salt and white pepper. Chill for 2 hours.
Serve cold, garnished with a swirl of cream and chopped chives.
description: A smooth and creamy avocado soup, subtly flavored with lime and garlic, and beautifully complemented with a touch of cream.

name: Cardamom Poached Pears
author: System
method: Peel 4 pears, leaving stems intact. In a large saucepan, combine 500 mL water, 200 g sugar, and 5 cardamom pods. Bring to a simmer.
Add pears, cover, and simmer gently for 15 minutes or until pears are tender.
Remove pears, reduce the syrup by half. Serve pears drizzled with syrup and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
description: Elegantly spiced pears, poached in a cardamom-infused syrup, served with creamy vanilla ice cream for a sophisticated dessert.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
author: System
method: Grill 500 g chicken breast until cooked through. Let cool and slice.
Toss sliced chicken with 200 g chopped romaine lettuce, 100 g croutons, and 50 g grated Parmesan cheese.
Dress with 120 mL Caesar dressing and serve immediately.
description: A classic salad combining grilled chicken, crisp romaine, croutons, and Parmesan cheese with creamy Caesar dressing.

name: Cranberry Chicken
author: System
method: In a skillet, brown 4 chicken thighs.
Mix 240 mL cranberry juice, 60 mL orange juice, and 2 tbsp brown sugar in a bowl. Pour over chicken.
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Uncover and increase heat to reduce the sauce.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cranberries and orange slices.
description: Tender chicken thighs cooked in a sweet and tangy cranberry and orange sauce, a delightful blend of flavors.

name: Cuban Sandwich
author: System
method: Layer 200 g sliced roast pork, 100 g sliced ham, 50 g Swiss cheese, and pickles on 4 pieces of Cuban bread.
Spread mustard on the top half of the bread. Press sandwiches in a heated panini press until the cheese is melted and the bread is crispy.
Cut in half and serve hot.
description: A classic Cuban sandwich with layers of roast pork, ham, Swiss cheese, and pickles, pressed to crispy perfection.

name: Cashew Chicken Stir Fry
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 15 mL sesame oil over high heat. Add 500 g diced chicken breast and stir fry until browned.
Add 1 chopped bell pepper, 100 g broccoli florets, and 50 g cashews. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in 60 mL soy sauce and 30 mL hoisin sauce. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice, garnished with sliced green onions.
description: A hearty stir fry featuring chicken, cashews, and vegetables, all tossed in a rich soy and hoisin sauce.

name: Caramelized Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Halve 500 g Brussels sprouts and toss with 15 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast in the oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Drizzle with 30 mL balsamic glaze before serving.
description: Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection and finished with a sweet balsamic glaze, a delicious and easy side dish.

name: Chorizo and Potato Tacos
author: System
method: Cook 200 g chorizo in a skillet until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 300 g diced potatoes and cook until golden and crispy.
Return chorizo to the skillet, mix with potatoes.
Serve in warm corn tortillas with diced onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
description: Spicy chorizo and crispy potatoes wrapped in soft corn tortillas, a simple yet flavorful meal.

name: Chicken and Corn Chowder
author: System
method: In a large pot, cook 200 g diced bacon until crisp. Remove bacon, set aside.
Add 1 diced onion, 2 diced celery stalks, and 500 g diced chicken breast to the pot. Cook until chicken is browned.
Stir in 500 g corn, 1 L chicken broth, and 240 mL cream. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot, topped with the crispy bacon and chopped chives.
description: A creamy chowder filled with tender chicken, sweet corn, and crisp bacon, a comforting and satisfying meal.

name: Carrot Cake Cupcakes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Mix 200 g flour, 5 g baking powder, 5 g cinnamon, and 1 g salt.
In another bowl, beat 100 mL oil with 200 g sugar, then add 2 eggs. Stir in 200 g grated carrots.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, fill muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes.
Cool and top with cream cheese frosting and a sprinkle of chopped walnuts.
description: Moist and flavorful carrot cake cupcakes, topped with rich cream cheese frosting and crunchy walnuts.

name: Cucumber Tomato Salad
author: System
method: Chop 3 large cucumbers and 3 large tomatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Toss with 30 g sliced red onions, 15 mL olive oil, 15 mL vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving, garnished with fresh basil.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad featuring cucumbers and tomatoes, lightly dressed and perfect for summer meals.

name: Coq au Vin
author: System
method: Season 500 g chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Brown in 30 mL olive oil and remove.
In the same pan, add 100 g chopped bacon, 200 g pearl onions, and 200 g sliced mushrooms. Cook until onions are soft.
Return chicken to the pan, add 500 mL red wine and 240 mL chicken broth. Simmer for 1 hour.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with mashed potatoes.
description: A classic French dish where chicken is slowly braised with wine, bacon, mushrooms, and pearl onions, rich in flavor.

name: Cheesy Cauliflower Casserole
author: System
method: Steam 1 head of cauliflower cut into florets until tender.
Mix steamed cauliflower with 200 g shredded cheddar cheese, 240 mL cream, and 1 tsp smoked paprika. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish, top with more cheese, and bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives.
description: A comforting and hearty casserole featuring tender cauliflower smothered in a creamy, cheesy sauce with a hint of smoky paprika.

name: Charred Corn Salsa
author: System
method: Grill 4 ears of corn until kernels are lightly charred. Cut kernels off the cob.
Mix corn with 1 diced red bell pepper, 1 diced avocado, and 1/4 cup chopped cilantro.
Dress with juice of 2 limes and 30 mL olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Chill before serving with tortilla chips or as a topping for grilled meats.
description: Fresh corn grilled and mixed with peppers, avocado, and cilantro, creating a vibrant and flavorful salsa.

name: Curry Spiced Carrot Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic in 15 mL olive oil until soft.
Add 500 g chopped carrots and 1 tbsp curry powder, cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in 1 L vegetable broth, simmer until carrots are tender, about 30 minutes.
Puree soup until smooth. Stir in 120 mL coconut milk, heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of coconut milk and fresh coriander.
description: A smooth and velvety carrot soup, warmly spiced with curry and enriched with coconut milk for a touch of richness.

name: Crispy Calamari Rings
author: System
method: Slice 500 g calamari tubes into rings. Dredge in 100 g flour seasoned with salt and pepper.
Deep fry in hot oil at 190°C (375°F) until golden and crispy, about 2 minutes.
Serve with lemon wedges and marinara sauce for dipping.
description: Lightly breaded calamari rings, fried until crispy and golden, served with a tangy marinara sauce and fresh lemon.

name: Chicken Chimichangas
author: System
method: Cook 500 g shredded chicken with 200 g refried beans, 100 g cheese, and 30 mL salsa.
Spoon mixture onto 4 large flour tortillas, roll up and secure with toothpicks.
Deep fry at 180°C (356°F) until golden. Serve with guacamole, sour cream, and extra salsa.
description: Crispy fried burritos stuffed with spicy chicken, beans, and cheese, accompanied by creamy guacamole and sour cream.

name: Creamy Carbonara
author: System
method: Cook 400 g spaghetti according to package directions. Drain, reserving 120 mL of pasta water.
Cook 150 g diced pancetta in a pan until crispy. Remove and set aside.
Whisk together 2 eggs and 100 g grated Parmesan. Pour over hot spaghetti, adding pasta water to create a sauce.
Mix in pancetta, season with black pepper. Serve immediately.
description: A rich and creamy spaghetti carbonara, with crispy pancetta and a silky sauce made from eggs and Parmesan, freshly seasoned with pepper.

name: Caramel Popcorn
author: System
method: Pop 100 g popcorn kernels using 15 mL vegetable oil. Set aside in a large bowl.
In a saucepan, melt 50 g butter, stir in 100 g brown sugar and 30 mL corn syrup, bring to a boil and let simmer for 5 minutes without stirring.
Pour the caramel over popcorn, mix quickly to coat evenly.
Spread on a baking sheet to cool. Break into pieces and serve.
description: Crunchy popcorn coated with a buttery caramel glaze, a perfect sweet treat for movie night or as a snack.

name: Cajun Spiced Cod
author: System
method: Rub 4 cod fillets with a mixture of 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning.
Heat 15 mL olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, add cod, and cook for 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Serve with a side of steamed vegetables and lemon wedges.
description: Deliciously seasoned cod fillets with a spicy Cajun kick, pan-fried to perfection and served with fresh lemon.

name: Chili Beef Lettuce Wraps
author: System
method: Cook 500 g ground beef with 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic until browned.
Stir in 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, and 60 mL soy sauce. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Spoon the beef mixture into leaves of butter lettuce. Top with diced tomatoes and shredded cheese.
Serve with salsa and sour cream on the side.
description: Spicy and flavorful ground beef served in crisp lettuce leaves, a lighter alternative to traditional tacos.

name: Curried Vegetable Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL coconut oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp grated ginger, sauté until onion is translucent.
Add 200 g chopped carrots, 200 g diced potatoes, and 1 chopped bell pepper. Stir in 2 tbsp curry powder and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in 500 mL vegetable broth and 240 mL coconut milk, bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 100 g frozen peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
description: A hearty and comforting stew loaded with vegetables and flavored with curry powder and coconut milk.

name: Cinnamon Raisin Bread
author: System
method: In a large bowl, dissolve 5 g yeast in 240 mL warm water. Add 50 g sugar, 5 g salt, 30 mL vegetable oil, and 400 g flour. Knead until smooth.
Let rise until doubled, about 1 hour. Punch down dough and knead in 100 g raisins and 2 tsp cinnamon.
Form into a loaf, place in a greased loaf pan, and allow to rise again.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes. Remove, cool, and slice.
description: Sweet and fragrant bread speckled with raisins and swirled with cinnamon, perfect for breakfast or as a snack.

name: Cauliflower Buffalo Bites
author: System
method: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into bite-sized florets. Toss with 15 mL olive oil and bake at 220°C (428°F) for 20 minutes.
Combine 60 mL hot sauce with 30 mL melted butter. Toss roasted cauliflower in the sauce.
Serve hot with blue cheese dressing and celery sticks.
description: Spicy and tangy cauliflower bites, a vegetarian twist on classic buffalo wings, served with a cooling blue cheese dressing.

name: Chicken Caprese Salad
author: System
method: Grill 500 g chicken breast and slice. Arrange on a platter.
Layer with 200 g sliced fresh mozzarella, 200 g sliced tomatoes, and fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and 30 mL olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
description: A fresh and light salad layering grilled chicken, mozzarella, and tomatoes, enhanced with basil and a balsamic glaze.

name: Chorizo Paella
author: System
method: In a large skillet, cook 200 g sliced chorizo until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 1 chopped onion, 1 diced bell pepper, and 2 cloves minced garlic; cook until soft.
Stir in 400 g paella rice, cook for 2 minutes. Add 1 L chicken broth and 0.5 g saffron. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Add chorizo back to the skillet, along with 200 g peas and 200 g shrimp. Cook until shrimp are pink.
Serve hot, garnished with lemon wedges and chopped parsley.
description: A vibrant Spanish rice dish loaded with spicy chorizo, colorful vegetables, and seafood, all infused with the flavor of saffron.

name: Cream of Mushroom Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms and 1 diced onion in 30 mL butter until tender.
Sprinkle with 30 g flour and stir to coat. Gradually add 1 L chicken broth, stirring continuously.
Simmer for 20 minutes. Blend until smooth, return to heat, and stir in 240 mL cream. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley and additional sautéed mushrooms.
description: A rich and velvety soup made with fresh mushrooms and cream, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Cinnamon Baked Apples
author: System
method: Core 4 large apples and place in a baking dish.
Mix 50 g brown sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 30 g butter; fill apples with this mixture.
Pour 120 mL water into the bottom of the dish. Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 45 minutes.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
description: Warm, tender apples filled with a sweet cinnamon sugar mixture, baked to perfection and served with a scoop of ice cream.

name: Cherry Chocolate Trifle
author: System
method: Layer 200 g cubed chocolate cake in the bottom of a large glass bowl.
Top with 150 g pitted cherries and drizzle with 50 mL cherry liqueur.
Whisk together 500 mL heavy cream and 50 g sugar until stiff peaks form. Spread half over the cherries.
Repeat the layers and top with shaved chocolate. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.
description: A decadent dessert layering rich chocolate cake, sweet cherries, and fluffy whipped cream, topped with chocolate shavings.

name: Coconut Shrimp Curry
author: System
method: Fry 400 g shrimp in 15 mL coconut oil until pink, set aside.
In the same pan, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 1 tbsp minced ginger until soft.
Add 1 tbsp curry paste, 400 mL coconut milk, and bring to a simmer. Return shrimp to pan.
Cook for 5 minutes. Serve over steamed rice, garnished with sliced green onions and cilantro.
description: Juicy shrimp enveloped in a creamy coconut curry sauce, infused with bold spices and served over a bed of rice.

name: Crispy Chicken Cutlets
author: System
method: Pound 4 chicken breasts to even thickness. Season with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat in breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan cheese.
Fry in 60 mL olive oil over medium heat until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with lemon wedges and a side salad.
description: Tender chicken breasts breaded with a crispy Parmesan crust, fried to golden perfection.

name: Carrot and Ginger Juice
author: System
method: Juice 500 g carrots and a 50 g piece of ginger root in a juicer.
Stir in the juice of 1 lemon and a pinch of turmeric for added flavor and health benefits.
Serve chilled, garnished with a sprig of mint.
description: A refreshing and healthy juice combining sweet carrots with zesty ginger and a touch of lemon, perfect for a nutritional boost.

name: Cabbage and Sausage Skillet
author: System
method: Slice 200 g smoked sausage and brown in a skillet with 15 mL oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 500 g shredded cabbage, 1 sliced onion, and cook until cabbage is wilted and slightly browned.
Return sausage to skillet, stir to combine, and season with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp paprika.
Serve hot, ideal as a hearty side dish or a simple main course.
description: A savory and satisfying skillet dish featuring smoked sausage and cabbage, spiced with paprika for depth of flavor.

name: Creamy Chicken Alfredo
author: System
method: Cook 400 g fettuccine pasta according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté 500 g sliced chicken breast in 15 mL olive oil until golden and cooked through.
Add 240 mL heavy cream and 100 g grated Parmesan cheese to the pan, stir until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens.
Toss the pasta with the sauce, season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with parsley and more Parmesan.
description: A rich and indulgent pasta dish featuring tender chicken in a creamy Alfredo sauce made with Parmesan cheese.

name: Cranberry Walnut Salad
author: System
method: Combine 150 g mixed salad greens, 100 g dried cranberries, and 100 g chopped walnuts in a large bowl.
Whisk together 30 mL balsamic vinegar, 15 mL olive oil, 1 tsp honey, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing just before serving.
Top with 50 g crumbled goat cheese for extra flavor.
description: A fresh and vibrant salad perfectly balanced with sweet cranberries, crunchy walnuts, and creamy goat cheese, dressed in a honey balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Chicken and Chorizo Jambalaya
author: System
method: In a large skillet, cook 200 g chorizo (sliced) until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 500 g diced chicken thigh, 1 diced onion, and 1 diced bell pepper. Cook until chicken is browned.
Add 200 g diced tomatoes, 500 mL chicken broth, 300 g rice, and 2 tsp Cajun seasoning. Bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 20 minutes.
Return chorizo to the skillet, mix well. Cook uncovered for 10 minutes or until rice is tender.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.
description: A hearty and spicy dish combining chicken and chorizo with rice and Cajun spices, all cooked together to infuse the flavors.

name: Cucumber Mint Lemonade
author: System
method: Juice 2 large cucumbers and 4 lemons. Mix the juices in a pitcher.
Add 60 mL simple syrup, a handful of fresh mint leaves, and 500 mL cold water. Stir well.
Serve over ice, garnished with additional mint leaves and thin cucumber slices.
description: A refreshing and hydrating beverage, perfect for warm days, featuring a blend of cucumber and lemon, sweetened and mint-infused.

name: Chocolate Hazelnut Spread Stuffed Pancakes
author: System
method: Prepare pancake batter using 200 g flour, 2 eggs, 300 mL milk, and 1 tsp baking powder.
Pour small rounds of batter onto a hot griddle. Place 1 tsp chocolate hazelnut spread in the center and cover with more batter.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side.
Serve warm with a dusting of powdered sugar.
description: Fluffy pancakes with a gooey chocolate hazelnut center, a surprise in every bite, perfect for a decadent breakfast or brunch.

name: Crispy Coconut Chicken
author: System
method: Slice 500 g chicken breasts into strips. Season with salt and pepper.
Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with a mixture of 100 g shredded coconut and 50 g breadcrumbs.
Fry in 60 mL coconut oil over medium heat until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with a sweet chili sauce and lime wedges.
description: Juicy chicken strips encrusted in a crispy coconut coating, fried to perfection and served with a tangy sweet chili sauce.

name: Chive and Onion Potato Cakes
author: System
method: Mash 500 g boiled potatoes. Mix with 30 g chopped chives, 50 g diced onions, 1 beaten egg, and 50 g flour.
Form into patties and fry in a skillet with 15 mL olive oil until each side is golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream.
description: Savory potato cakes with a delightful mix of chives and onions, pan-fried to a golden crisp, ideal for breakfast or a side dish.

name: Cantaloupe and Prosciutto Salad
author: System
method: Peel and cube 1 large cantaloupe and arrange on a platter.
Drape 100 g thinly sliced prosciutto over the cantaloupe.
Scatter with 50 g arugula and drizzle with 30 mL balsamic reduction.
Sprinkle with black pepper and serve immediately.
description: A refreshing and elegant salad pairing sweet cantaloupe with savory prosciutto, accented with peppery arugula and rich balsamic.

name: Curried Chickpea Sandwich
author: System
method: In a bowl, mash 400 g canned chickpeas. Mix with 1 diced red onion, 100 g yogurt, and 2 tbsp curry powder.
Spread mixture on 4 slices of whole grain bread, top with sliced cucumbers and sprouts.
Complete the sandwich with another slice of bread. Serve cut into halves.
description: A hearty and flavorful vegetarian sandwich with a curried chickpea spread, crisp cucumbers, and fresh sprouts.

name: Cranberry Pecan Chicken Salad
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine 500 g cooked, diced chicken, 100 g dried cranberries, 100 g chopped pecans, and 100 g chopped celery.
Mix with 120 mL mayonnaise and 30 mL honey mustard.
Chill for at least 1 hour. Serve on lettuce leaves or as a sandwich filling.
description: A delightful chicken salad with the sweet tang of cranberries and the crunch of pecans, bound together with creamy mayonnaise.

name: Chili Con Carne
author: System
method: In a large pot, cook 500 g ground beef until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and cook until onions are translucent.
Stir in 1 chopped red bell pepper, 400 g canned diced tomatoes, 400 g canned kidney beans (drained), 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, and 500 mL beef broth.
Simmer covered for 1 hour. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, topped with shredded cheddar cheese and sour cream.
description: A hearty and spicy dish of ground beef, beans, and tomatoes, simmered with chili and cumin, topped with cheese and sour cream.

name: Cinnamon French Toast
author: System
method: In a shallow dish, whisk together 2 eggs, 240 mL milk, 2 tbsp sugar, and 1 tsp cinnamon.
Dip 8 slices of brioche bread into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are coated.
Fry in a buttered skillet over medium heat until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve hot with maple syrup and a dusting of powdered sugar.
description: Rich and fluffy French toast spiced with cinnamon, cooked to golden perfection, and served with sweet maple syrup.

name: Cajun Corn Maque Choux
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green bell pepper, and 2 cloves minced garlic; sauté until soft.
Add 500 g corn kernels, 1 chopped tomato, 1 tsp Cajun seasoning, and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in 120 mL cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.
description: A vibrant and flavorful Cajun dish with corn, peppers, and tomatoes, simmered in creamy sauce, spiced just right.

name: Caribbean Jerk Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken thighs in a mixture of 60 mL jerk seasoning paste and the juice of 1 lime for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until fully cooked, about 6 minutes per side.
Serve with a side of coconut rice and grilled pineapple slices.
description: Spicy and intensely flavored jerk chicken, grilled to perfection, served with sweet coconut rice and tangy pineapple.

name: Crab Stuffed Flounder
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Mix 200 g crabmeat with 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, 1 minced shallot, and 1 tbsp chopped parsley.
Lay 4 flounder fillets flat, divide stuffing among them, and roll up. Place seam-side down in a baking dish.
Drizzle with 30 mL melted butter and bake for 20 minutes.
Serve drizzled with lemon butter sauce.
description: Delicate flounder fillets stuffed with a savory crabmeat mixture, baked until golden and served with a rich lemon butter sauce.

name: Cheddar Apple Pie
author: System
method: Prepare a pie crust in a 9-inch pie dish. Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Toss 500 g sliced apples with 100 g sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 30 g flour.
Layer half of the apples in the crust, top with 100 g shredded cheddar cheese, then layer remaining apples.
Top with a second crust, seal edges, and cut slits in the top.
Bake for 50 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A unique twist on traditional apple pie, incorporating sharp cheddar cheese within layers of cinnamon-spiced apples, encased in a flaky crust.

name: Creamed Spinach
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL olive oil in a pan. Add 2 cloves minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add 500 g fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in 120 mL heavy cream and 50 g grated Parmesan cheese. Cook until the cream thickens.
Season with salt and nutmeg. Serve hot.
description: Rich and creamy spinach sautéed with garlic and enriched with heavy cream and Parmesan cheese, a perfect side dish.

name: Cajun Grilled Corn
author: System
method: Peel back the husks of 4 ears of corn without removing them. Remove the silks and brush the corn with 15 mL melted butter.
Sprinkle evenly with 1 tbsp Cajun seasoning. Pull the husks back over the corn.
Grill over medium heat for 15 minutes, turning occasionally, until kernels are tender and slightly charred.
Serve hot with additional butter if desired.
description: Sweet corn on the cob seasoned with spicy Cajun spices and grilled to perfection, a flavorful addition to any barbecue.

name: Curried Lentil Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp grated ginger, cook until onion is soft.
Add 1 tbsp curry powder, 300 g dried lentils, 1 chopped carrot, and 1 L vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 25 minutes.
Stir in 240 mL coconut milk and heat through. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a wedge of lime.
description: A warm and comforting soup featuring tender lentils and vegetables, spiced with curry and enriched with coconut milk.

name: Chocolate Covered Strawberries
author: System
method: Wash 300 g fresh strawberries and pat dry.
Melt 200 g dark chocolate in a double boiler or microwave. Stir until smooth.
Dip strawberries into the chocolate, letting excess chocolate drip off.
Place on a parchment-lined tray and refrigerate until chocolate sets, about 30 minutes.
Serve chilled.
description: Elegant and simple dessert of strawberries dipped in luxuriously smooth dark chocolate, perfect for special occasions.

name: Cilantro Lime Shrimp
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g peeled shrimp in a mixture of juice of 2 limes, 15 mL olive oil, and 30 g chopped cilantro for 30 minutes.
Sauté shrimp in a skillet over medium heat until pink and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with extra cilantro and lime wedges.
description: Juicy shrimp marinated in fresh cilantro and tangy lime, quickly sautéed and bursting with vibrant flavors.

name: Crispy Cauliflower Tacos
author: System
method: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into small florets. Toss with 15 mL olive oil, 30 g all-purpose flour, 1 tsp chili powder, and salt.
Roast at 220°C (428°F) for 25 minutes until golden and crispy.
Fill warm corn tortillas with cauliflower, top with sliced avocado, pickled red onions, and a drizzle of lime crema.
Serve immediately.
description: A delightful vegetarian taco option featuring crispy spiced cauliflower florets, topped with creamy avocado and tangy pickled onions.

name: Coconut Curry Meatballs
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground beef with 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, 1 tsp curry powder, and salt. Form into 20 meatballs.
Brown meatballs in a skillet with 15 mL coconut oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 400 mL coconut milk, 1 tbsp curry paste, and bring to a simmer.
Return meatballs to the skillet, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve over steamed rice or with naan bread.
description: Savory beef meatballs infused with curry flavors, simmered in a creamy coconut sauce, perfect for an exotic touch to your meal.

name: Citrus Cilantro Quinoa Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g quinoa according to package instructions and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, 100 g diced mango, 50 g chopped red bell pepper, and 50 g chopped green onions.
For the dressing, whisk together juice of 1 orange, juice of 1 lime, 30 mL olive oil, and 1 tsp honey.
Pour dressing over the salad, add a handful of chopped cilantro, and toss well.
Chill for an hour before serving to blend the flavors.
description: A fresh and light salad featuring fluffy quinoa, sweet mango, and crisp bell peppers, all brought together with a citrusy cilantro dressing.

name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
author: System
method: Flatten 4 chicken breasts to 1/4 inch thickness. Place a slice of ham and a slice of Swiss cheese on each breast.
Roll up each breast tightly and secure with toothpicks. Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter and cook the chicken rolls until golden and cooked through, about 7 minutes per side.
Serve hot with a creamy Dijon sauce.
description: Tender chicken breasts stuffed with ham and Swiss cheese, breaded and pan-fried to a crispy finish, served with a smooth Dijon sauce.

name: Chipotle Lime Grilled Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 60 mL chipotle in adobo sauce, juice of 2 limes, and 15 mL olive oil for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side.
Serve with a fresh salsa made from chopped tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and lime juice.
description: Spicy and tangy chicken breasts grilled to perfection, served with a vibrant fresh salsa that enhances the smoky flavors.

name: Caramelized Onion and Gruyere Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F). Roll out a sheet of puff pastry and fit into a 9-inch tart pan; set aside.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter over medium heat. Add 3 thinly sliced onions and cook slowly until deeply caramelized, about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Spread the caramelized onions on the prepared pastry. Top with 150 g sliced Gruyere cheese.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes until the pastry is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Serve warm, garnished with fresh thyme leaves.
description: A sophisticated tart combining sweet caramelized onions with rich Gruyere cheese, baked in a flaky puff pastry crust.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g chicken breast pieces in a mixture of 120 mL yogurt, 2 tbsp tikka masala paste, juice of 1 lemon, and salt for 4 hours.
Grill the chicken until charred and cooked through. Set aside.
In a pan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil, add 1 finely chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 1 tbsp grated ginger; sauté until onions are soft.
Add 200 mL tomato puree and 100 mL cream, bring to a simmer. Add grilled chicken, simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander and accompanied by steamed basmati rice.
description: A popular Indian dish featuring grilled marinated chicken smothered in a creamy, spicy tomato sauce, served with rice.

name: Cinnamon Apple Crisp
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Toss 500 g peeled and sliced apples with 50 g sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1 tbsp lemon juice. Place in a baking dish.
Mix 100 g rolled oats, 50 g flour, 50 g brown sugar, and 50 g melted butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over the apples.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the topping is golden and apples are bubbly.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
description: A delightful dessert featuring tender cinnamon-spiced apples topped with a crunchy oat crust, perfect with a scoop of ice cream.

name: Dutch Apple Pie
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Toss 600 g peeled and sliced apples with 200 g sugar, 5 g cinnamon, and 15 mL lemon juice. Place in a pie dish.
Mix 150 g flour and 100 g butter in a bowl until crumbly. Sprinkle over the apples.
Bake for 45 minutes or until the topping is golden brown.
Serve warm, optional to add vanilla ice cream.
description: A classic Dutch apple pie with a sweet and buttery crumble topping, perfect for any occasion.

name: Dijon Mustard Chicken
author: System
method: Rub 4 chicken breasts with 30 g Dijon mustard and 2 minced garlic cloves.
Cook in a skillet over medium heat for 20 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked.
Pour 200 mL cream into the skillet, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 more minutes.
Finish with 5 mL lemon juice and serve.
description: Creamy and tangy Dijon mustard chicken, a simple yet flavorful dish for a hearty meal.

name: Date and Walnut Cake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Combine 250 g chopped dates and 100 g chopped walnuts with 200 g flour, 150 g sugar, and 3 beaten eggs into a batter.
Pour batter into a lined baking tin.
Bake for 55 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean.
Cool before serving.
description: A moist and rich date cake with crunchy walnuts, perfect with afternoon tea or as a dessert.

name: Dill Pickle Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, sauté 1 diced onion until translucent.
Add 300 g chopped dill pickles and 200 g cubed potatoes.
Pour in 1 L of vegetable broth and bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 100 mL cream and 30 mL pickle juice, heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh dill.
description: A unique and savory soup with a tangy pickle twist, enriched with creamy undertones.

name: Dark Chocolate Mousse
author: System
method: Melt 200 g dark chocolate gently over a double boiler, then let cool slightly.
Whip 300 mL heavy cream to soft peaks.
Fold whipped cream into cooled chocolate until well combined.
Divide mixture into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve chilled, optionally garnished with chocolate shavings.
description: A rich and velvety dark chocolate mousse, an indulgent dessert that's surprisingly easy to make.

name: Duck à l'Orange
author: System
method: Season 2 duck breasts with salt and pepper.
Sear duck skin-side down in a skillet over medium-high heat until golden, about 5 minutes each side.
Transfer duck to a preheated 200°C oven and roast for 8 minutes.
For the sauce, deglaze the skillet with 50 mL orange liqueur, add 150 mL chicken stock and the juice of 1 orange, and reduce by half.
Slice duck, serve with sauce.
description: Classic French dish featuring duck with a tangy orange sauce.

name: Dim Sum Shrimp Dumplings
author: System
method: Mix 200 g chopped shrimp with 50 g finely chopped bamboo shoots, 2 tbsp soy sauce, and 1 tbsp sesame oil.
Wrap mixture in 20 g dumpling wrappers and seal edges with water.
Steam dumplings in a bamboo steamer over boiling water for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with additional soy sauce for dipping.
description: Delicate and flavorful shrimp dumplings, a staple in Chinese cuisine.

name: Double Cheeseburger
author: System
method: Form 400 g ground beef into 4 thin patties.
Cook patties on a grill over medium heat for 4 minutes each side.
Top each with a slice of cheddar cheese during the last minute of cooking to melt.
Assemble burgers with buns, lettuce, tomato, and ketchup.
description: Juicy double cheeseburger with melted cheddar, a fast food classic.

name: Dried Fig Biscotti
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Mix 300 g flour, 150 g sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, and 2 beaten eggs into a dough.
Fold in 100 g chopped dried figs.
Shape dough into two logs, place on a baking sheet, and bake for 25 minutes.
Slice logs while warm, return slices to oven, and bake for another 10 minutes until crisp.
description: Crunchy biscotti with sweet dried figs, perfect for coffee dipping.

name: Dandelion Green Salad
author: System
method: Wash 300 g dandelion greens and pat dry.
Toss greens with 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste.
Top with 50 g crumbled goat cheese and 30 g toasted pine nuts before serving.
description: A refreshing and slightly bitter salad with dandelion greens, goat cheese, and pine nuts.

name: Deviled Crab Cakes
author: System
method: Combine 300 g crabmeat, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, 10 mL Worcestershire sauce, and 5 g paprika in a bowl.
Form mixture into 8 cakes and chill for 30 minutes to set.
Pan-fry in 30 mL oil over medium heat for 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce.
description: Savory crab cakes with a hint of spice, perfect for a light meal or appetizer.

name: Duck Ramen
author: System
method: Season 2 duck legs with salt and pepper, and roast at 200°C for 90 minutes until tender.
In a pot, simmer 1 L chicken broth with 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL mirin, and 1 clove minced garlic for 30 minutes.
Shred duck meat and add to broth. Cook 200 g ramen noodles in broth for 5 minutes.
Serve hot, topped with sliced green onions and boiled egg halves.
description: Rich and flavorful duck ramen with tender meat and a deeply seasoned broth.

name: Dandelion Wine
author: System
method: Pick 400 g fresh dandelion flowers and rinse thoroughly.
Boil flowers in 1 L water with 200 g sugar and the zest of 1 lemon until sugar dissolves.
Cool to room temperature, add 5 g yeast, and ferment in a sealed container for 60 days.
Strain and bottle the wine, then age for at least 6 months before serving.
description: Homemade dandelion wine with a floral and slightly sweet taste, perfect for special occasions.

name: Dulce de Leche Brownies
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Mix 100 g melted butter with 200 g sugar and 2 beaten eggs until smooth.
Stir in 100 g flour, 30 g cocoa powder, and 5 g salt.
Swirl in 100 g dulce de leche and pour into a greased baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out with moist crumbs.
Cool and cut into squares before serving.
description: Decadent brownies with rich swirls of dulce de leche, a chocolate lover’s dream.

name: Dijon Roasted Potatoes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss 500 g cubed potatoes with 30 mL olive oil, 20 g Dijon mustard, 5 g garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 35 minutes, stirring halfway through, until crispy and golden.
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: Crispy roasted potatoes with a tangy Dijon mustard coating, an easy and flavorful side dish.

name: Date Nut Loaf
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C.
In a bowl, mix 200 g chopped dates, 100 g chopped walnuts, 250 g flour, 100 g brown sugar, 5 g baking soda, and 1 beaten egg.
Add 250 mL boiling water and stir until combined.
Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove to cool completely on a wire rack.
description: Moist and hearty date nut loaf, perfect for breakfast or as a snack.

name: Dried Tomato Pesto Pasta
author: System
method: In a food processor, blend 150 g dried tomatoes, 50 g pine nuts, 50 g grated Parmesan, 2 cloves garlic, and 30 mL olive oil into a smooth paste.
Cook 400 g pasta according to package instructions, drain.
Toss hot pasta with tomato pesto.
Serve garnished with additional Parmesan and fresh basil leaves.
description: Rich and flavorful pasta coated in a homemade dried tomato pesto.

name: Duck Pate
author: System
method: In a skillet, cook 500 g duck liver and 1 chopped onion in 30 mL brandy until liver is browned.
Transfer to a food processor, add 200 g softened butter, 5 g thyme, and blend until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper, then press into a mold lined with cling film.
Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Unmold and serve with crackers or toast points.
description: A smooth and rich duck pate, infused with brandy and thyme, perfect for an elegant appetizer.

name: Dill Cucumber Salad
author: System
method: Thinly slice 300 g cucumbers and 1 small red onion.
In a bowl, mix 15 mL vinegar, 30 mL olive oil, 5 g chopped dill, salt, and pepper.
Add cucumbers and onion to the dressing and toss to coat.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
description: A light and refreshing salad featuring crisp cucumbers, dill, and a simple vinaigrette.

name: Dry Rubbed Steak
author: System
method: Mix 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, 5 g garlic powder, 5 g onion powder, and 5 g smoked paprika.
Rub mixture onto 500 g ribeye steak, covering all sides.
Let steak sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Grill over high heat for 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest steak for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
description: Perfectly seasoned steak with a homemade dry rub, grilled to juicy perfection.

name: Danish Blue Cheese Salad
author: System
method: Combine 150 g mixed salad greens, 100 g sliced cucumbers, and 50 g halved cherry tomatoes in a salad bowl.
Crumble 100 g Danish blue cheese over the top.
In a small jar, shake together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper to make dressing.
Drizzle dressing over the salad and toss gently before serving.
description: A fresh and sharp salad featuring Danish blue cheese and a simple homemade vinaigrette.

name: Duck and Orange Risotto
author: System
method: In a saucepan, cook 200 g chopped duck breast over medium heat until browned.
Add 1 chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Stir in 300 g Arborio rice until well coated with the duck fat.
Gradually add 1 L chicken stock, stirring continuously, until the rice is creamy and al dente, about 18 minutes.
Stir in the zest of 1 orange, juice of the orange, and 50 g grated Parmesan before serving.
description: Luxurious risotto with rich duck and vibrant orange flavors, finished with Parmesan.

name: Dark Ale Onion Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, melt 50 g butter and add 600 g thinly sliced onions, cooking on low heat until caramelized, about 30 minutes.
Stir in 1 tsp sugar and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Pour in 500 mL dark ale and 1 L beef broth, bring to a simmer, and cook for 45 minutes.
Serve hot with toasted baguette slices topped with melted Gruyere cheese.
description: Hearty onion soup enriched with dark ale, topped with a cheesy baguette slice.

name: Dried Apricot Compote
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 300 g dried apricots with 500 mL water, 100 g sugar, and 1 cinnamon stick.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove cinnamon stick and serve the compote warm or chilled.
description: Sweet and tangy dried apricot compote, perfect as a dessert or yogurt topping.

name: Double Chocolate Cookies
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
In a mixing bowl, cream together 100 g butter and 150 g sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in 1 egg and 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Mix in 200 g flour, 30 g cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking soda, and a pinch of salt until combined.
Stir in 100 g chopped dark chocolate and 100 g milk chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of the dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes or until the edges are set but the center is still soft.
Cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
description: Rich and gooey double chocolate cookies, loaded with dark and milk chocolate.

name: Dairy-Free Vanilla Pudding
author: System
method: In a saucepan, mix 500 mL almond milk, 100 g sugar, and 30 g cornstarch.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in 5 mL vanilla extract.
Pour into serving dishes and chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
description: A smooth and creamy vanilla pudding, perfect for those looking for a dairy-free dessert option.

name: Dandelion Honey Tea
author: System
method: Boil 500 mL water in a kettle.
Add 15 g dried dandelion leaves and steep for 10 minutes.
Strain the tea into cups and stir in 20 g honey.
Serve warm.
description: Herbal and soothing, this dandelion tea sweetened with honey is a comforting drink.

name: Dry-Aged Beef Tacos
author: System
method: Cook 500 g dry-aged beef strips in a skillet over high heat until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add 10 mL lime juice and 5 g cumin.
Warm 8 corn tortillas in a dry pan.
Assemble tacos by placing beef in tortillas, topped with 100 g chopped lettuce, 50 g diced tomatoes, and 30 g shredded cheese.
Serve with 30 mL salsa.
description: Flavorful and hearty tacos made with premium dry-aged beef, a festive and tasty meal.

name: Dijon Maple Glazed Salmon
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
In a small bowl, mix 30 g Dijon mustard, 30 mL maple syrup, 5 mL soy sauce, and 1 clove minced garlic.
Place 4 salmon fillets on a greased baking sheet and brush with the glaze.
Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Serve garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Sweet and tangy glazed salmon, a quick and elegant main dish perfect for any night of the week.

name: Dried Cherry and Almond Biscotti
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
In a large bowl, mix 250 g flour, 150 g sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, and 3 beaten eggs until combined.
Stir in 100 g dried cherries and 100 g chopped almonds.
Form the dough into two logs on a lined baking sheet and bake for 35 minutes.
Remove from oven, slice diagonally, and bake again for 10 minutes until crisp.
Cool on a wire rack.
description: Crunchy biscotti loaded with sweet dried cherries and nutty almonds, perfect for dipping in coffee or tea.

name: Duck Breast with Cherry Sauce
author: System
method: Score the skin of 2 duck breasts and season with salt and pepper.
Place skin side down in a cold skillet, turn heat to medium, and cook until fat is rendered and skin is crisp, about 8 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 5 minutes for medium rare. Rest for 10 minutes.
For the sauce, deglaze the pan with 50 mL red wine, add 100 g pitted cherries, 10 g sugar, and simmer until thickened.
Slice duck and serve with cherry sauce.
description: Tender duck breasts with a sweet and tangy cherry sauce, perfect for a sophisticated dinner.

name: Durian Smoothie
author: System
method: Combine 150 g durian flesh, 200 mL coconut milk, 50 g ice, and 10 mL honey in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately, garnished with a sprig of mint.
description: Creamy and distinctively flavored smoothie made with durian fruit and coconut milk.

name: Dilled Salmon Patties
author: System
method: Mix 400 g canned salmon, drained, with 100 g bread crumbs, 1 beaten egg, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g chopped dill.
Form into 8 patties.
Fry patties in 30 mL olive oil over medium heat until golden on each side, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve hot with tartar sauce.
description: Easy-to-make salmon patties with a fresh hint of dill, ideal for a quick meal.

name: Double Bean Chili
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic in 30 mL vegetable oil until soft.
Add 200 g chopped tomatoes, 400 g drained kidney beans, 400 g drained black beans, 500 mL vegetable broth, 10 g chili powder, and 5 g cumin.
Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, topped with shredded cheddar cheese and sour cream.
description: Hearty and spicy chili with kidney and black beans, perfect for a cold day.

name: Dill Pickled Beets
author: System
method: Peel and slice 500 g beets into thin strips.
In a saucepan, bring 250 mL water, 125 mL vinegar, 50 g sugar, and 5 g salt to a boil.
Add beets and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in 5 g chopped dill, then transfer to jars and seal.
Chill for at least 48 hours before serving.
description: Tangy and flavorful pickled beets with a hint of dill, a great addition to salads or as a side dish.

name: Dark Chocolate Fondue
author: System
method: In a double boiler, melt 300 g dark chocolate with 150 mL heavy cream until smooth.
Stir in 5 mL vanilla extract.
Transfer to a fondue pot and keep warm.
Serve with assorted fruits and marshmallows for dipping.
description: Rich and velvety dark chocolate fondue, perfect for dipping fruits and marshmallows.

name: Dijon Crusted Lamb Chops
author: System
method: Rub 4 lamb chops with 20 g Dijon mustard.
Coat with a mixture of 50 g breadcrumbs, 5 g rosemary, and 2 g salt.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat and cook lamb chops for 3 minutes each side for medium-rare.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving.
description: Savory lamb chops with a mustard and rosemary crust, cooked to perfection.

name: Duck Fat Potatoes
author: System
method: Cube 600 g potatoes and toss with 30 g duck fat, 5 g salt, and 2 g black pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C for 45 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden and crisp.
Garnish with 5 g chopped parsley and serve.
description: Crispy potatoes roasted in duck fat, seasoned simply with salt and pepper.

name: Dulce de Leche Crepes
author: System
method: Prepare crepe batter by whisking together 100 g flour, 250 mL milk, 1 beaten egg, and 1 g salt.
Cook thin crepes in a nonstick skillet, about 2 minutes per side.
Spread each crepe with 20 g dulce de leche, fold, and serve warm.
description: Sweet and creamy crepes filled with rich dulce de leche, a delightful dessert or breakfast treat.

name: Dragon Fruit Parfait
author: System
method: Cube 1 dragon fruit and layer in two glasses with 100 g yogurt and 30 g granola.
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used.
Top with a drizzle of 10 mL honey and a sprinkle of 5 g chia seeds.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.
description: A visually striking and healthy parfait with layers of dragon fruit, yogurt, and granola.

name: Deviled Egg Salad
author: System
method: Boil 8 eggs for 10 minutes, cool, peel, and chop.
Mix eggs with 50 g mayonnaise, 10 g mustard, 5 g paprika, salt, and pepper.
Stir in 30 g chopped celery and 20 g chopped onions.
Chill for 1 hour and serve on lettuce leaves.
description: A twist on traditional deviled eggs, turned into a delightful and creamy egg salad.

name: Dutch Baby Pancake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C and place a 25 cm cast iron skillet inside to heat.
Whisk together 100 g flour, 200 mL milk, 3 eggs, 30 g sugar, and 5 mL vanilla extract.
Remove skillet from oven, add 30 g butter to melt, then pour in batter.
Bake for 20 minutes until puffed and golden.
Serve immediately with powdered sugar and lemon wedges.
description: A large, fluffy pancake that bakes in the oven, with a custard-like texture.

name: Dry Fried String Beans
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL vegetable oil in a wok over high heat.
Add 500 g trimmed string beans and stir-fry until blistered and slightly charred, about 7 minutes.
Add 10 g minced garlic, 10 g minced ginger, and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Season with 5 mL soy sauce and 5 g sesame oil before serving.
description: Sichuan-inspired dish where string beans are fried to a crispy texture without any batter.

name: Dark Rye Bread
author: System
method: Combine 300 g rye flour, 200 g bread flour, 10 g salt, 5 g sugar, and 10 g active dry yeast in a large bowl.
Add 350 mL warm water and knead until smooth, about 10 minutes.
Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Shape into a loaf, let rise again for 30 minutes, then bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 30 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack.
description: Hearty and flavorful bread made from dark rye, perfect for sandwiches or toasting.

name: Dumpling Soup
author: System
method: Prepare dumplings by mixing 200 g minced pork, 50 g chopped cabbage, 20 g minced scallions, 5 g salt, and 5 g pepper.
Wrap mixture in 30 g dumpling wrappers.
Bring 1.5 L chicken broth to a boil, add dumplings, and cook for 5 minutes.
Season with 10 mL soy sauce and 5 g minced ginger.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.
description: Comforting soup with homemade pork dumplings simmered in a flavorful broth.

name: Duck and Watermelon Salad
author: System
method: Season 400 g duck breast with salt and pepper, sear in a hot skillet until medium rare, about 7 minutes per side. Let rest and slice thinly.
Combine sliced duck with 500 g cubed watermelon, 100 g arugula, and 50 g crumbled feta cheese in a large bowl.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, and 5 g honey for the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and serve immediately.
description: Refreshing summer salad with juicy watermelon and rich duck breast, dressed in a sweet balsamic glaze.

name: Date and Almond Energy Balls
author: System
method: In a food processor, blend 200 g pitted dates, 100 g almonds, and 50 g shredded coconut until sticky.
Form the mixture into 20 small balls.
Roll each ball in 30 g sesame seeds for coating.
Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours before serving.
description: No-bake energy balls packed with dates, almonds, and coconut, perfect for a quick snack or energy boost.

name: Dijon-Braised Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Trim and halve 500 g Brussels sprouts.
Heat 15 mL olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté sprouts until golden, about 5 minutes.
Add 100 mL chicken broth and 15 g Dijon mustard, cover and simmer for 10 minutes until tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.
description: Tender Brussels sprouts braised with Dijon mustard and chicken broth, a flavorful side dish.

name: Dark Soy Glazed Tofu
author: System
method: Cut 400 g firm tofu into cubes.
In a pan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil over medium heat and fry tofu until golden on all sides, about 8 minutes.
Add 30 mL dark soy sauce and 20 mL honey, glaze tofu evenly, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Sprinkle with 5 g sesame seeds and serve with steamed rice.
description: Crispy tofu cubes with a sweet and savory dark soy and honey glaze, sprinkled with sesame seeds.

name: Dry Spice Rubbed Ribs
author: System
method: Mix 10 g smoked paprika, 10 g brown sugar, 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, and 2 g cayenne pepper.
Rub the spice mix onto 1 kg pork ribs evenly.
Wrap ribs in foil and bake in a preheated 160°C oven for 3 hours.
Unwrap and grill for 10 minutes for a charred finish.
Serve hot with barbecue sauce.
description: Fall-off-the-bone pork ribs coated with a smoky and spicy dry rub, slow-baked and finished on the grill.

name: Dandelion Tea
author: System
method: Boil 1 L of water in a kettle.
Add 20 g of dried dandelion leaves and steep for 10 minutes.
Strain and serve hot, with optional honey or lemon for flavor.
description: A herbal detox tea made from dandelion leaves, known for its health benefits.

name: Dried Fig and Ricotta Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Roll out 200 g puff pastry and fit into a tart pan.
Mix 250 g ricotta with 50 g sugar, 1 beaten egg, and 5 mL vanilla extract, spread over pastry.
Top with 150 g chopped dried figs.
Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden.
Cool before serving.
description: Sweet and creamy tart with dried figs and a smooth ricotta filling.

name: Dijon Mustard Vinaigrette
author: System
method: In a jar, combine 30 mL Dijon mustard, 15 mL honey, 60 mL white wine vinegar, and 90 mL olive oil.
Shake vigorously until emulsified.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and use as a dressing for salads.
description: A tangy and slightly sweet mustard vinaigrette, perfect for dressing greens or vegetable salads.

name: Dark Chocolate Ganache
author: System
method: Chop 300 g dark chocolate into small pieces and place in a heatproof bowl.
Heat 250 mL heavy cream in a saucepan until just boiling.
Pour cream over chocolate, let sit for 5 minutes, then stir until smooth.
Use as a filling or topping for cakes, or let set and roll into truffles.
description: Rich and creamy chocolate ganache made with high-quality dark chocolate, versatile for various desserts.

name: Double Baked Sweet Potatoes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Bake 4 large sweet potatoes for 1 hour until soft.
Halve lengthwise, scoop out insides, leaving a thin layer of potato in the skin.
Mix potato flesh with 50 g butter, 30 g brown sugar, and 50 mL cream, spoon back into skins.
Bake for another 20 minutes until tops are browned.
Serve warm.
description: Twice-baked sweet potatoes with a creamy and sweet filling, topped with a crispy crust.

name: Dairy-Free Coconut Yogurt
author: System
method: Heat 1 L coconut milk to 40°C.
Mix in 5 g probiotic powder until well combined.
Pour mixture into a sterile jar, cover with a cloth, and let ferment in a warm place for 24 hours.
Refrigerate to thicken before serving.
description: A smooth and creamy alternative to traditional yogurt, made entirely from coconut milk.

name: Decadent Chocolate Truffles
author: System
method: Heat 250 mL heavy cream in a saucepan until it just begins to simmer.
Pour over 300 g finely chopped dark chocolate, let sit for 5 minutes, then stir until smooth.
Chill mixture for 2 hours, then form into small balls.
Roll truffles in cocoa powder, chopped nuts, or coconut flakes.
Chill again until firm before serving.
description: Rich and luxurious chocolate truffles, perfect for gifting or indulging.

name: Dill and Lemon Baked Salmon
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place 4 salmon fillets on a baking sheet.
Season with salt, pepper, 10 g chopped dill, and slices from 1 lemon.
Drizzle with 30 mL olive oil.
Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Serve immediately.
description: Flavorful salmon fillets enhanced with fresh dill and lemon, baked to perfection.

name: Dry Curry Chicken
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and cook until translucent.
Add 500 g chicken breast, cut into cubes, and brown.
Stir in 15 g curry powder, 5 g turmeric, and salt to taste.
Cook until chicken is done and spices are fragrant.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.
description: A robust chicken curry with intense flavors and no sauce, served best with steamed rice.

name: Dijon Roast Beef
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Rub 1 kg beef roast with a mixture of 30 g Dijon mustard, 5 g garlic powder, and 5 g thyme.
Roast in the oven for 1 hour, or until desired doneness.
Rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve with a side of roasted vegetables.
description: Succulent roast beef with a tangy Dijon crust, aromatic and ideal for a hearty meal.

name: Dark Cherry Compote
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 300 g pitted dark cherries, 50 g sugar, and 100 mL water.
Simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes until cherries are soft and the syrup has thickened.
Stir in 5 mL vanilla extract and cool before serving over pancakes or yogurt.
description: Sweet and slightly tart cherry compote, perfect as a topping for breakfast or dessert dishes.

name: Duck Fat Fries
author: System
method: Preheat your oven to 200°C.
Cut 800 g of potatoes into sticks and soak in water for 30 minutes to remove excess starch.
Dry thoroughly with a towel.
Toss the potatoes with 60 mL duck fat and spread on a baking sheet.
Bake for 45 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden and crispy.
Season with sea salt and serve with a side of garlic aioli.
description: Crispy and rich fries cooked in duck fat, with a perfect golden exterior and fluffy interior.

name: Dijon Maple Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Peel and slice 500 g carrots into batons.
In a bowl, mix 20 g Dijon mustard, 30 mL maple syrup, and 15 mL olive oil.
Toss the carrots in the mixture, then lay them on a baking tray.
Roast for 30 minutes, or until tender and caramelized.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
description: Sweet and tangy carrots roasted with a Dijon and maple syrup glaze, an easy and delicious side dish.

name: Dark Molasses Bread
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 400 g whole wheat flour, 100 g rye flour, 10 g salt, and 5 g yeast.
Warm 250 mL water and 100 mL molasses until lukewarm, then add to the dry ingredients.
Knead for 10 minutes until smooth.
Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
Shape into a loaf, place in a greased pan, and let rise again for 30 minutes.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 35 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack before slicing.
description: Hearty bread with a deep flavor from dark molasses, ideal for toasting or as a sandwich base.

name: Dry Spiced Chickpeas
author: System
method: Rinse and drain 400 g canned chickpeas.
Toss with 15 mL olive oil, 5 g cumin, 5 g smoked paprika, and salt to taste.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast at 200°C for 20 minutes until crispy.
Serve as a snack or as a topping for salads.
description: Crunchy, spiced chickpeas roasted to perfection, a healthy and satisfying snack.

name: Dill Pickle Deviled Eggs
author: System
method: Hard-boil 12 eggs, cool, peel, and halve.
Remove yolks and mix with 30 g mayonnaise, 20 g chopped dill pickles, 5 mL pickle juice, and 5 g mustard.
Pipe the mixture back into the egg whites.
Garnish with paprika and extra dill before serving.
description: A classic appetizer with a twist, featuring the tangy taste of dill pickles mixed into creamy deviled eggs.

name: Dulce de Leche Ice Cream
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 500 mL heavy cream, 250 mL whole milk, and 200 g sugar. Heat until sugar dissolves.
Remove from heat, stir in 200 g dulce de leche until smooth.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
Churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.
description: Creamy homemade ice cream with rich dulce de leche flavor, perfect for a sweet treat.

name: Date and Nut Bars
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
In a food processor, blend 300 g pitted dates, 100 g almonds, and 100 g walnuts until sticky.
Press the mixture into a lined 20x20 cm baking pan.
Bake for 20 minutes. Allow to cool and slice into bars.
Store in an airtight container.
description: Energy-packed bars with dates and nuts, ideal for a quick snack or energy boost on the go.

name: Dragon Fruit Salad
author: System
method: Peel and chop 2 dragon fruits into cubes.
Toss with 200 g mixed salad greens, 100 g sliced cucumbers, and 50 g blueberries.
Drizzle with a dressing made from 30 mL lime juice, 15 mL honey, and 15 mL olive oil.
Serve immediately for best freshness.
description: A vibrant and refreshing salad featuring dragon fruit, perfect for a light meal or side dish.

name: Duck Confit Tacos
author: System
method: Cook 4 duck leg confits in a slow cooker on low for 6 hours until tender.
Shred the duck meat.
Serve on warm corn tortillas with 100 g shredded cabbage, 50 g diced pineapple, and a drizzle of 30 mL chipotle sauce.
Garnish with cilantro before serving.
description: Unique and flavorful tacos filled with tender duck confit, complemented by the sweetness of pineapple and the spice of chipotle sauce.

name: Dark Chocolate Raspberry Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Roll out 200 g of pastry dough and press into a 22 cm tart pan. Bake for 20 minutes.
In a bowl, melt 300 g dark chocolate and 150 mL cream in a microwave, stir until smooth.
Pour chocolate mixture into the baked tart shell. Top with 200 g fresh raspberries.
Refrigerate for 2 hours until set. Serve chilled.
description: A decadent tart combining rich dark chocolate with fresh raspberries, set in a crisp pastry shell.

name: Duck Rillettes
author: System
method: Simmer 1 kg duck legs in a pot with 1 L duck fat, 3 cloves garlic, and 5 g thyme on low heat for 4 hours until meat is very tender.
Shred the meat and mix with 50 mL of the cooking fat, salt, and pepper.
Pack into a terrine or jar and cover with a layer of melted fat. Chill for at least 6 hours before serving.
description: Traditional French dish of slow-cooked, shredded duck preserved in fat, perfect as a spread on crusty bread.

name: Deviled Avocado Eggs
author: System
method: Hard boil 12 eggs, cool, peel, and halve.
Remove yolks and mix with 1 ripe avocado, 30 g mayonnaise, and 10 mL lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper, then pipe the mixture back into the egg whites.
Garnish with paprika and serve chilled.
description: A twist on classic deviled eggs, adding creamy avocado for a richer flavor and smoother texture.

name: Dijon Crusted Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Pat dry 4 cod fillets and spread 20 g Dijon mustard over each.
Mix 50 g breadcrumbs with 10 g chopped parsley and press onto the mustard-coated fillets.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with lemon wedges.
description: Tender cod fillets with a crispy mustard and breadcrumb crust, bursting with flavor.

name: Dairy-Free Spinach Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Prepare 200 g gluten-free pie crust and press into a 9-inch pie dish.
Sauté 200 g spinach and 1 chopped onion in 15 mL olive oil until soft.
In a blender, mix 300 mL coconut milk, 100 g tofu, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Combine spinach mixture with the coconut milk mixture, pour into crust.
Bake for 35 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
description: A wholesome and hearty quiche filled with spinach, set in a dairy-free, gluten-free crust.

name: Dulce de Leche Cheesecake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 160°C.
Combine 200 g crushed graham crackers with 50 g melted butter for the crust, press into a springform pan.
Beat 500 g cream cheese until smooth, add 100 g sugar, 200 g dulce de leche, and 3 eggs, one at a time.
Pour filling over crust, bake for 50 minutes.
Chill overnight. Top with a layer of dulce de leche before serving.
description: Luxuriously creamy cheesecake with a smooth dulce de leche topping, on a buttery graham cracker crust.

name: Dry Rubbed Barbecue Chicken
author: System
method: Mix 10 g paprika, 10 g brown sugar, 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, and 2 g cayenne pepper.
Rub the spice mix onto 1 kg of chicken thighs evenly.
Grill over medium heat for 25 minutes, turning occasionally, until fully cooked.
Serve hot with a side of coleslaw and cornbread.
description: Juicy grilled chicken coated with a sweet and spicy homemade dry rub, perfect for a summer barbecue.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
author: System
