method: Slice 2 large eggplants into 1 cm thick rounds.
Dip each slice in beaten egg, then coat with 200 g breadcrumbs mixed with 50 g grated Parmesan.
Fry in 60 mL olive oil until golden on each side.
Layer the eggplant with 500 mL marinara sauce and 250 g sliced mozzarella in a baking dish.
Bake at 180°C for 30 minutes.
Top with fresh basil before serving.
description: A classic Italian dish featuring layers of breaded eggplant, marinara sauce, and melted mozzarella cheese.

name: English Muffin Breakfast
author: System
method: Toast 4 English muffins until golden brown.
Cook 4 eggs to preference (fried or scrambled).
Layer each muffin half with a slice of cooked ham, an egg, and a slice of cheddar cheese.
Serve hot with a side of hash browns.
description: Hearty breakfast muffins with eggs, ham, and melted cheese, paired with crispy hash browns.

name: Espresso Chocolate Mousse
author: System
method: Melt 200 g dark chocolate in a double boiler.
Stir in 120 mL brewed espresso and let cool slightly.
Whip 300 mL heavy cream to soft peaks.
Fold the cream into the chocolate mixture.
Spoon into serving cups and chill for 3 hours before serving.
description: Rich and creamy mousse with a deep coffee flavor, topped with whipped cream or chocolate shavings.

name: Elderberry Syrup
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 200 g elderberries, 500 mL water, 200 g sugar, and the juice of 1 lemon.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes.
Strain the mixture, pressing berries to extract juice.
Bottle the syrup and store in the refrigerator.
description: Homemade elderberry syrup, perfect for flavoring drinks or as a natural remedy for colds.

name: Empanadas de Carne
author: System
method: Cook 500 g ground beef with 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, until browned.
Add 15 g paprika, 5 g cumin, and season with salt and pepper.
Roll out 500 g dough and cut into 12 circles.
Spoon beef mixture onto each circle, fold over, and seal edges.
Bake at 200°C for 20 minutes or until golden.
description: Traditional Latin American pastries filled with savory spiced beef, baked to a golden finish.

name: Egg Drop Soup
author: System
method: Bring 1 L chicken broth to a simmer.
Slowly stir in 3 beaten eggs, pouring in a thin stream to form ribbons.
Season with 5 mL soy sauce and a pinch of white pepper.
Garnish with 10 g chopped green onions and serve hot.
description: A simple and comforting Chinese soup, featuring silky egg ribbons in a flavorful chicken broth.

name: English Pea Salad
author: System
method: Combine 400 g cooked and cooled English peas, 100 g diced cheddar cheese, and 100 g chopped celery in a bowl.
Mix 30 g mayonnaise and 10 mL apple cider vinegar for the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and chill before serving.
description: A refreshing and crunchy pea salad with cheddar cheese and a creamy dressing, perfect for picnics or as a side dish.

name: Espresso Panna Cotta
author: System
method: Heat 500 mL heavy cream, 100 g sugar, and 30 mL espresso in a saucepan until just simmering.
Sprinkle 5 g gelatin over 60 mL cold water and let bloom for 5 minutes.
Stir the gelatin mixture into the hot cream until fully dissolved.
Pour into molds and chill for at least 4 hours until set.
Serve with a drizzle of chocolate sauce.
description: Smooth and creamy panna cotta infused with rich espresso, a perfect dessert for coffee lovers.

name: Eggplant Rollatini
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants lengthwise into 1 cm thick strips.
Grill strips until tender and set aside.
Mix 200 g ricotta, 50 g spinach, 1 beaten egg, and season with salt and pepper.
Place a spoonful of filling on each eggplant slice, roll up, and place seam side down in a baking dish.
Top with 250 mL marinara sauce and 100 g shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 180°C for 25 minutes until cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with basil before serving.
description: Delicious eggplant slices rolled with a ricotta and spinach filling, baked in marinara sauce topped with mozzarella.

name: Endive and Apple Salad
author: System
method: Combine 4 chopped endives and 2 sliced apples in a large salad bowl.
Whisk together 30 mL apple cider vinegar, 15 mL honey, and 45 mL olive oil for the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and top with 50 g crumbled blue cheese.
Serve chilled.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad with a sweet and tangy dressing, perfect for a light lunch or side dish.

name: Eclairs with Pastry Cream
author: System
method: Prepare choux pastry and pipe into 10 cm long eclairs on a baking sheet.
Bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until puffed and golden.
For the filling, heat 250 mL milk with vanilla pod to a simmer.
Whisk 3 egg yolks with 50 g sugar and 20 g flour, then temper with hot milk.
Cook until thickened. Fill eclairs with pastry cream.
Top with chocolate glaze before serving.
description: Classic French eclairs filled with rich vanilla pastry cream and topped with smooth chocolate glaze.

name: English Toffee
author: System
method: Butter a 20x20 cm baking dish.
In a heavy saucepan, combine 200 g butter, 200 g sugar, 15 mL water, and 5 mL vanilla extract.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture reaches 150°C (hard crack stage).
Pour into prepared dish. Sprinkle 100 g chopped almonds on top.
Let cool and break into pieces.
description: Crunchy and buttery toffee topped with almonds, a sweet treat that's hard to resist.

name: Eggnog
author: System
method: Whisk 6 egg yolks with 100 g sugar until light and fluffy.
Slowly add 500 mL whole milk and 250 mL heavy cream, whisking constantly.
Stir in 5 mL vanilla extract and a pinch of nutmeg.
Chill for at least 2 hours.
Serve with a sprinkle of cinnamon and an optional shot of rum.
description: Traditional holiday drink made from a rich, creamy base of eggs, milk, and spices, served chilled with a hint of rum.

name: Esquites (Mexican Street Corn Salad)
author: System
method: Cook 500 g corn kernels in a skillet with 15 mL butter until charred, about 10 minutes.
Mix corn with 50 g mayonnaise, 50 g cotija cheese, 5 mL lime juice, and chopped cilantro.
Season with chili powder and salt.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A savory, tangy, and creamy salad made from charred corn, mixed with mayo, cheese, and spices—a popular Mexican street food.

name: Egg Foo Young
author: System
method: In a bowl, whisk 6 eggs with 30 mL soy sauce and 5 mL sesame oil.
Stir in 100 g cooked shrimp, 50 g chopped green onions, and 100 g bean sprouts.
Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a skillet. Pour in egg mixture to form 4 pancakes, cook until golden on both sides.
Serve with a side of soy sauce and hot mustard.
description: A Chinese-American omelet with shrimp, green onions, and bean sprouts, served with dipping sauces.

name: Elderflower Cordial
author: System
method: In a large pot, bring 1 L water to a boil with 800 g sugar until dissolved.
Add 20 elderflower heads, zest of 2 lemons, and juice of 2 lemons. Let infuse off the heat for 24 hours.
Strain through a fine mesh, bottle, and refrigerate.
Dilute with water or sparkling water to serve.
description: A fragrant and refreshing drink made from fresh elderflowers, perfect for summer refreshments.

name: Escargot in Garlic Butter
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place 24 cleaned escargot in snail dishes.
Mix 100 g softened butter with 5 g minced garlic, 5 g chopped parsley, and salt.
Top each escargot with a dollop of garlic butter.
Bake for 10 minutes until butter is sizzling.
Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: Classic French appetizer featuring snails baked in a savory garlic and parsley butter.

name: English Cucumber Sandwiches
author: System
method: Thinly slice 1 English cucumber.
Spread 30 g softened cream cheese on 12 slices of white bread.
Layer cucumber slices on 6 of the bread slices, top with a sprinkle of dill and salt.
Cover with the remaining bread slices, trim the crusts, and cut into quarters.
Serve immediately or keep chilled until serving.
description: Light and refreshing cucumber sandwiches with cream cheese and dill, ideal for afternoon tea or a light snack.

name: Eggnog French Toast
author: System
method: In a shallow dish, whisk together 250 mL eggnog, 2 eggs, and 1 tsp cinnamon.
Dip 8 slices of brioche bread into the mixture, allowing to soak for 1 minute on each side.
Cook on a buttered griddle over medium heat until golden brown on each side.
Serve with maple syrup and a dusting of powdered sugar.
description: Rich and festive French toast made with eggnog and cinnamon, served warm with syrup.

name: Endive Stuffed with Goat Cheese and Walnuts
author: System
method: Separate leaves from 4 endives.
In each leaf, place a spoonful of soft goat cheese and sprinkle with chopped walnuts.
Drizzle with balsamic reduction and garnish with chopped chives before serving.
description: Elegant and simple appetizer, perfect for gatherings, featuring crisp endive leaves filled with creamy goat cheese and crunchy walnuts.

name: Eggplant and Chickpea Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, sauté until soft.
Add 1 large diced eggplant, 400 g drained chickpeas, 400 g diced tomatoes, and 500 mL vegetable broth.
Simmer for 30 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Stir in 10 g chopped parsley and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: Hearty and flavorful stew with eggplant and chickpeas, simmered in a tomato broth, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Elderflower Lemonade
author: System
method: In a pitcher, combine the juice of 6 lemons with 750 mL of cold water and 100 g of sugar, stir until sugar dissolves.
Add 60 mL of elderflower cordial and stir to mix.
Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Serve over ice with lemon slices and fresh elderflower sprigs.
description: Refreshing homemade lemonade enhanced with the subtle floral notes of elderflower, perfect for hot summer days.

name: English Ale Onion Soup
author: System
method: Caramelize 500 g sliced onions in 30 mL butter over low heat for 40 minutes.
Stir in 15 g flour, cook for 2 minutes.
Add 500 mL English ale and 1 L beef broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with toasted bread topped with melted cheddar cheese.
description: A robust and flavorful soup featuring caramelized onions deglazed with English ale, topped with a cheesy toast.

name: Egg and Spinach Breakfast Muffins
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Grease a muffin tin. Divide 200 g fresh spinach among the cups.
Crack an egg into each cup, season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 15 minutes until eggs are set.
Serve hot with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan.
description: Protein-rich breakfast muffins with fresh spinach and eggs, ideal for an on-the-go morning.

name: Emmental Cheese Dip
author: System
method: In a saucepan, melt 200 g Emmental cheese with 100 mL cream, stirring until smooth.
Add 5 mL Dijon mustard and a pinch of nutmeg, mix well.
Keep warm and serve with pretzels or vegetable sticks.
description: Creamy and smooth cheese dip made with Emmental cheese, enhanced with a hint of mustard and nutmeg.

name: Exotic Fruit Salad
author: System
method: Combine 100 g diced mango, 100 g diced papaya, 100 g diced pineapple, and 50 g pomegranate seeds in a large bowl.
Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the fruit and toss gently.
Chill for 1 hour before serving, garnished with fresh mint leaves.
description: A vibrant and refreshing salad featuring a medley of exotic fruits, perfect for a healthy dessert or side dish.

name: Escalope of Veal
author: System
method: Pound 4 veal cutlets to 5 mm thickness.
Dredge each cutlet in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry in 60 mL olive oil over medium heat until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with lemon wedges and a side of sautéed greens.
description: Tender veal cutlets breaded and fried until crisp, served with a fresh lemon squeeze.

name: Egg Salad with Capers and Dill
author: System
method: Boil 8 eggs, cool, peel, and chop roughly.
Mix eggs with 30 g mayonnaise, 15 g capers, and 5 g chopped dill.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve chilled on rye bread or as a filling for tomatoes.
description: Classic egg salad enhanced with the tangy flavors of capers and the freshness of dill, ideal for sandwiches or as a standalone dish.

name: Espresso Martini
author: System
method: Combine 60 mL vodka, 30 mL coffee liqueur, 30 mL fresh espresso, and 15 mL simple syrup in a shaker.
Fill with ice and shake vigorously for 30 seconds.
Strain into chilled martini glasses and garnish with three coffee beans.
description: A sophisticated cocktail with a robust coffee flavor, perfect for a classy evening.

name: Eggplant Lasagna
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants and grill until tender.
Layer grilled eggplant, 500 mL marinara sauce, and 300 g ricotta in a baking dish.
Repeat layers, ending with marinara and top with 200 g shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 175°C for 45 minutes.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
description: A hearty, low-carb lasagna using eggplant slices instead of pasta, layered with ricotta and mozzarella.

name: Endive Boats with Crab Salad
author: System
method: Mix 200 g crab meat with 30 g mayonnaise, 10 g chopped chives, 5 mL lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Separate leaves from 3 endives and arrange on a platter.
Spoon crab mixture into each leaf and garnish with paprika.
Chill before serving.
description: Fresh and light appetizer featuring crisp endive leaves filled with a creamy crab salad.

name: Escarole and White Bean Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic in 30 mL olive oil until soft.
Add 1 head chopped escarole and cook until wilted.
Pour in 1 L vegetable broth and add 400 g canned white beans.
Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with grated Parmesan.
description: A nourishing and comforting soup with escarole, white beans, and a savory broth.

name: English Pea Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, simmer 500 g fresh English peas, 1 diced potato, and 1 L chicken broth until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the soup in a blender until smooth.
Return to the pot, reheat gently, and season with salt and mint.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream.
description: A vibrant and creamy spring pea soup with a hint of mint, served with sour cream for added richness.

name: Eggs Benedict with Spinach
author: System
method: Toast 4 English muffins and keep warm.
Poach 8 eggs in simmering water with a little vinegar for 3-4 minutes.
Sauté 200 g fresh spinach in 15 mL olive oil until wilted.
For hollandaise, whisk 4 egg yolks, 15 mL lemon juice over double boiler until thickened, then slowly add 100 g melted butter.
Layer muffins with spinach, poached eggs, and spoon hollandaise over.
Serve immediately.
description: A classic brunch dish made with poached eggs and fresh spinach on English muffins, topped with creamy hollandaise sauce.

name: Elk Steak with Juniper Berry Sauce
author: System
method: Season 2 elk steaks with salt and pepper.
Grill over high heat to desired doneness, 6 minutes per side for medium-rare.
For the sauce, sauté 10 g crushed juniper berries, 1 minced shallot in 15 mL olive oil. Add 125 mL red wine and reduce by half.
Finish sauce with 30 mL cream, simmer until thick.
Serve steaks with sauce drizzled over.
description: Rich and flavorful elk steaks paired with a unique juniper berry sauce, offering a taste of the wilderness.

name: Eggplant Caponata
author: System
method: Dice 2 large eggplants and salt heavily; let sit for 30 minutes, then rinse and dry.
In a large skillet, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat, add eggplant, and fry until golden.
Add 1 diced onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cooking until soft.
Stir in 200 g chopped tomatoes, 50 mL red wine vinegar, 15 g capers, and 50 g olives.
Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened. Stir in 10 g chopped basil before serving.
description: A traditional Sicilian dish featuring eggplant with capers, olives, and a tangy vinegar touch.

name: Eel Sushi
author: System
method: Grill 200 g of eel until crispy and glazed with eel sauce.
Prepare 200 g sushi rice according to package instructions.
Slice the eel into strips and lay atop hand-pressed blocks of rice.
Drizzle with additional eel sauce and garnish with thinly sliced cucumber and sesame seeds.
description: Delicate sushi featuring grilled eel, seasoned rice, and crisp cucumber accents, perfect for sushi enthusiasts.

name: Egg Custard Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Roll out 250 g of puff pastry and line a 22 cm tart pan; chill for 20 minutes.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 100 g sugar, 250 mL milk, and 5 mL vanilla extract; strain into pastry shell.
Bake for 35 minutes or until set and golden.
Cool slightly before slicing.
description: Smooth and creamy custard in a flaky pastry shell, a beloved classic dessert.

name: Elderflower Cheesecake
author: System
method: Blend 200 g digestive biscuits to form crumbs, mix with 100 g melted butter, and press into a springform pan.
Beat 500 g cream cheese with 150 g sugar until smooth. Add 100 mL elderflower cordial and 3 eggs, one at a time.
Pour over the crust and bake at 160°C for 50 minutes. Chill overnight.
Top with elderflower jelly before serving.
description: A unique floral cheesecake with a biscuit base, infused with elderflower and topped with a delicate jelly.

name: Eggplant and Tomato Gratin
author: System
method: Slice 2 eggplants and 3 tomatoes. Layer in a baking dish, alternating with slices of mozzarella.
Sprinkle each layer with salt, pepper, and Italian herbs.
Top with a mixture of 50 g breadcrumbs and 50 g grated Parmesan.
Drizzle with 30 mL olive oil and bake at 190°C for 45 minutes until golden and bubbly.
description: A hearty vegetarian gratin with layers of eggplant, tomato, and mozzarella, topped with a crispy breadcrumb crust.

name: Egg Fried Rice
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL sesame oil in a large wok.
Add 3 beaten eggs, scramble until just set.
Add 500 g cold cooked rice, 100 g peas, and 100 g chopped carrots, fry until heated through.
Season with 30 mL soy sauce and 5 g white pepper. Garnish with sliced green onions before serving.
description: A quick and easy meal, featuring stir-fried rice with vegetables and fluffy scrambled eggs.

name: Eggs Florentine
author: System
method: Blanch 200 g fresh spinach in boiling water, drain and chop.
Butter 4 small ramekins and divide spinach among them.
Crack an egg into each ramekin, season with salt and pepper.
Place ramekins in a baking dish, add hot water to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
Bake at 175°C for 15-20 minutes until the eggs are set.
Serve with hollandaise sauce.
description: Classic Eggs Florentine with steamed spinach and eggs, topped with creamy hollandaise sauce.

name: English Beef Stew
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg beef chunks in 30 mL oil in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped carrots, 2 chopped celery stalks, and cook until softened.
Stir in 15 g flour, then add 500 mL beef broth and 250 mL stout beer.
Simmer covered for 2 hours until beef is tender.
Add 200 g cubed potatoes, cook for an additional 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, and serve with crusty bread.
description: Hearty English stew made with beef, root vegetables, and stout beer, simmered to perfection.

name: Eggplant Bolognese
author: System
method: Dice 1 large eggplant and sauté in 30 mL olive oil until golden.
Add 1 minced onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in 400 g crushed tomatoes, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Finish with 10 g chopped basil and serve over cooked pasta.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A vegetarian twist on the classic Bolognese, using eggplant for a hearty and satisfying sauce.

name: Escarole Salad with Gorgonzola and Pears
author: System
method: Chop 1 head of escarole and toss with 1 sliced pear, 50 g crumbled Gorgonzola, and 30 g toasted walnuts.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL white wine vinegar, 5 mL honey, salt, and pepper to make dressing.
Drizzle dressing over salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately.
description: Fresh escarole paired with sweet pears, pungent Gorgonzola cheese, and crunchy walnuts, dressed in a light vinaigrette.

name: Entrecote with Green Peppercorn Sauce
author: System
method: Season 2 entrecote steaks with salt and sear in a hot pan with 15 mL oil until desired doneness.
Remove steaks and rest. Add 30 mL brandy to the pan and deglaze.
Add 100 mL cream and 10 g green peppercorns, simmer until thickened.
Serve sauce over steaks with a side of roasted potatoes.
description: Juicy entrecote steaks served with a rich and creamy green peppercorn sauce, a classic French dish.

name: Egg and Chorizo Breakfast Tacos
author: System
method: Cook 200 g chorizo in a skillet until crispy.
Remove chorizo and use the fat to scramble 6 eggs.
Warm 8 corn tortillas in a dry skillet.
Assemble tacos with scrambled eggs, chorizo, and top with 50 g shredded cheddar, fresh cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
Serve hot.
description: Spicy and filling breakfast tacos with chorizo and eggs, garnished with cheese and fresh herbs.

name: Endive with Roquefort and Pear
author: System
method: Separate leaves from 3 endives.
In each leaf, place a slice of pear and a small piece of Roquefort cheese.
Drizzle with 15 mL walnut oil and sprinkle with chopped walnuts before serving.
description: A chic appetizer featuring crisp endive leaves filled with creamy Roquefort and sweet pear slices.

name: Espresso Gelato
author: System
method: Whisk together 500 mL whole milk, 250 mL heavy cream, 150 g sugar, and 60 mL espresso.
Heat mixture just until it begins to simmer, then remove from heat.
Chill the mixture thoroughly in the refrigerator.
Churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze until firm before serving.
description: Rich and creamy homemade gelato with a strong espresso flavor, perfect for coffee lovers.

name: English Lemon Curd Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Roll out 300 g shortcrust pastry and line a 23 cm tart tin; blind bake for 15 minutes.
In a saucepan, combine juice and zest of 4 lemons, 200 g sugar, and 100 g butter. Cook over low heat until melted.
Whisk in 3 beaten eggs and cook until mixture thickens.
Pour lemon curd into the baked pastry shell. Bake for 10 minutes.
Cool completely before serving.
description: A delightful tart filled with smooth and tangy lemon curd, encased in a buttery pastry shell.

name: Egg Drop Soup with Tomatoes
author: System
method: Bring 1.5 L chicken broth to a simmer.
Stir in 200 g diced tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Slowly pour in 4 beaten eggs, stirring constantly to form ribbons.
Season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with chopped green onions.
Serve hot.
description: A comforting and simple Chinese soup, enhanced with fresh tomatoes and silky egg ribbons.

name: Enchiladas Suizas
author: System
method: Cook 500 g shredded chicken with 200 mL green salsa.
Soften 12 corn tortillas in hot oil for a few seconds each.
Fill each tortilla with chicken, roll up, and place in a baking dish.
Cover with 300 mL cream and 200 g grated Swiss cheese.
Bake at 180°C for 30 minutes until bubbly.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and sliced red onion before serving.
description: Creamy and spicy rolled tortillas filled with salsa-cooked chicken and topped with Swiss cheese.

name: Eggplant Tikka Masala
author: System
method: Cube 2 large eggplants and toss with 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast at 200°C for 25 minutes until tender.
In a pan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil, add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp minced ginger. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add 1 tbsp garam masala, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp cumin, and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in 400 g canned tomatoes and 200 mL coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Add roasted eggplant, simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with basmati rice.
description: A vegetarian twist on the classic tikka masala, featuring roasted eggplant in a creamy, spiced tomato sauce.

name: English Scones with Clotted Cream
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Sift 250 g self-raising flour, 30 g sugar, a pinch of salt into a bowl. Rub in 50 g butter until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
Add 150 mL milk and mix to form a soft dough.
Turn out onto a floured surface, knead lightly and roll out to 2 cm thick. Cut into rounds with a biscuit cutter.
Place on a baking sheet and brush with beaten egg.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until risen and golden.
Serve warm with clotted cream and jam.
description: Classic English scones, perfect for afternoon tea, served warm with luxurious clotted cream and jam.

name: Egg Salad with Avocado
author: System
method: Hard boil 6 eggs, cool, peel and chop.
In a bowl, mash 1 ripe avocado and mix with the chopped eggs.
Add 2 tbsp mayonnaise, 1 tsp mustard, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve on whole wheat bread or over a bed of lettuce.
description: A healthy twist on traditional egg salad, using creamy avocado instead of extra mayo, served as a sandwich or salad.

name: Espresso Brownies
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 175°C.
Melt 200 g dark chocolate with 100 g butter. Stir in 30 mL espresso.
Whisk in 200 g sugar, 3 eggs, and 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Fold in 100 g flour and a pinch of salt. Pour batter into a greased 20x20 cm pan.
Bake for 25 minutes until just set.
Cool before cutting into squares.
description: Rich and fudgy brownies infused with espresso, combining deep chocolate flavor with a coffee kick.

name: Elk Burgers with Blue Cheese
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground elk meat with salt and pepper, form into 4 patties.
Grill over medium heat for 5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Top each patty with 25 g blue cheese during the last minute of grilling.
Serve on toasted buns with lettuce, tomato, and onion.
description: Juicy grilled elk burgers topped with tangy blue cheese, served on a classic burger bun with fresh toppings.

name: Eggplant and Lentil Stew
author: System
method: Dice 2 large eggplants and sauté in 30 mL olive oil until golden.
Add 1 chopped onion, 3 cloves minced garlic, and sauté until translucent.
Stir in 200 g red lentils, 1 L vegetable broth, and 400 g diced tomatoes. Bring to a simmer.
Cook for 35 minutes or until lentils are tender. Stir in 10 g chopped parsley.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
description: Hearty vegetarian stew with eggplant and lentils, rich in flavor and perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Eggs in Purgatory
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL olive oil in a skillet, add 2 cloves minced garlic and 1 diced onion, cook until soft.
Add 500 mL tomato sauce and bring to a simmer.
Crack 4 eggs into the sauce, cover and cook until eggs are set, about 6 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Sprinkle with chopped basil.
Serve with crusty bread.
description: Simple yet bold dish of eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce, garnished with fresh basil.

name: English Roast Chicken
author: System
method: Rub a whole chicken (about 1.5 kg) with a mix of 10 g salt, 5 g pepper, and 15 mL olive oil.
Stuff with a halved lemon and a bunch of thyme.
Roast at 200°C for 1 hour 30 minutes, or until juices run clear.
Let rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with roasted potatoes and carrots.
description: Classic English roast chicken with lemon and thyme, served with traditional roasted vegetables.

name: Earl Grey Tea Cake
author: System
method: Infuse 250 mL milk with 3 Earl Grey tea bags; heat and let steep for 10 minutes.
Cream 200 g sugar with 100 g butter. Add 3 eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Fold in 250 g flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and the tea-infused milk.
Pour batter into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 175°C for 50 minutes.
Cool in pan, then turn out and dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: Moist loaf cake infused with the distinctive flavor of Earl Grey tea, topped with a light sugar dusting.

name: Enoki Mushroom Omelette
author: System
method: Clean 100 g enoki mushrooms and trim the ends.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 15 mL milk, salt, and pepper.
In a skillet, heat 10 mL olive oil. Sauté mushrooms for 2 minutes.
Pour eggs over mushrooms, cook until the omelette sets, folding gently.
Serve hot, garnished with chives.
description: Light and fluffy omelette filled with delicate enoki mushrooms, perfect for a quick and nutritious meal.

name: Eggplant Parmesan Stacks
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants into 1 cm thick rounds. Salt and let sit for 30 minutes, then rinse and pat dry.
Dredge eggplant slices in flour, dip in beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry in 60 mL olive oil until golden on both sides. Drain on paper towels.
Layer eggplant with 250 g sliced mozzarella and 200 mL marinara sauce in a baking dish.
Bake at 190°C for 20 minutes until cheese is bubbly.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
description: Layers of crispy eggplant with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella, baked to perfection.

name: Elderflower and Lemon Sorbet
author: System
method: In a saucepan, dissolve 200 g sugar in 500 mL water over medium heat. Remove from heat.
Stir in 100 mL elderflower cordial and the juice of 2 lemons. Chill the mixture thoroughly.
Freeze in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Serve in chilled bowls, garnished with lemon zest.
description: Refreshing and floral sorbet with a zesty lemon flavor, perfect for a light dessert or palate cleanser.

name: English Pea and Mint Soup
author: System
method: In a saucepan, sauté 1 chopped onion in 15 mL butter until translucent.
Add 500 g fresh peas and 750 mL vegetable broth. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 10 minutes.
Add 30 g fresh mint leaves and puree the soup with an immersion blender until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot or chilled, garnished with crème fraîche.
description: A vibrant green soup that's light and refreshing, with the sweetness of peas and a hint of mint.

name: Empanadas de Pollo
author: System
method: Cook 400 g minced chicken with 1 diced onion, 1 minced garlic clove, and 50 g chopped bell peppers until chicken is done.
Add 10 mL cumin, 5 g paprika, salt, and pepper. Let cool.
Roll out 500 g dough, cut into circles, spoon filling onto each, fold and seal.
Bake at 200°C for 20 minutes or fry until golden. Serve with salsa.
description: Savory chicken-filled pastries, spiced with cumin and paprika, perfect for snacks or a light meal.

name: Escabeche of Vegetables
author: System
method: Slice 1 carrot, 1 bell pepper, and 1 onion into thin strips. Fry in 30 mL olive oil until just tender.
Add 250 mL white wine vinegar, 100 mL water, 10 g sugar, and bring to a boil. Add a pinch of salt.
Pour hot mixture over 200 g cauliflower florets in a bowl. Let cool, then refrigerate overnight.
Serve chilled as a condiment or side dish.
description: Pickled vegetable medley in a tangy marinade, perfect as a refreshing side or appetizer.

name: Eggnog Pancakes
author: System
method: In a bowl, mix 200 g flour, 5 g baking powder, 5 g sugar, and a pinch of nutmeg.
In another bowl, whisk together 250 mL eggnog, 1 egg, and 30 mL melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. Heat a griddle and pour 60 mL batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve with maple syrup and a dusting of powdered sugar.
description: Festive pancakes made with rich eggnog and a hint of nutmeg, perfect for holiday breakfasts.

name: Eggplant Rollatini with Spinach
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants lengthwise into 1 cm thick slices. Salt lightly and set aside for 30 minutes, then pat dry.
Grill eggplant slices until soft and pliable, about 2 minutes per side.
Mix 200 g ricotta, 100 g chopped spinach, 50 g grated Parmesan, 1 beaten egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Place a spoonful of filling on each eggplant slice, roll up tightly, and place seam side down in a baking dish.
Top with 300 mL marinara sauce and 100 g shredded mozzarella. Bake at 175°C for 25 minutes.
Garnish with basil before serving.
description: Sliced eggplant filled with a creamy spinach and ricotta mixture, baked with marinara and mozzarella.

name: English Raspberry Trifle
author: System
method: Layer 200 g sponge cake, cut into pieces, in the bottom of a large glass bowl.
Sprinkle with 20 mL sherry, then layer 200 g fresh raspberries over the cake.
Mix 500 mL custard with 100 mL whipped cream and pour over the raspberries.
Top with an additional 200 mL whipped cream and garnish with 50 g toasted almonds.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
description: A traditional British dessert with layers of sponge cake, raspberries, creamy custard, and whipped cream.

name: Elderflower Spritz
author: System
method: Fill two glasses with ice.
Pour 50 mL elderflower cordial and 50 mL gin into each glass.
Top with 100 mL sparkling water and a splash of lime juice.
Stir gently and garnish with lime slices and mint leaves.
description: A refreshing and floral cocktail, perfect for summer evenings, featuring elderflower and gin.

name: Empanadas with Chorizo and Potatoes
author: System
method: Cook 200 g diced chorizo and 300 g diced potatoes in a skillet until the potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat, stir in 100 g shredded cheese, and season with paprika and salt.
Roll out 500 g pastry dough, cut into circles, fill each with the chorizo mixture, fold and seal.
Bake at 200°C for 20 minutes or until golden. Serve with salsa verde.
description: Savory pastry filled with a spicy mix of chorizo, potatoes, and melted cheese, baked to a perfect golden brown.

name: Egg Drop Soup with Shiitake
author: System
method: Bring 1.5 L chicken broth to a simmer. Add 100 g sliced shiitake mushrooms and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in 1 tbsp soy sauce and a pinch of white pepper.
Slowly pour in 3 beaten eggs, stirring constantly to create ribbons.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions and a drizzle of sesame oil.
description: A comforting soup enriched with earthy shiitake mushrooms and delicate egg ribbons, seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil.

name: Escalivada (Catalan Roasted Vegetables)
author: System
method: Slice 1 eggplant, 2 bell peppers, and 2 onions into large pieces.
Place vegetables on a baking sheet, drizzle with 30 mL olive oil, and season with salt.
Roast at 200°C for 40 minutes until tender and charred.
Peel the skins off the peppers. Serve vegetables warm or at room temperature, drizzled with more olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
description: Traditional Catalan dish of roasted vegetables, including eggplant, bell peppers, and onions, enhanced with olive oil and vinegar.

name: Egg and Asparagus Tart
author: System
method: Roll out 300 g puff pastry and line a tart pan. Prick the base with a fork.
Blanch 200 g asparagus in boiling water for 2 minutes, then arrange on the pastry.
Beat 4 eggs with 100 mL cream, season with salt and pepper, and pour over the asparagus.
Bake at 180°C for 25 minutes until set and golden.
Serve warm, garnished with grated Parmesan.
description: A simple yet elegant tart featuring tender asparagus and a creamy egg custard in a flaky pastry shell.

name: Egg Curry
author: System
method: Hard boil 6 eggs, peel and set aside.
Heat 30 mL vegetable oil in a pan. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tbsp minced ginger, sauté until golden.
Stir in 1 tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp turmeric, and 1 tsp cumin, cook for 1 minute.
Add 400 mL coconut milk and 200 g chopped tomatoes, bring to a simmer.
Add eggs, cover and simmer gently for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with steamed rice.
description: Rich and spicy egg curry cooked in a fragrant tomato and coconut sauce, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Escarole and Bean Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 2 chopped garlic cloves and 1 chopped onion, cook until soft.
Add 1 head of chopped escarole and cook until wilted, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 1 L chicken broth and 400 g canned white beans. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty and healthy soup combining bitter escarole with creamy white beans, topped with Parmesan.

name: Fruity French Toast
author: System
method: In a mixing bowl, whisk together 3 eggs and 250 mL of milk until well combined.
Soak each slice of white bread in the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are fully coated.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook the soaked bread for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Serve the French toast hot, topped with 200 g of mixed berries.
Drizzle 50 mL of maple syrup over the toast before serving and dust with 25 g of powdered sugar.
description: A sweet breakfast featuring fluffy French toast topped with mixed berries and a drizzle of maple syrup.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of fettuccine noodles in boiling water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes, then drain.
In a saucepan, melt 50 g of butter and sauté 1 minced garlic clove until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add 200 mL of heavy cream and bring to a simmer, then stir in 100 g of grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Toss the cooked fettuccine with the Alfredo sauce until evenly coated.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan if desired.
description: Creamy and rich, this classic pasta dish combines fettuccine noodles with a cheesy garlic sauce.

name: Fiesta Chicken Salad
author: System
method: Grill 400 g of chicken breast over medium heat until fully cooked, about 6-7 minutes per side, then slice thinly.
In a large bowl, combine sliced chicken with 200 g of chopped romaine lettuce, 150 g of diced tomatoes, and 1 sliced avocado.
Whisk together 2 tbsp of lime juice, 50 mL of olive oil, 1 tsp of honey, and a pinch of salt and pepper to make the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing until well mixed.
Serve chilled, optionally garnished with fresh cilantro or lime wedges.
description: A vibrant salad with grilled chicken, fresh vegetables, and a zesty lime dressing.

name: Fig and Goat Cheese Pizza
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F).
Roll out 500 g of pizza dough to form a 12-inch base and spread 150 g of fig jam evenly over the surface.
Crumble 100 g of goat cheese and sprinkle over the fig jam along with 75 g of arugula.
Drizzle 30 mL of balsamic glaze over the toppings and bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden and crisp.
Serve hot, sliced into wedges.
description: A delightful pizza with a base of fig spread, topped with goat cheese, arugula, and balsamic glaze.

name: Fried Green Tomatoes
author: System
method: Slice 4 green tomatoes into 1/2 inch thick rounds.
In one bowl, mix 100 g of cornmeal with 50 g of flour, salt, and pepper.
In another bowl, beat 2 eggs.
Dip each tomato slice first in the egg, then dredge in the cornmeal mixture.
Fry in a skillet with hot vegetable oil over medium-high heat, about 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a side of spicy aioli.
description: Crunchy and tangy green tomatoes fried to a golden perfection, served with a spicy aioli.

name: Fennel and Orange Salad
author: System
method: Thinly slice 2 bulbs of fennel and peel 3 oranges, then separate them into segments.
In a large bowl, combine sliced fennel and orange segments.
Drizzle with a dressing made by whisking together 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of white wine vinegar, and 5 mL of honey.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and toss gently to combine.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving, garnished with fennel fronds.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad featuring thinly sliced fennel and fresh orange segments, dressed in a light vinaigrette.

name: French Lentil Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 2 diced carrots, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 300 g of French lentils and 1 L of vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp of thyme.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty and nutritious stew made with French lentils, vegetables, and aromatic herbs.

name: Fried Halloumi with Lemon
author: System
method: Slice 200 g of halloumi cheese into 1/2 inch thick pieces.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and fry the halloumi slices for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden and crispy.
Squeeze the juice of 1 lemon over the fried halloumi right before removing from the heat.
Serve immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped fresh mint.
description: A simple yet delicious dish featuring slices of halloumi cheese fried until golden and finished with a splash of fresh lemon juice.

name: Farfalle with Spinach Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 350 g of farfalle pasta in boiling water until al dente, about 10-12 minutes, then drain.
In a blender, blend 200 g of fresh spinach with 50 mL of cream and 30 g of grated Parmesan cheese until smooth.
In a pan, heat the spinach sauce over medium heat until heated through.
Toss the cooked pasta with the warm spinach sauce.
Serve garnished with extra Parmesan cheese.
description: Creamy and vibrant, this pasta dish combines farfalle with a smooth sauce made from fresh spinach and Parmesan cheese.

name: Fried Cod with Tartar Sauce
author: System
method: Cut 500 g of cod fillets into serving-size pieces.
Season the cod pieces with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat in breadcrumbs.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and fry the cod until golden and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
Serve immediately with homemade tartar sauce made by mixing 100 g of mayonnaise, 30 g of chopped pickles, and 1 tbsp of lemon juice.
description: Golden and crispy fried cod served with a creamy and tangy homemade tartar sauce.

name: Farmhouse Beef Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 50 mL of vegetable oil over medium heat.
Brown 600 g of cubed beef on all sides, then remove from the pot.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 200 g of sliced carrots, and cook until softened.
Return the beef to the pot, add 1 L of beef broth, 1 cup of red wine, and 2 tbsp of tomato paste, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1.5 hours.
Add 200 g of cubed potatoes and cook for an additional 30 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty and warming stew made with tender beef, vegetables, and a rich, flavorful broth.

name: Fusilli with Mushroom Ragu
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of fusilli pasta in boiling water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes, then drain.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat.
Add 300 g of sliced mushrooms and sauté until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in 1 minced garlic clove and 1 tsp of thyme, cook for an additional minute.
Add 200 mL of tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Toss the cooked pasta with the mushroom ragu.
Serve garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A robust and earthy pasta dish featuring fusilli tossed in a savory mushroom ragu.

name: Feta and Watermelon Salad
author: System
method: Cube 500 g of watermelon and 200 g of feta cheese.
In a large bowl, combine watermelon and feta cubes with 100 g of arugula leaves.
Drizzle with a dressing made by whisking together 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of balsamic vinegar, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Gently toss everything to combine without breaking the cheese too much.
Chill in the refrigerator for about 15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
description: A refreshing summer salad that combines sweet watermelon with creamy feta and peppery arugula, dressed in a simple balsamic dressing.

name: Five Spice Pork Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 800 g of pork ribs with a mixture of 5 g of Chinese five-spice powder, 10 g of salt, and 5 g of black pepper.
Place the ribs in a baking dish and cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in a preheated oven at 150°C (302°F) for 2 hours.
Uncover and brush the ribs with 50 mL of hoisin sauce, then return to the oven and bake for an additional 30 minutes at 175°C (347°F) until caramelized.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
description: Tender pork ribs seasoned with aromatic Chinese five-spice and glazed with hoisin sauce for a sweet and savory finish.

name: Fried Zucchini Flowers
author: System
method: Gently wash 12 zucchini flowers and pat dry.
Prepare a batter by whisking together 100 g of flour, 1 egg, and 150 mL of sparkling water until smooth.
Heat 200 mL of vegetable oil in a deep skillet to 180°C (356°F).
Dip each flower into the batter, then carefully place in the hot oil.
Fry for 2-3 minutes until golden and crisp.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a sprinkle of salt and a lemon wedge on the side.
description: Delicate zucchini flowers fried in a light batter, resulting in a crispy and savory appetizer, perfect for summer gatherings.

name: Forest Mushroom Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 300 g of mixed forest mushrooms and 1 diced onion in 30 mL of butter until the mushrooms are soft and the onion is translucent.
Add 1 L of vegetable broth and bring to a simmer.
Blend half of the soup to create a smooth yet chunky texture.
Stir in 100 mL of cream, heat through, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives and a dollop of sour cream.
description: A rich and earthy soup made from a variety of forest mushrooms, blended into a creamy broth.

name: Fig and Prosciutto Bruschetta
author: System
method: Slice a baguette into 12 pieces and toast until crisp.
Top each slice with a thin slice of prosciutto, a slice of fresh fig, and a small spoonful of ricotta cheese.
Drizzle with 15 mL of honey and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and freshly cracked black pepper.
Broil for 2-3 minutes until the toppings are warm and slightly melted.
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh basil leaves.
description: An elegant appetizer combining sweet figs, savory prosciutto, and creamy ricotta on toasted bruschetta, finished with a touch of honey.

name: Flank Steak with Chimichurri
author: System
method: Season 500 g of flank steak with salt and pepper, and grill over high heat for 5-6 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest the steak for 10 minutes, then slice against the grain.
Combine 50 g of chopped parsley, 10 g of minced garlic, 5 g of red chili flakes, 30 mL of vinegar, and 50 mL of olive oil to make the chimichurri.
Serve the steak slices topped with the chimichurri sauce.
description: Juicy grilled flank steak topped with a vibrant and herby chimichurri sauce, perfect for a hearty meal.

name: Fried Sweet Plantains
author: System
method: Peel and slice 4 ripe plantains into 1/2 inch thick diagonal pieces.
Heat 50 mL of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Fry the plantain slices in batches, 2-3 minutes per side, until golden and caramelized.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with a pinch of salt and sugar while still hot.
description: Sweet plantains fried to a caramelized perfection, a delicious and simple dessert or side dish.

name: French Bean and Almond Salad
author: System
method: Blanch 300 g of French beans in boiling water for 3 minutes, then plunge into ice water to stop cooking.
Toast 50 g of sliced almonds in a dry pan over medium heat until golden, about 3 minutes.
Combine beans and toasted almonds in a bowl, drizzle with a dressing made from 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g of minced garlic.
Toss everything together and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
description: A crunchy, nutty salad of blanched French beans and toasted almonds, dressed with a simple garlic lemon vinaigrette.

name: Fruit Pavlova
author: System
method: Whisk 4 egg whites with a pinch of salt until soft peaks form, then gradually add 200 g of sugar until stiff peaks form.
Fold in 5 mL of vanilla extract and 5 mL of white vinegar, then spoon onto a baking sheet in a circular shape.
Bake in a preheated oven at 120°C (248°F) for 1.5 hours, then turn off the oven and let cool inside.
Top the cooled meringue with 300 mL of whipped cream and 200 g of mixed fresh berries.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.
description: A classic dessert featuring a crisp meringue base topped with whipped cream and fresh berries.

name: Fennel Pork Roast
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork loin with a mixture of 10 g of crushed fennel seeds, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of black pepper.
Sear the pork on all sides in a hot skillet with 30 mL of olive oil.
Transfer the pork to a roasting pan, add 200 g of sliced onions around the pork, and roast in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 1 hour.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve with the roasted onions and pan juices drizzled over the top.
description: Succulent pork loin seasoned with fennel seeds and roasted to perfection, served with caramelized onions.

name: Fiery Shrimp Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Marinate 400 g of shrimp in a mixture of 30 mL of soy sauce, 15 mL of sriracha, and 15 mL of honey for 30 minutes.
Heat 30 mL of vegetable oil in a wok, add shrimp and marinate, and stir-fry over high heat until shrimp are cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
Add 200 g of mixed bell peppers and 100 g of snap peas, stir-fry for an additional 2 minutes.
Serve hot over steamed rice.
description: Spicy and sweet shrimp stir-fried with crisp vegetables, perfect for a quick and flavorful meal.

name: Feta Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Halve 4 bell peppers and remove seeds.
Mix 200 g of crumbled feta cheese with 50 g of chopped olives and 15 mL of olive oil.
Stuff the pepper halves with the feta mixture.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 20 minutes.
Serve warm, garnished with fresh basil.
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a tangy feta and olive filling, baked until tender.

name: Fluffy Pancakes
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of flour, 10 g of sugar, 5 g of baking powder, and a pinch of salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, beat 2 eggs with 250 mL of milk and 30 mL of melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed, being careful not to overmix.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour 60 mL of batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another 2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve hot with maple syrup and fresh berries.
description: Classic, soft, and fluffy pancakes, perfect for a lazy weekend breakfast or brunch.

name: Fish Pie
author: System
method: Poach 500 g of mixed fish fillets in 500 mL of milk with 1 bay leaf, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of pepper for 10 minutes.
Remove fish and reserve the milk. Flake the fish into a baking dish.
Cook 200 g of chopped leeks and 200 g of diced carrots in 30 mL of butter until soft.
Sprinkle 30 g of flour over vegetables, stir for 1 minute, then gradually add reserved milk to form a thick sauce.
Pour sauce over flaked fish, then top with 500 g of mashed potatoes.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
description: A comforting fish pie with a creamy vegetable sauce topped with a layer of golden mashed potatoes.

name: Filo-wrapped Asparagus
author: System
method: Trim 20 spears of asparagus and blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes, then cool in ice water.
Brush 4 sheets of filo pastry with melted butter, then cut each sheet into 5 strips.
Wrap a strip of filo around each asparagus spear, leaving the tips exposed.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 10 minutes or until the filo is golden and crisp.
Serve warm with a lemon wedge.
description: Elegant asparagus spears wrapped in crispy filo pastry, perfect for an appetizer or side dish.

name: Fried Banana Fritters
author: System
method: Mash 4 ripe bananas and mix with 100 g of flour, 50 g of sugar, and 1 egg until smooth.
Heat 100 mL of vegetable oil in a deep skillet.
Drop spoonfuls of banana mixture into the hot oil and fry until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.
description: Sweet and golden, these banana fritters are a delightful treat, dusted with powdered sugar.

name: Four Cheese Pasta Bake
author: System
method: Cook 500 g of penne pasta until al dente, drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt 30 g of butter and stir in 30 g of flour to make a roux.
Gradually add 500 mL of milk, stirring continuously until the sauce thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in 100 g of mixed grated cheeses (mozzarella, cheddar, Parmesan, and Gouda).
Combine pasta with cheese sauce and transfer to a baking dish.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A rich and comforting pasta bake made with four types of cheese, perfect for a hearty meal.

name: Fried Butter Mushrooms
author: System
method: Clean 300 g of button mushrooms and slice.
Heat 50 g of butter in a skillet over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and sauté until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
Season with 5 g of salt and 5 g of black pepper.
Finish with a splash of 15 mL of lemon juice and garnish with chopped parsley before serving.
description: Simple yet flavorful sautéed mushrooms cooked in butter and seasoned with salt, pepper, and a hint of lemon.

name: Fruit Smoothie Bowl
author: System
method: Blend 200 g of mixed frozen berries, 1 banana, and 200 mL of almond milk until smooth.
Pour the mixture into bowls and top with 50 g of sliced strawberries, 30 g of blueberries, and 25 g of granola.
Drizzle with 10 mL of honey and sprinkle with 5 g of chia seeds before serving.
description: A refreshing and nutritious smoothie bowl topped with fresh berries, crunchy granola, and chia seeds, perfect for a healthy breakfast.

name: Fried Calamari
author: System
method: Slice 500 g of calamari into rings.
Dredge the calamari rings in a mixture of 100 g of flour, 5 g of salt, and 2 g of black pepper.
Heat 500 mL of vegetable oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (356°F).
Fry the calamari rings in batches until golden and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per batch.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a side of marinara sauce.
description: Crispy fried calamari rings served with a tangy marinara sauce, perfect for an appetizer or snack.

name: Falafel Wrap
author: System
method: Blend 300 g of soaked chickpeas with 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of garlic, and 15 g of parsley until smooth.
Form the mixture into small patties and fry in 200 mL of vegetable oil until golden, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Wrap the falafels in pita bread with 100 g of diced tomatoes, 50 g of sliced cucumber, and drizzle with 50 mL of tahini sauce.
description: Hearty falafel patties wrapped in soft pita bread with fresh vegetables and creamy tahini sauce.

name: Fig Jam
author: System
method: Chop 500 g of fresh figs and place them in a saucepan with 250 g of sugar and 30 mL of lemon juice.
Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens and reaches a jam-like consistency, about 30 minutes.
Pour the hot jam into sterilized jars and seal.
Allow to cool at room temperature before storing in the refrigerator.
description: Sweet and luscious homemade fig jam, perfect for spreading on toast or pairing with cheeses.

name: Focaccia Art
author: System
method: Prepare 500 g of focaccia dough and spread it on a baking sheet.
Decorate the top of the dough with an array of vegetables (bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, olives, onions) to create a colorful pattern.
Drizzle with 30 mL of olive oil and sprinkle with 10 g of coarse sea salt.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes, or until golden and fluffy.
Serve warm, cut into pieces.
description: Beautiful and delicious focaccia decorated with fresh vegetables, creating a visually stunning edible art piece.

name: Fettuccine Carbonara
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of fettuccine pasta in boiling salted water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
In a large skillet, cook 200 g of chopped bacon until crispy, remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, mix 2 beaten eggs, 100 g of grated Parmesan, and cooked bacon, stirring quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Add the drained pasta to the skillet, tossing to coat with the sauce.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan and freshly cracked black pepper.
description: A classic Italian pasta dish combining creamy egg sauce, crispy bacon, and Parmesan cheese, all tossed with al dente fettuccine.

name: Farmhouse Chicken
author: System
method: Season 4 chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and 5 g of dried herbs.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil and brown the chicken on both sides.
Add 200 g of sliced mushrooms and 100 g of diced onions to the skillet, cook until the onions are translucent.
Pour in 200 mL of chicken broth and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: Rustic and hearty chicken breasts cooked with mushrooms and onions in a flavorful broth.

name: Fusilli with Peas and Ham
author: System
method: Cook 350 g of fusilli pasta in boiling water until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil and sauté 150 g of chopped ham until slightly browned.
Add 200 g of frozen peas and cook until heated through.
Toss the cooked pasta with the ham and peas, adding 100 mL of cream and 50 g of grated Parmesan.
Serve warm, topped with additional Parmesan if desired.
description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish featuring fusilli, sweet peas, and savory ham in a creamy sauce.

name: Fried Tofu with Spicy Glaze
author: System
method: Cut 400 g of firm tofu into cubes and pat dry with paper towels.
Fry the tofu in 100 mL of hot vegetable oil until all sides are golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Drain the tofu on paper towels and then toss with a spicy glaze made from 30 mL of soy sauce, 30 mL of honey, and 15 mL of sriracha.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
description: Crispy fried tofu cubes coated in a sweet and spicy glaze, perfect for a flavorful vegetarian dish.

name: Fig and Ricotta Crostini
author: System
method: Slice a baguette into 18 pieces and toast until crisp.
Spread each slice with ricotta cheese, then top with a slice of fresh fig.
Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with chopped walnuts before serving.
description: Elegant crostini topped with creamy ricotta, fresh figs, and a touch of honey, perfect for an appetizer or party snack.

name: Fried Cheese Balls
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of shredded mozzarella cheese with 100 g of breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, and seasonings (salt, pepper, garlic powder).
Form the mixture into small balls, about the size of a walnut.
Heat 200 mL of vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 180°C (356°F).
Fry the cheese balls in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with marinara sauce for dipping.
description: Crispy on the outside, gooey on the inside, these fried cheese balls are a crowd-pleasing appetizer or snack.

name: Four Cheese Garlic Bread
author: System
method: Slice a baguette lengthwise and spread with a mixture of 50 g softened butter, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and a pinch of salt.
Top with 25 g each of grated mozzarella, cheddar, Parmesan, and Gouda cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 10-12 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Slice and serve hot.
description: Decadent garlic bread loaded with a mix of four cheeses, perfect for a rich and comforting side dish.

name: Fig Stuffed Pork Tenderloin
author: System
method: Butterfly a 500 g pork tenderloin and spread with a mixture of chopped dried figs, 50 g blue cheese, and a sprinkle of thyme.
Roll up the tenderloin and secure with kitchen twine.
Sear on all sides in a hot skillet with 15 mL of olive oil, then roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (374°F) for 25 minutes.
Rest for 10 minutes, slice, and serve.
description: Elegant pork tenderloin stuffed with sweet figs and tangy blue cheese, roasted to perfection.

name: Fava Bean and Pea Salad
author: System
method: Blanch 200 g of shelled fava beans and 200 g of peas in boiling water for 2 minutes, then cool in ice water.
Toss with 100 g of sliced radishes, 30 mL of olive oil, and the juice of 1 lemon.
Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh mint leaves before serving.
description: A light and refreshing salad featuring spring vegetables with a simple lemon olive oil dressing.

name: Fried Rice with Pineapple and Shrimp
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL of sesame oil in a large skillet or wok.
Add 200 g of shrimp and cook until pink, about 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 400 g of cooked and chilled rice, 100 g of diced pineapple, and 50 g of peas. Stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Return the shrimp to the skillet, add 50 mL of soy sauce, and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot.
description: Tropical and savory fried rice loaded with shrimp and sweet pineapple, perfect for a quick and delicious meal.

name: Fennel and Citrus Cured Salmon
author: System
method: Mix 50 g of salt, 50 g of sugar, zest of 1 orange, zest of 1 lemon, and 10 g of crushed fennel seeds.
Cover a 500 g piece of salmon fillet with the curing mix, wrap tightly in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 48 hours.
Unwrap, rinse off the cure under cold water, and pat dry.
Slice thinly and serve with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of chopped dill.
description: Luxuriously soft salmon cured with fennel and citrus, creating a delightful combination of fresh and aromatic flavors.

name: Flatbread with Spicy Lamb
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of ground lamb in a skillet with 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of cumin, and 5 g of paprika until browned.
Spread the cooked lamb over 4 prepared flatbreads.
Top with 100 g of crumbled feta and 50 g of diced tomatoes.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 10 minutes.
Serve garnished with fresh parsley and a drizzle of yogurt sauce.
description: Spicy and savory flatbread topped with seasoned lamb, feta cheese, and fresh tomatoes, finished with a cool yogurt sauce.

name: French Ratatouille
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil and sauté 1 sliced onion, 2 cloves of garlic, 1 diced bell pepper, 1 sliced zucchini, and 1 sliced eggplant until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add 200 g of crushed tomatoes, 5 g of basil, 5 g of thyme, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.
description: Traditional French stew of summer vegetables, simmered slowly to meld the flavors into a comforting dish.

name: Frosted Cinnamon Rolls
author: System
method: Prepare dough with 500 g of flour, 250 mL of milk, 50 g of sugar, and 7 g of yeast. Let rise until doubled.
Roll out the dough, spread with 50 g of melted butter, and sprinkle with a mixture of 100 g of brown sugar and 10 g of cinnamon.
Roll up the dough, cut into 12 pieces, and place in a baking pan.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes.
Top with frosting made from 100 g of cream cheese, 50 g of powdered sugar, and 5 mL of vanilla extract.
description: Soft and fluffy cinnamon rolls, freshly baked and topped with a sweet cream cheese frosting.

name: Fried Green Tomato BLT
author: System
method: Slice 4 green tomatoes and dredge in flour, then dip in beaten eggs and coat in breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot oil until golden, about 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Assemble the sandwich with toasted bread, a layer of lettuce, a slice of fried green tomato, 2 slices of bacon, and a smear of mayonnaise.
Serve immediately.
description: A Southern twist on the classic BLT, featuring crispy fried green tomatoes as the star ingredient.

name: Fennel and Apple Slaw
author: System
method: Thinly slice 1 fennel bulb and 2 apples. Toss in a bowl with 100 g of shredded cabbage.
Whisk together 30 mL of apple cider vinegar, 15 mL of honey, and 15 mL of olive oil to make the dressing.
Toss the slaw with the dressing and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
description: A crisp and refreshing slaw combining sweet apples and anise-flavored fennel, dressed with a light vinaigrette.

name: Fried Camembert with Cranberry Sauce
author: System
method: Cut 1 Camembert cheese into 8 wedges and coat each with flour, then dip in beaten eggs and breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve immediately with cranberry sauce on the side.
description: Creamy Camembert cheese fried to a perfect crisp, accompanied by sweet and tangy cranberry sauce.

name: Flank Steak Fajitas
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of flank steak in a mixture of 30 mL lime juice, 15 mL soy sauce, 5 g cumin, and 2 cloves of minced garlic for 1 hour.
Heat a skillet over high heat, add steak and cook for 5-6 minutes per side for medium rare. Let rest for 10 minutes then slice thinly.
In the same skillet, sauté 1 sliced bell pepper and 1 sliced onion until soft, about 5 minutes.
Serve the steak with sautéed vegetables on warmed tortillas, topped with salsa and sour cream.
description: Juicy marinated flank steak with sautéed peppers and onions, served in tortillas with traditional fajita toppings.

name: Fried Goat Cheese Salad
author: System
method: Slice 200 g of goat cheese into rounds and freeze for 30 minutes.
Dip frozen goat cheese in beaten egg, then in breadcrumbs mixed with 5 g of herbs de Provence.
Fry in 100 mL of hot olive oil until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Serve on top of a salad made with 150 g mixed greens, 100 g cherry tomatoes, and 50 g walnuts, drizzled with balsamic vinaigrette.
description: Crispy fried goat cheese served on a fresh salad with tomatoes, mixed greens, and a balsamic dressing.

name: Farm Style Meatloaf
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground beef, 200 g ground pork, 1 chopped onion, 2 beaten eggs, 100 g breadcrumbs, and 50 mL milk in a bowl.
Shape the mixture into a loaf and place on a baking tray.
Top with a glaze made by combining 50 g ketchup, 15 g mustard, and 15 g brown sugar.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 1 hour.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
description: Traditional meatloaf with a sweet and tangy glaze, hearty and satisfying, perfect for a family dinner.

name: Fresh Herb and Ricotta Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Mix 200 g ricotta cheese with 50 g chopped fresh herbs (basil, parsley, chives), 1 minced garlic clove, and 50 g grated Parmesan.
Stuff the mixture into 4 halved and seeded bell peppers.
Bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 20 minutes.
Serve warm, topped with additional Parmesan if desired.
description: Bell peppers stuffed with a creamy blend of ricotta, fresh herbs, and Parmesan, baked until perfectly tender.

name: Fruit Tart with Vanilla Custard
author: System
method: Prepare a tart crust from 200 g flour and 100 g butter, then pre-bake at 180°C (356°F) for 15 minutes.
Cook 500 mL milk with 100 g sugar, 1 vanilla bean until it simmers.
Whisk 2 eggs with 50 g flour, then temper with hot milk and return to heat, stirring until thick.
Pour custard into the crust, top with 300 g of mixed fresh berries, and chill for 2 hours before serving.
description: A delightful tart filled with creamy vanilla custard and topped with an array of colorful fresh berries.

name: Feta and Olive Greek Salad
author: System
method: Combine 200 g chopped cucumbers, 150 g halved cherry tomatoes, 100 g sliced red onions, and 100 g black olives in a bowl.
Crumble 200 g feta cheese over the salad.
Dress with 30 mL olive oil and 15 mL red wine vinegar, season with salt and pepper.
Toss gently and serve chilled.
description: A classic Greek salad with juicy tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, sharp onions, briny olives, and creamy feta.

name: Fried Mushroom Risotto Balls
author: System
method: Cook 300 g risotto rice with 500 mL vegetable broth until creamy, let cool.
Sauté 200 g chopped mushrooms and 1 minced garlic clove, mix into the cooled risotto with 50 g grated Parmesan.
Form into balls, coat with flour, then beaten egg, and finally breadcrumbs.
Fry in 200 mL of hot oil until golden. Drain on paper towels and serve with marinara sauce.
description: Crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside, these risotto balls filled with mushrooms and Parmesan are a delicious treat.

name: Fennel Orange Roast Chicken
author: System
method: Rub a whole chicken (about 1.5 kg) with a mix of 5 g salt, 5 g pepper, and the zest of 1 orange.
Stuff the chicken cavity with sliced fennel and orange slices.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 1 hour 30 minutes or until the juices run clear.
Rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with roasted fennel and orange slices.
description: Aromatic roast chicken stuffed with fresh fennel and orange slices, creating a juicy, flavorful dish perfect for a special meal.

name: Filo Pastry Apple Turnovers
author: System
method: Peel and dice 3 apples and sauté with 50 g sugar, 5 g cinnamon, and 10 mL lemon juice until soft.
Cut 6 sheets of filo pastry into squares, spoon apple mixture into the center, fold over to form triangles, and seal edges.
Brush with melted butter and bake at 180°C (356°F) for 15 minutes or until golden.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: Crispy filo pastry filled with a sweet and spiced apple mixture, a delightful dessert or snack.

name: Fish and Chips
author: System
method: Cut 500 g of cod into strips. Dredge in flour, dip in batter made from 150 g flour, 250 mL beer, 1 egg, and fry in 500 mL vegetable oil until crispy.
Slice 4 potatoes into fries and fry in the same oil until golden.
Serve the fish and chips with tartar sauce and lemon wedges.
description: Classic British fish and chips, featuring beer-battered cod and crispy fried potatoes, served with tartar sauce.

name: Fig and Walnut Baked Brie
author: System
method: Top a 200 g wheel of Brie with 100 g chopped dried figs and 50 g chopped walnuts.
Wrap in puff pastry and bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes or until the pastry is golden.
Serve warm with crackers and honey drizzle.
description: Elegant baked Brie wrapped in puff pastry, topped with sweet figs and crunchy walnuts, ideal for a sophisticated appetizer.

name: French Green Bean Casserole
author: System
method: Blanch 500 g of green beans in boiling water for 3 minutes, then shock in ice water.
Sauté 1 chopped onion and 200 g sliced mushrooms in 30 mL of butter until soft.
Stir in 30 g of flour, then gradually add 500 mL of milk, cooking until thickened.
Mix the green beans into the mushroom sauce and top with 100 g of fried onions.
Bake at 175°C (347°F) for 20 minutes or until bubbly.
description: A creamy, comforting casserole featuring green beans and mushrooms, topped with crispy fried onions.

name: Fusilli with Broccoli and Anchovies
author: System
method: Boil 350 g of fusilli pasta until al dente, about 10 minutes, then drain.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil and sauté 2 cloves of minced garlic and 50 g of anchovy fillets until the anchovies melt.
Add 300 g of chopped broccoli and cook until tender, about 5 minutes.
Toss the pasta with the broccoli mixture, season with salt and pepper, and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A savory pasta dish featuring fusilli with tender broccoli and rich, umami-packed anchovies.

name: French Toast with Caramelized Bananas
author: System
method: Whisk together 3 eggs, 100 mL of milk, and 5 g of cinnamon.
Dip 8 slices of brioche bread into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are coated.
Cook in a buttered skillet over medium heat until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
In another skillet, sauté 2 sliced bananas with 50 g of brown sugar until caramelized.
Serve the French toast with caramelized bananas and a drizzle of maple syrup.
description: Luxurious French toast topped with sweet caramelized bananas, perfect for a decadent breakfast or brunch.

name: Fried Chickpea and Herb Falafel
author: System
method: Process 400 g of soaked chickpeas with 50 g of chopped parsley, 30 g of chopped cilantro, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 10 g of cumin until smooth.
Form into small balls and chill for 30 minutes.
Fry in 200 mL of vegetable oil until golden and crispy, about 5 minutes.
Serve with tahini sauce and lemon wedges.
description: Crispy homemade falafel made from chickpeas and fresh herbs, served with creamy tahini sauce.

name: Fig and Prosciutto Flatbread
author: System
method: Roll out 500 g of pizza dough into a thin circle and place on a baking sheet.
Top with 100 g of sliced figs, 100 g of torn prosciutto, and 100 g of mozzarella cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven at 220°C (428°F) for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is crisp and golden.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve immediately.
description: A gourmet flatbread combining sweet figs, salty prosciutto, and creamy mozzarella, finished with a balsamic reduction.

name: Fish Tacos with Mango Salsa
author: System
method: Season 400 g of cod fillets with cumin, chili powder, and salt, then grill until cooked through.
Mix together 100 g diced mango, 50 g diced red onion, 30 g chopped cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to make the salsa.
Serve the fish in corn tortillas, topped with mango salsa and a dollop of sour cream.
description: Flavorful grilled fish tacos topped with a fresh mango salsa, perfect for a light and refreshing meal.

name: French Onion Chicken
author: System
method: In a skillet, sauté 3 thinly sliced onions in 30 mL of olive oil until caramelized, about 15 minutes.
Add 500 g of chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides.
Pour in 250 mL of beef broth, cover, and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes.
Top with 100 g of grated Gruyere cheese and broil until melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: Tender chicken breasts topped with caramelized onions and melted Gruyere cheese, inspired by French onion soup.

name: Fried Lemon Pepper Wings
author: System
method: Season 500 g of chicken wings with 10 g of lemon pepper seasoning.
Fry in 200 mL of hot oil until crispy, about 8 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve with lemon wedges and ranch dressing.
description: Crispy chicken wings seasoned with zesty lemon pepper, served with a side of cooling ranch.

name: Fennel Seed Crusted Pork Chops
author: System
method: Crush 10 g of fennel seeds and mix with 5 g of salt and 5 g of black pepper.
Rub the mixture onto 4 pork chops.
Sear the pork chops in 30 mL of olive oil over medium-high heat, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with a side of sautéed spinach and mashed potatoes.
description: Juicy pork chops crusted with aromatic fennel seeds, served with simple yet flavorful sides.

name: Fettuccine with Creamy Tomato Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of fettuccine pasta in boiling salted water until al dente, then drain.
In a saucepan, heat 15 mL of olive oil, add 2 cloves of minced garlic, and sauté until fragrant.
Stir in 250 g of crushed tomatoes and 100 mL of heavy cream, simmer for 10 minutes.
Toss the pasta with the sauce, season with salt and pepper, and garnish with fresh basil.
description: Creamy and rich tomato sauce draped over tender fettuccine, topped with fresh basil for a touch of freshness.

name: Fig and Honey Oatmeal
author: System
method: Cook 200 g of rolled oats with 500 mL of milk and a pinch of salt until thick and creamy.
Stir in 30 mL of honey and 100 g of chopped fresh figs.
Serve hot, topped with a sprinkle of cinnamon and extra honey if desired.
description: Warm, comforting oatmeal enriched with sweet figs and honey, a perfect start to the day.

name: Flambéed Banana Crepes
author: System
method: Prepare crepe batter from 100 g flour, 2 eggs, and 300 mL milk. Cook thin crepes in a non-stick skillet.
Sauté 4 sliced bananas in 30 g butter and 50 g sugar until golden.
Pour 50 mL of rum over the bananas and carefully ignite to flambé.
Fold the crepes and top with flambéed bananas, serving immediately.
description: Delicate crepes filled with caramelized, flambéed bananas, offering a spectacular dessert with a dramatic flair.

name: Fennel Crusted Salmon with Orange Glaze
author: System
method: Mix 10 g of crushed fennel seeds, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of black pepper to create a seasoning blend.
Rub the blend onto 4 salmon fillets.
Heat 15 mL of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear the salmon, skin side down, for 4 minutes.
Flip the salmon and cook for another 3 minutes until nearly done.
In a small saucepan, reduce 100 mL of orange juice with 10 g of honey until thickened to a glaze consistency.
Brush the salmon with the orange glaze and serve immediately, garnished with orange slices and fresh dill.
description: Perfectly seared salmon fillets encrusted with a fennel seasoning, enhanced with a sweet and tangy orange glaze.

name: Fried Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in 250 mL of buttermilk with 5 g of paprika, 5 g of garlic powder, and salt and pepper for at least 1 hour.
Dredge each marinated chicken breast in a mixture of 200 g of flour and 5 g of cayenne pepper.
Fry in 500 mL of vegetable oil heated to 175°C (347°F) until golden and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
Toast 4 buns and spread each with 15 mL of mayonnaise.
Assemble the sandwiches with fried chicken, slices of pickles, and lettuce leaves.
Serve immediately.
description: Crispy fried buttermilk chicken served on a soft bun with creamy mayonnaise and crisp pickles, perfect for a satisfying lunch or dinner.

name: Garlic Herb Chicken
author: System
method: In a bowl, mix 30 mL olive oil, 5 cloves minced garlic, 5 g chopped rosemary, 5 g thyme, and salt and pepper.
Rub mixture onto 4 chicken breasts.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with steamed green beans and mashed potatoes.
description: Juicy chicken breasts marinated in a garlic herb sauce, baked to perfection.

name: Greek Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 3 sliced cucumbers, 3 diced tomatoes, 1 sliced red onion, and 100 g pitted Kalamata olives.
Crumble 150 g feta cheese over the vegetables.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL red wine vinegar, a pinch of oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
description: Classic Greek salad with crisp vegetables, tangy feta cheese, and a flavorful dressing.

name: Grilled Grouper with Mango Salsa
author: System
method: For the salsa, mix 1 diced mango, 50 g diced red bell pepper, 30 g chopped red onion, 10 g chopped cilantro, juice of 1 lime, salt, and pepper.
Grill 4 grouper fillets seasoned with salt and pepper over medium heat, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve the grilled grouper topped with mango salsa.
description: Fresh grouper fillets grilled to perfection, topped with a sweet and spicy mango salsa.
