method: Rub a whole chicken (about 1.5 kg) with a mix of 30 mL vegetable oil, 10 g garam masala, 5 g turmeric, 5 g cumin, and salt.
Stuff the chicken cavity with 1 halved lemon and a bunch of cilantro.
Roast in a preheated 190°C oven for 1.5 hours or until the juices run clear.
Serve with roasted vegetables and mint yogurt sauce.
description: Whole chicken seasoned with Indian spices and roasted to golden perfection, served with a cooling mint yogurt sauce.

name: Irish Coffee
author: System
method: Brew 200 mL strong coffee and divide between two cups.
Stir in 15 mL brown sugar into each cup until dissolved.
Add 45 mL Irish whiskey to each cup.
Top with 30 mL whipped cream without stirring.
Serve hot with a dusting of nutmeg.
description: A classic Irish coffee with a warming blend of coffee, Irish whiskey, sugar, and topped with a creamy layer.

name: Italian Baked Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish. Season with salt, pepper, and 10 g Italian herbs.
Top each fillet with a slice of lemon and a sprinkle of 30 g capers.
Drizzle with 30 mL olive oil and bake for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily.
Serve with a side of steamed spinach.
description: Deliciously tender cod fillets baked with Italian herbs, lemon, and capers.

name: Indonesian Beef Rendang
author: System
method: In a large pot, combine 500 g beef chuck, cut into cubes, with 400 mL coconut milk, 200 mL water, 2 chopped shallots, 2 cloves minced garlic, 20 g grated ginger, and 10 g turmeric.
Bring to a simmer and cook uncovered for 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the liquid reduces and the meat is tender.
Add 5 g ground coriander, 5 g cumin, and salt to taste, cook until the sauce thickens and coats the beef.
Serve with jasmine rice and garnish with lime leaves.
description: A slow-cooked Indonesian curry that is rich in spices and extremely tender, typically served during special occasions.

name: Iced Vanilla Latte
author: System
method: Brew 200 mL strong coffee and let cool.
Fill two glasses with ice cubes. Pour the cooled coffee over the ice.
Stir in 30 mL vanilla syrup into each glass.
Top with 60 mL milk and serve immediately.
description: A refreshing and sweet caffeinated beverage with smooth vanilla flavor, perfect for hot days.

name: Indian Vegetable Korma
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 10 g grated ginger, sauté until onion is soft.
Add 200 g chopped potatoes, 100 g chopped carrots, 100 g peas, and 200 g cauliflower florets. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in 200 mL coconut milk and 15 g korma paste. Simmer for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with naan bread.
description: A creamy, flavorful Indian curry made with a variety of vegetables, cooked in a rich coconut milk-based sauce.

name: Italian Pesto Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Spread 200 g of homemade pesto on 4 chicken breasts. Place in a baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the chicken is thoroughly cooked.
Serve with a side of roasted vegetables and a sprinkle of grated Parmesan.
description: Juicy chicken breasts smothered in a rich basil pesto, baked to perfection.

name: Irish Colcannon
author: System
method: Boil 600 g potatoes until tender. Mash with 50 mL milk and 30 g butter.
Sauté 200 g chopped kale and 1 diced onion in 15 mL butter until soft.
Mix the vegetables with the mashed potatoes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a pat of butter.
description: A traditional Irish dish of creamy mashed potatoes mixed with sautéed kale and onion.

name: Indian Mango Lassi
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 300 g ripe mango pulp, 500 mL plain yogurt, 50 mL honey, and a pinch of cardamom.
Blend until smooth. Chill for at least 1 hour.
Serve cold, garnished with a sprinkle of ground pistachios.
description: A refreshing and creamy yogurt-based drink, sweetened with mango and a hint of cardamom.

name: Israeli Shakshuka
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 30 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped bell pepper and 1 chopped onion, sauté until soft.
Add 2 minced garlic cloves, 400 g diced tomatoes, 5 g paprika, and 5 g cumin. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Make four wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each. Cover and cook until eggs are set.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with crusty bread.
description: Eggs poached in a sauce of tomatoes, chili peppers, and onions, spiced with cumin and paprika.

name: Italian Frittata
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
In a skillet, sauté 1 diced onion and 100 g chopped bell peppers in 15 mL olive oil until soft.
Add 100 g spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat.
Whisk together 6 eggs, 50 mL milk, 50 g grated Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Pour over vegetables in the skillet.
Transfer skillet to the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until set.
Serve warm, cut into wedges.
description: A hearty Italian frittata with eggs, cheese, and vegetables, baked to fluffy perfection.

name: Irish Coddle
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 200 g sliced bacon and 400 g pork sausages. Remove and set aside.
Layer the bacon and sausages in the pot with 300 g sliced potatoes, 2 sliced onions, and 200 g sliced carrots.
Pour over 500 mL chicken broth, season with salt and pepper. Simmer covered for 1.5 hours.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A traditional Irish dish made with sausages, bacon, and root vegetables, stewed until tender.

name: Iced Caramel Macchiato
author: System
method: Fill two glasses with ice. Pour 30 mL vanilla syrup into each glass.
Add 150 mL milk over the syrup. Slowly pour 60 mL espresso over the milk.
Drizzle with 15 mL caramel sauce. Serve immediately with a straw.
description: A coffeehouse favorite, featuring layers of milk, espresso, and vanilla, topped with caramel.

name: Indian Chana Masala
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 10 g grated ginger. Cook until onion is translucent.
Add 15 g garam masala, 5 g cumin, and 400 g canned tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add 400 g canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed. Simmer for 20 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt and chili powder.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with basmati rice or naan.
description: A robust and spicy North Indian chickpea curry, rich in flavors and perfect for a hearty meal.

name: Iced Tea Lemonade
author: System
method: Brew 500 mL of strong black tea and allow to cool.
In a pitcher, mix the cooled tea with 500 mL lemonade.
Add ice, 30 mL honey, and stir well.
Serve chilled with slices of lemon.
description: A refreshing blend of iced tea and lemonade sweetened with honey, perfect for hot days.

name: Italian Wedding Soup
author: System
method: Form 200 g ground chicken into small meatballs, season with salt, pepper, and 10 g minced parsley.
In a pot, cook meatballs in 15 mL olive oil until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and sauté until translucent.
Add 1.5 L chicken broth, 100 g chopped escarole, and cooked meatballs. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in 100 g acini di pepe pasta and cook until tender. Adjust seasoning.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty Italian soup with chicken meatballs, escarole, and pasta in a savory broth.

name: Indonesian Nasi Goreng
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble. Remove and set aside.
Add 200 g diced chicken and cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 20 g chopped chili to the wok. Cook until soft.
Add 400 g cooked jasmine rice, scrambled eggs, chicken, 50 mL kecap manis, and 5 g sambal oelek. Stir-fry until everything is hot and combined.
Serve with cucumber slices and a fried egg on top.
description: A classic Indonesian fried rice dish with chicken, kecap manis, and a hint of chili, topped with a fried egg.

name: Irish Apple Cake
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Cream together 150 g butter and 150 g sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in 3 eggs one at a time.
Fold in 300 g flour, 5 g baking powder, and 5 g mixed spice. Stir in 200 g peeled, cored, and sliced apples.
Pour into a greased cake tin. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: A traditional Irish dessert, this apple cake is spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg, and studded with tender pieces of apple.

name: Icelandic Fish Stew
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until translucent.
Add 500 g mixed fish fillets (cod, haddock, salmon), cut into chunks, and 200 g peeled shrimp. Sauté lightly.
Pour in 500 mL fish stock and 200 mL cream. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 10 g chopped dill, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh dill and accompanied by rye bread.
description: A comforting seafood stew, common in Icelandic cuisine, featuring a variety of fish and creamy broth.

name: Indian Chickpea Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 400 g canned chickpeas (drained and rinsed), 100 g chopped cucumber, 100 g halved cherry tomatoes, 50 g diced red onion, and 50 g chopped coriander.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL lemon juice, 30 mL olive oil, 5 g cumin, and salt to taste.
Pour dressing over the salad, mix well.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional coriander.
description: A vibrant and nutritious salad with chickpeas, fresh vegetables, and a tangy cumin-lemon dressing.

name: Italian Zucchini Boats
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Halve 4 medium zucchinis lengthwise and scoop out the centers to create boats.
In a skillet, cook 200 g ground turkey with 1 minced garlic clove, salt, and pepper until browned.
Mix cooked turkey with 100 g cooked quinoa, 100 g tomato sauce, and 10 g chopped basil.
Stuff the zucchini boats with the mixture. Top with 50 g shredded mozzarella.
Bake for 25 minutes or until zucchini is tender and cheese is melted.
Serve hot, garnished with more fresh basil.
description: Delicious and healthy zucchini boats stuffed with a flavorful turkey and quinoa mixture, topped with melted mozzarella.

name: Indonesian Peanut Stir-Fry
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 300 g thinly sliced beef, cook until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add 200 g sliced bell peppers, 100 g snap peas, and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Return the beef to the wok. Add 100 mL peanut sauce, stir to combine and heat through.
Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice, garnished with chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro.
description: A quick and easy stir-fry with beef and vegetables, coated in a rich peanut sauce.

name: Italian Minestrone Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 diced carrot, and 1 diced celery stalk; cook until softened.
Add 400 g canned diced tomatoes, 1 L vegetable broth, 100 g chopped green beans, and 100 g chopped zucchini; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in 100 g small pasta and cook until pasta is tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and 10 g Italian seasoning. Stir in 50 g chopped spinach before serving.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty Italian soup packed with vegetables, beans, and pasta, simmered in a rich tomato broth.

name: Indian Paneer Tikka
author: System
method: Cut 400 g paneer into cubes. Marinate in a mixture of 150 g yogurt, 10 g garam masala, 5 g turmeric, 5 g chili powder, juice of 1 lemon, and salt for 2 hours.
Thread paneer cubes onto skewers, alternating with pieces of bell pepper and onion.
Grill on a preheated grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until charred on all sides, about 8 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro and accompanied by mint chutney.
description: Grilled paneer cheese marinated in Indian spices, served with crisp vegetables and a refreshing mint chutney.

name: Irish Potato Pancakes
author: System
method: Grate 500 g potatoes and squeeze out excess moisture. Mix with 1 beaten egg, 50 g flour, salt, and pepper.
Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a skillet. Drop large spoonfuls of potato mixture into the skillet, flatten to form pancakes.
Cook over medium heat until golden brown on both sides, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve hot with applesauce or sour cream.
description: Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, these traditional Irish pancakes are a delicious breakfast or side dish.

name: Indonesian Bakso Soup
author: System
method: Form 300 g ground beef into meatballs. Boil in 1.5 L beef broth with 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves for 30 minutes.
Add 100 g noodles and cook until tender. Stir in 50 g chopped scallions and 10 g fried shallots.
Season with salt, pepper, and a splash of soy sauce.
Serve hot, sprinkled with more scallions and accompanied by lime wedges.
description: A savory Indonesian soup featuring tender meatballs and noodles in a flavorful broth, topped with scallions and shallots.

name: Italian Eggplant Parmesan
author: System
method: Slice 2 medium eggplants into 1 cm thick rounds. Salt lightly and set aside for 30 minutes to draw out moisture.
Dip eggplant slices in flour, then in beaten eggs, and finally in breadcrumbs mixed with 10 g Parmesan.
Fry in 30 mL olive oil until golden on each side. Drain on paper towels.
Layer eggplant in a baking dish with 200 mL marinara sauce and 100 g mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers.
Bake at 190°C for 25 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Garnish with basil before serving.
description: Slices of eggplant coated in breadcrumbs and Parmesan, layered with marinara and mozzarella, and baked until bubbly.

name: Irish Whiskey Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: Peel and slice 400 g carrots into sticks.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter, add carrots, and cook for 10 minutes until starting to soften.
Add 30 mL Irish whiskey and 20 g brown sugar. Cook until the carrots are glazed and the liquid is reduced, about 10 minutes.
Season with salt and garnish with chopped parsley.
description: Tender carrots glazed with a sweet and slightly boozy whiskey sauce, enhanced with a hint of butter and sugar.

name: Indian Vegetable Pakora
author: System
method: In a large bowl, mix 100 g chickpea flour, 5 g garam masala, 5 g turmeric, salt, and water to make a thick batter.
Add 200 g chopped mixed vegetables (potato, onion, spinach, and cauliflower). Stir to coat.
Deep fry spoonfuls of the mixture in hot oil until crisp and golden.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with mint chutney.
description: Crispy fritters made from a variety of vegetables coated in a spiced chickpea batter, deep-fried to perfection.

name: Indonesian Coconut Rice
author: System
method: Rinse 300 g jasmine rice until water runs clear. Drain.
In a pot, combine rice, 400 mL coconut milk, 100 mL water, and a pinch of salt.
Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 18-20 minutes until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.
Fluff with a fork and serve with sliced green onions and toasted coconut flakes.
description: Fragrant jasmine rice cooked in creamy coconut milk, a staple side dish in Indonesian cuisine.

name: Israeli Salad
author: System
method: Dice 200 g cucumbers, 200 g tomatoes, 100 g bell peppers, and 50 g red onions.
In a large bowl, mix the chopped vegetables. Add 15 mL lemon juice, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
Toss well and garnish with 10 g chopped parsley.
Chill before serving to allow flavors to blend.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad featuring finely diced vegetables, dressed simply with olive oil and lemon juice.

name: Italian Tortellini Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 diced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until onion is translucent.
Add 1 L vegetable broth, 400 g canned diced tomatoes, and bring to a boil.
Add 200 g fresh tortellini and cook according to package instructions until tender.
Stir in 100 g spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, topped with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty soup with cheese tortellini, tomatoes, and spinach in a savory broth, topped with Parmesan.

name: Irish Bacon and Cabbage
author: System
method: In a large pot, place 1 kg of bacon (in one piece). Cover with water, bring to a boil, then simmer for 1 hour.
Add 1 chopped head of green cabbage and 4 peeled, quartered potatoes to the pot. Cook for another 25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Remove bacon, slice, and serve with the cabbage and potatoes, drizzled with the cooking broth.
Season with pepper to taste.
description: A traditional Irish dish of gently boiled bacon served with cabbage and potatoes, flavored simply with its cooking broth.

name: Indonesian Soto Ayam
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 2 minced garlic cloves, 20 g chopped ginger, and 2 chopped lemongrass stalks; sauté until fragrant.
Add 500 g diced chicken breast, cook until lightly browned.
Pour in 1.5 L chicken broth, bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Add 200 g cooked rice noodles and heat through. Adjust seasoning with salt and a squeeze of lime.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions and fried shallots.
description: A comforting Indonesian chicken soup with noodles and aromatic herbs, perfect for soothing the soul.

name: Irish Seafood Chowder
author: System
method: In a pot, melt 30 g butter over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until translucent.
Add 200 g diced potatoes, 100 g sliced carrots, and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in 500 mL fish stock and 200 mL cream. Bring to a simmer.
Add 300 g mixed seafood (shrimp, scallops, and white fish), cook for 10 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and 5 g chopped parsley.
Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: A rich and creamy seafood chowder filled with shrimp, scallops, and white fish, rooted in Irish culinary tradition.

name: Italian Risotto Balls
author: System
method: Prepare 300 g risotto and let cool. Mix in 50 g grated Parmesan and 1 beaten egg.
Form into balls, insert a small cube of mozzarella into each, and roll to enclose.
Dip each ball in beaten egg, then roll in breadcrumbs.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden. Drain on paper towels.
Serve with marinara sauce for dipping.
description: Crispy outside, creamy inside, these risotto balls stuffed with mozzarella are a delightful Italian treat.

name: Indian Kheer
author: System
method: In a saucepan, simmer 100 g basmati rice in 500 mL milk over low heat until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens, about 25 minutes.
Add 50 g sugar, 5 g cardamom, and 50 g raisins. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Cool to room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator.
Serve cold, garnished with sliced almonds and a sprinkle of saffron.
description: A traditional Indian dessert made with rice, milk, and sugar, infused with cardamom and enriched with raisins and nuts.

name: Indonesian Bami Goreng
author: System
method: Cook 400 g egg noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
In a wok, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Stir-fry 200 g sliced chicken breast until cooked through.
Add 100 g sliced cabbage, 50 g sliced carrots, and 50 g sliced bell peppers; stir-fry until vegetables are tender.
Add noodles, 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL oyster sauce, and toss to combine.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
description: A popular Indonesian noodle dish with chicken and vegetables, seasoned with soy and oyster sauce.

name: Indian Mango Chutney
author: System
method: Peel and chop 3 ripe mangoes. In a saucepan, combine mangoes with 100 g sugar, 50 mL vinegar, 20 g grated ginger, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt.
Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Cool completely before storing in jars. Serve as an accompaniment to grilled meats or curry dishes.
description: A sweet and tangy chutney made from fresh mangoes and ginger, perfect for enhancing any meal with a burst of flavor.

name: Italian Bean and Escarole Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic; cook until soft.
Add 200 g chopped escarole and cook until wilted. Stir in 400 g canned cannellini beans (drained and rinsed) and 1 L vegetable broth; bring to a simmer.
Cook for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan.
description: A warming soup featuring tender escarole and creamy cannellini beans, seasoned with Italian flavors.

name: Indonesian Tempeh Satay
author: System
method: Cut 400 g tempeh into cubes. Marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g crushed garlic, 20 mL lime juice, and 5 g coriander powder for 1 hour.
Thread tempeh cubes onto skewers.
Grill on a preheated grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until charred on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Serve with peanut sauce for dipping.
description: Grilled tempeh skewers marinated in a flavorful blend of soy sauce, lime, and spices, served with a rich peanut sauce.

name: Irish Mussels in Garlic Butter
author: System
method: Clean 1 kg mussels under cold running water. Discard any that do not close when tapped.
In a large pot, melt 50 g butter. Add 4 cloves minced garlic and 1 chopped shallot; sauté until fragrant.
Add mussels and 200 mL white wine. Cover and steam over high heat until mussels open, about 5-7 minutes.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve with crusty bread for dipping in the sauce.
description: Fresh mussels steamed in a savory garlic butter and white wine sauce, perfect for soaking up with crusty bread.

name: Indian Spiced Chickpea Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 400 g canned chickpeas (drained and rinsed), 100 g diced cucumbers, 100 g cherry tomatoes halved, 50 g diced red onion, and 50 g chopped coriander.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL lemon juice, 30 mL olive oil, 5 g cumin, and salt to taste.
Pour dressing over the salad, mix well.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with additional coriander.
description: A vibrant and nutritious salad with chickpeas, fresh vegetables, and a tangy cumin-lemon dressing.

name: Italian Chicken Piccata
author: System
method: Pound 4 chicken breast halves to even thickness. Dredge in flour seasoned with salt and pepper.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter with 15 mL olive oil. Add chicken and cook until golden on each side.
Remove chicken, add 50 mL lemon juice, 100 mL chicken broth, and 30 g capers. Boil until reduced by half.
Return chicken to pan, cook until heated through.
Serve with sauce and a sprinkle of chopped parsley.
description: Tender chicken breasts in a lemony caper sauce, an Italian classic perfect for a refined meal.

name: Irish Beef and Stout Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg beef chunks in 15 mL vegetable oil. Remove and set aside.
Add 2 diced onions, 2 sliced carrots, and 2 minced garlic cloves to the pot; cook until softened.
Return beef to pot. Sprinkle with 30 g flour, cook for 2 minutes.
Add 500 mL stout beer and enough beef broth to cover the meat. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 2 hours.
Add 300 g chopped potatoes, cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A hearty stew with tender chunks of beef, vegetables, and a rich, dark stout-based gravy.

name: Italian Grilled Vegetables
author: System
method: Slice 1 zucchini, 1 bell pepper, 1 eggplant, and 4 large mushrooms into thick strips or slices.
Brush vegetables with a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 5 g Italian seasoning.
Grill over medium heat for 5-7 minutes on each side until tender and lightly charred.
Serve with a drizzle of balsamic glaze and fresh basil.
description: A medley of fresh vegetables, seasoned and grilled to perfection, drizzled with balsamic and garnished with basil.

name: Italian Stuffed Artichokes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Trim the tops of 4 artichokes, remove the outer leaves, and scoop out the choke. Drizzle with lemon juice to prevent browning.
Mix 100 g breadcrumbs, 50 g grated Parmesan, 2 minced garlic cloves, 10 g chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. Stuff mixture into the artichoke centers and between the leaves.
Place stuffed artichokes in a baking dish. Pour 250 mL water into the dish. Drizzle artichokes with 30 mL olive oil.
Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 20 minutes until tops are golden.
Serve warm with additional lemon wedges.
description: Tender artichokes filled with a flavorful breadcrumb and Parmesan stuffing, baked until perfectly golden.

name: Indian Butter Shrimp
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 minced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 10 g grated ginger. Cook until onion is soft.
Add 10 g garam masala, 5 g turmeric, and 400 g canned tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add 500 g cleaned shrimp and 100 mL cream. Cook until shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Stir in 30 g butter until melted and combined.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro, alongside basmati rice.
description: Creamy and rich shrimp cooked in a spiced tomato sauce with a touch of butter, served with fragrant rice.

name: Indonesian Beef Satay
author: System
method: Slice 500 g beef tenderloin into thin strips. Marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 mL lime juice, 10 g crushed garlic, and 5 g chili flakes for 2 hours.
Thread beef onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until cooked to desired doneness.
Serve with a peanut dipping sauce and cucumber salad.
description: Tender strips of beef marinated in a flavorful soy and lime mixture, grilled and served with peanut sauce.

name: Irish Lamb Pie
author: System
method: In a large skillet, brown 1 kg diced lamb in 15 mL vegetable oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 1 diced onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 minced garlic cloves. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Return lamb to skillet, add 200 mL beef broth, 100 mL red wine, and simmer for 45 minutes.
Transfer mixture to a pie dish, cover with rolled out pastry dough, and bake at 200°C for 25 minutes until golden.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Savory lamb pie with a rich gravy, encased in a flaky pastry crust, a true Irish comfort food.

name: Indian Spiced Roasted Cauliflower
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Cut 1 large cauliflower into florets. Toss with 30 mL olive oil, 10 g curry powder, 5 g turmeric, and salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes until tender and golden.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with yogurt dip.
description: Cauliflower florets seasoned with aromatic Indian spices and roasted to perfection.

name: Indonesian Gado Gado
author: System
method: Blanch 200 g green beans, 100 g bean sprouts, and 2 sliced carrots until tender-crisp.
Arrange blanched vegetables, 100 g thinly sliced cabbage, and 4 halved boiled eggs on a platter.
Prepare peanut sauce by mixing 50 mL peanut butter, 15 mL soy sauce, 15 mL lime juice, and 5 g crushed garlic.
Drizzle peanut sauce over the vegetables and eggs, garnish with fried shallots.
Serve immediately.
description: A traditional Indonesian salad featuring a mix of cooked and fresh vegetables, boiled eggs, and a rich peanut dressing.

name: Italian Lemon Chicken
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper, and brown each side.
Add the juice of 2 lemons and 100 mL chicken broth to the skillet. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 20 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with sliced lemon and chopped parsley before serving.
description: Succulent chicken breasts cooked in a bright lemon-infused sauce, an Italian classic.

name: Irish Scones
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Mix 500 g flour, 50 g sugar, 10 g baking powder, and a pinch of salt in a large bowl.
Cut in 100 g cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in 240 mL buttermilk just until the dough comes together.
Turn out onto a floured surface and gently knead. Cut into rounds with a biscuit cutter.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm with butter and jam.
description: Fluffy and lightly sweetened scones, a staple of Irish tea time, perfect with butter and jam.

name: Irish Stew with Lamb
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg diced lamb shoulder in 30 mL olive oil. Remove and set aside.
Add 2 diced onions, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until soft.
Return lamb to the pot, add 1 L beef broth, 500 g cubed potatoes, 300 g sliced carrots, and bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook over low heat for 2 hours until the lamb is tender.
Stir in 200 g chopped leeks, cook for another 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with fresh parsley, and serve.
description: A traditional Irish stew made with tender lamb, hearty vegetables, and a rich, savory broth.

name: Indonesian Ikan Bakar
author: System
method: Marinate 4 whole mackerels in a blend of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g crushed garlic, 20 g grated ginger, and juice of 1 lime for 1 hour.
Grill the fish on a preheated grill over medium heat, 7 minutes per side, until the fish is cooked through and the skin is crisp.
Serve with a spicy sambal sauce and steamed rice.
description: Grilled mackerel marinated in a flavorful mix of soy, garlic, and ginger, served with spicy sambal sauce.

name: Italian Zuppa Toscana
author: System
method: In a pot, cook 200 g sliced Italian sausage until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until translucent.
Add 1 L chicken broth, 500 g sliced potatoes, and 200 g chopped kale. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Return sausage to the pot, add 200 mL heavy cream, and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
description: A rich and creamy Tuscan soup with Italian sausage, potatoes, and kale.

name: Indian Jalebi
author: System
method: Mix 200 g all-purpose flour with 20 g gram flour, 5 g baking powder, and 200 mL yogurt to make a batter. Let it ferment overnight.
Heat 500 mL vegetable oil in a wide pan. Pour the batter in a steady stream into the oil, forming coils. Fry until crisp and golden.
Dip the fried jalebi immediately in warm sugar syrup for 2 minutes. Remove and let drain.
Serve warm or cold, garnished with pistachios.
description: Crispy, syrupy, and sweet, these classic Indian treats are a festival favorite.

name: Irish Coffee Pudding
author: System
method: In a saucepan, mix 500 mL heavy cream, 50 g sugar, and 2 tsp instant coffee. Heat until coffee and sugar dissolve.
Sprinkle 10 g gelatin over 50 mL cold water and let sit for 5 minutes. Add to the hot cream mixture and stir until dissolved.
Pour into dessert dishes and refrigerate until set, about 4 hours.
Top with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cocoa powder before serving.
description: A creamy dessert infused with the rich flavors of Irish coffee, set into a smooth pudding.

name: Italian Sausage and Peppers
author: System
method: In a skillet, cook 400 g Italian sausages over medium heat until browned and cooked through.
Remove sausages, slice into rounds. In the same skillet, add 1 sliced bell pepper and 1 sliced onion; cook until softened.
Return sausages to the skillet, add 200 mL marinara sauce, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve on hoagie rolls or with a side of pasta.
description: Flavorful Italian sausages cooked with bell peppers and onions in a rich marinara sauce.

name: Indonesian Coconut Curry
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 20 g minced ginger, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 chopped onion. Cook until onion is soft.
Add 500 g diced chicken, cook until browned. Stir in 20 g curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in 400 mL coconut milk and 200 mL chicken stock. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Add 100 g diced tomatoes and 100 g sliced bell peppers, cook for 10 more minutes.
Season with salt and serve with steamed rice.
description: A rich and flavorful curry with tender chicken, infused with coconut milk and traditional Indonesian spices.

name: Israeli Beet Salad
author: System
method: Boil 400 g peeled and diced beets until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and cool.
In a large bowl, combine beets with 100 g crumbled feta cheese and 50 g chopped walnuts.
Dress with a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, and salt to taste.
Chill before serving, garnished with fresh mint.
description: A refreshing salad of tender beets, rich feta, and crunchy walnuts, dressed with a simple lemon and olive oil vinaigrette.

name: Juicy Grilled Steak
author: System
method: Season 1 kg of steak (ribeye or sirloin) with 10 g of salt and 5 g of black pepper.
Preheat grill to high heat. Grill steaks for 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
Serve with a side of garlic butter mushrooms and roasted potatoes.
description: Perfectly grilled steak, seasoned simply and cooked to tender perfection.

name: Japanese Miso Soup
author: System
method: Bring 1 liter of water to a boil and add 20 g of dried seaweed. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir in 100 g of miso paste until fully dissolved.
Add 200 g of tofu cubes and 5 g of chopped scallions. Heat through for 3 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with more scallions.
description: A traditional Japanese soup with miso, seaweed, tofu, and scallions, offering a warm and soothing flavor.

name: Jalapeño Cheddar Cornbread
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of cornmeal, 100 g of all-purpose flour, 10 g of baking powder, and 5 g of salt.
Stir in 1 beaten egg, 250 mL of milk, and 50 mL of melted butter.
Fold in 100 g of shredded cheddar cheese and 50 g of diced jalapeños.
Pour into a greased baking dish and bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes or until golden.
Serve warm, cut into squares.
description: Savory cornbread infused with spicy jalapeños and rich cheddar cheese, perfect as a side for chili or barbecues.

name: Jerusalem Artichoke Soup
author: System
method: Peel and chop 500 g of Jerusalem artichokes and 1 onion.
Sauté in 30 mL of olive oil until the onion is translucent.
Add 1 liter of vegetable stock and simmer for 30 minutes until the artichokes are tender.
Blend until smooth, season with salt and pepper, and stir in 50 mL of cream.
Serve hot, garnished with a drizzle of truffle oil and chopped chives.
description: A creamy, earthy soup made from Jerusalem artichokes, enriched with a touch of cream and truffle oil for added luxury.

name: Jambalaya with Shrimp and Sausage
author: System
method: Brown 200 g of sliced Andouille sausage in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped bell pepper, and 2 minced garlic cloves, sauté until soft.
Stir in 300 g of rice, 400 g of canned tomatoes, 500 mL of chicken broth, 5 g of paprika, and 5 g of thyme.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add 300 g of shrimp and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A hearty Creole dish with spicy sausage, tender shrimp, and rice, bursting with flavors and perfect for feeding a crowd.

name: Japanese Eggplant Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Slice 400 g of Japanese eggplant and salt lightly.
Heat 30 mL of sesame oil in a wok and stir-fry the eggplant until it begins to soften.
Add 100 g of sliced red bell peppers and 50 g of green onions and stir-fry for another 5 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL of soy sauce and 15 mL of mirin before serving.
Garnish with sesame seeds.
description: Quick and easy stir-fry featuring tender Japanese eggplant and crisp bell peppers, flavored with soy sauce and mirin.

name: Jicama and Carrot Slaw
author: System
method: Julienne 200 g of jicama and 200 g of carrots.
Toss with 30 mL of lime juice, 15 mL of honey, and 5 g of chopped cilantro.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve as a refreshing side dish to grilled meats or tacos.
description: A crisp and refreshing slaw made with jicama and carrots, dressed with a sweet and tangy lime and honey dressing.

name: Jalapeño Popper Chicken
author: System
method: Slice 4 chicken breasts to create a pocket. Stuff with a mixture of 100 g of cream cheese, 50 g of chopped jalapeños, and 50 g of shredded cheddar cheese.
Secure with toothpicks and season with salt and pepper.
Grill over medium heat until the chicken is cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side.
Serve hot, garnished with extra jalapeños and a dollop of sour cream.
description: Chicken breasts stuffed with a spicy and creamy filling, grilled to perfection, embodying the flavors of jalapeño poppers.

name: Juniper Berry Roasted Game Hen
author: System
method: Crush 10 g of juniper berries and mix with 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of black pepper.
Rub the mixture over 2 game hens and stuff with 1 sliced lemon and a few sprigs of rosemary.
Roast at 190°C (374°F) for 50 minutes or until the hens are golden and the juices run clear.
Rest for 10 minutes before serving with a side of wild rice.
description: Flavorful roasted game hens seasoned with juniper berries and rosemary, offering a unique taste experience.

name: Jamaican Jerk Tofu
author: System
method: Press and cube 400 g of firm tofu.
Marinate in a blend of 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL vinegar, 10 g jerk seasoning, and 5 g minced garlic for 2 hours.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 20 minutes, turning halfway through.
Serve with coconut rice and steamed greens.
description: Spicy and flavorful jerk-marinated tofu, baked until crispy, served with a side of creamy coconut rice.

name: Japanese Style Grilled Fish
author: System
method: Marinate 4 fish fillets (such as sea bass) in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL mirin, 15 mL sake, and 5 g grated ginger for 1 hour.
Grill the fillets over medium heat until cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve with steamed rice and sprinkle with finely chopped green onions.
description: Delicately flavored grilled fish, marinated in traditional Japanese ingredients for a simple yet elegant meal.

name: Jerk Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Cube 500 g of chicken breast and marinate in 50 mL of jerk marinade for at least 2 hours.
Thread the chicken onto skewers, alternating with pieces of bell pepper and onion.
Grill over medium-high heat for 6-7 minutes on each side until cooked through.
Serve with a mango salsa on the side.
description: Spicy jerk chicken skewers, grilled with fresh vegetables and served with a sweet mango salsa.

name: Jalapeño Lime Rice
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of rice according to package instructions.
In a skillet, sauté 2 finely chopped jalapeños in 15 mL of olive oil until soft.
Add the cooked rice, juice of 2 limes, and 5 g of salt. Mix well.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: A zesty side dish of fluffy rice infused with the tangy flavors of lime and the heat of jalapeños.

name: Juniper Spiced Venison
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of venison loin with a mix of 10 g crushed juniper berries, 5 g salt, and 5 g black pepper.
Sear in a hot pan with 30 mL of olive oil, then roast in the oven at 180°C (356°F) for 15 minutes.
Let rest for 10 minutes, then slice and serve with a red wine reduction and roasted root vegetables.
description: Rich and flavorful venison seasoned with juniper berries, offering a unique gamey taste perfect for a special dinner.

name: Jicama Mango Salad
author: System
method: Peel and julienne 200 g of jicama and 1 ripe mango.
Toss with the juice of 1 lime, 5 g of chili powder, and 5 g of salt.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving to blend the flavors.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves.
description: A refreshing and crunchy salad combining the sweetness of mango and the mild flavor of jicama with a hint of lime and chili.

name: Jamaican Pepper Pot Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves of minced garlic in 30 mL of vegetable oil until soft.
Add 1 chopped bell pepper, 200 g of sliced okra, and 300 g of diced potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in 1 liter of beef broth and add 200 g of chopped spinach. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with 5 g of allspice, salt, and pepper. Serve hot.
description: A hearty and spicy Jamaican soup filled with vegetables and flavored with allspice, perfect for warming up on a cold day.

name: Japanese Pumpkin Curry
author: System
method: Peel and cube 500 g of kabocha squash.
In a pot, heat 30 mL of coconut oil and sauté 1 chopped onion and 1 minced garlic clove until translucent.
Add the kabocha squash, 200 mL of coconut milk, 200 mL of vegetable stock, and 10 g of curry powder.
Simmer for 25 minutes or until the squash is tender.
Serve over steamed rice and garnish with chopped cilantro.
description: A warm and comforting Japanese-inspired curry featuring sweet kabocha squash and rich coconut milk.

name: Jalapeño Cheese Dip
author: System
method: In a saucepan, melt 50 g of butter and stir in 30 g of flour to make a roux.
Gradually add 250 mL of milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Mix in 100 g of shredded cheddar cheese and 50 g of diced jalapeños until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with tortilla chips.
description: A creamy and spicy cheese dip, loaded with jalapeños, perfect for parties or as a tasty snack.

name: Jerk Spiced Sweet Potato Fries
author: System
method: Peel and cut 600 g of sweet potatoes into fries.
Toss with 30 mL of olive oil and 10 g of jerk spice mix.
Spread on a baking sheet and bake at 220°C (428°F) for 25 minutes, turning halfway through.
Serve hot, garnished with a sprinkle of sea salt.
description: Crispy baked sweet potato fries seasoned with a fiery jerk spice blend, a delicious twist on a classic snack.

name: Jicama Cucumber Salad
author: System
method: Peel and julienne 200 g of jicama and 200 g of cucumber.
Toss with 30 mL of lime juice, 5 g of chili powder, and 5 g of salt.
Refrigerate for 1 hour before serving to enhance flavors.
Garnish with fresh chopped mint and serve as a refreshing side dish.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad with the unique texture of jicama and cucumber, spiced with chili and brightened with lime.

name: Juniper Berry and Citrus Roasted Turkey
author: System
method: Rub a 3 kg turkey with a mixture of 10 g crushed juniper berries, zest of 1 orange, zest of 1 lemon, 10 g salt, and 5 g black pepper.
Stuff the turkey with the orange and lemon halves and a bunch of thyme.
Roast in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 3 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F).
Rest for 20 minutes before carving. Serve with cranberry sauce.
description: Festive roasted turkey enhanced with the aromatic flavors of juniper berries and fresh citrus, perfect for holiday celebrations.

name: Japanese Beef Curry
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of cubed beef in 30 mL of vegetable oil in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped carrots, and 2 chopped potatoes and sauté for 5 minutes.
Stir in 750 mL of beef broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and add 100 g of Japanese curry roux.
Simmer for 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened.
Serve over steamed rice, garnished with pickled radish.
description: A rich and hearty Japanese curry with tender beef and vegetables, served over rice for a satisfying meal.

name: Jerk Pork Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork ribs with 50 g of jerk seasoning.
Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 160°C (320°F). Place ribs on a baking tray and cover with foil.
Bake for 3 hours until the meat is tender.
Uncover and broil for 10 minutes to crisp the exterior.
Serve with coleslaw and cornbread.
description: Slow-cooked pork ribs coated in spicy jerk seasoning, finished under the broiler for a crispy exterior.

name: Jalapeño Honey Chicken
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of honey, 15 mL of lime juice, 1 minced jalapeño, and 5 g of minced garlic.
Marinate 4 chicken thighs in the mixture for 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until the chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 7 minutes per side.
Serve with a fresh avocado salad.
description: Sweet and spicy grilled chicken thighs marinated in a jalapeño honey sauce, paired with a cool avocado salad.

name: Japanese Pancakes
author: System
method: Whisk together 100 g of flour, 5 g of baking powder, 1 beaten egg, 150 mL of milk, and 30 mL of vegetable oil to form a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick skillet over low heat. Pour in batter to form 10 cm wide pancakes.
Cook slowly until fluffy and golden, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with maple syrup and fresh fruit.
description: Thick and fluffy Japanese-style pancakes, lightly sweetened and cooked to a soft perfection.

name: Jicama Tacos
author: System
method: Peel and slice 200 g of jicama into thin rounds to use as taco shells.
Fill each shell with 200 g of grilled chicken, 50 g of diced tomatoes, and 30 g of shredded lettuce.
Top with 30 mL of cilantro-lime dressing and serve immediately.
description: A light and refreshing take on tacos, using crisp jicama slices as the shell, filled with grilled chicken and fresh vegetables.

name: Juicy Lemon Chicken
author: System
method: Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Brown in a skillet with 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat.
Add the juice of 2 lemons and 100 mL of chicken broth. Simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Garnish with sliced lemons and chopped parsley before serving.
description: Simple yet flavorful chicken breasts, pan-seared and simmered in a lemony broth, enhancing the chicken's natural juiciness.

name: Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail
author: System
method: Boil 20 jumbo shrimp in salted water for 2 minutes, then plunge into ice water to stop the cooking process.
Serve chilled with a sauce made from 100 g of ketchup, 15 mL of horseradish, juice of 1 lemon, and a dash of Worcestershire sauce.
description: Classic shrimp cocktail with perfectly cooked jumbo shrimp, served with a zesty homemade cocktail sauce.

name: Jalapeño Bacon Wrapped Poppers
author: System
method: Halve 10 jalapeños and remove the seeds. Stuff with a mixture of 100 g cream cheese and 50 g shredded cheddar cheese.
Wrap each jalapeño half with a slice of bacon.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes or until the bacon is crispy.
Serve hot.
description: Spicy jalapeños filled with creamy cheese and wrapped in crispy bacon, a perfect blend of textures and flavors.

name: Jamaican Banana Fritters
author: System
method: Mash 4 ripe bananas in a bowl. Mix in 100 g of flour, 50 g of sugar, 5 g of baking powder, and a pinch of nutmeg.
Heat 30 mL of vegetable oil in a skillet. Drop spoonfuls of the banana mixture into the oil and fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and dust with powdered sugar before serving.
description: Sweet and soft fritters made with ripe bananas and a hint of nutmeg, fried to a golden perfection.

name: Juniper-Citrus Cured Salmon
author: System
method: Mix 50 g of salt, 50 g of sugar, 10 g crushed juniper berries, zest of 1 orange, and zest of 1 lemon.
Cover 500 g of salmon fillet with the mixture and wrap tightly in plastic wrap.
Cure in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
Rinse off the cure, slice thinly, and serve with cream cheese and capers on rye bread.
description: Elegantly cured salmon with a blend of juniper, citrus zests, salt, and sugar, creating a luxurious and flavorful dish.

name: Japanese Sweet Potato Soup
author: System
method: Peel and cube 600 g of Japanese sweet potatoes.
Sauté 1 chopped onion in 30 mL of sesame oil until translucent.
Add sweet potatoes, 1 liter of vegetable broth, and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the soup until smooth, season with salt and pepper, and stir in 50 mL of coconut milk.
Serve hot, garnished with toasted sesame seeds and a drizzle of soy sauce.
description: Creamy and comforting soup made with Japanese sweet potatoes, subtly enhanced with sesame and coconut flavors.

name: Jalapeño Cheddar Biscuits
author: System
method: Combine 250 g of all-purpose flour, 10 g of baking powder, 5 g of sugar, and 5 g of salt in a bowl.
Cut in 50 g of cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in 100 g of shredded cheddar cheese and 50 g of diced jalapeños.
Add 120 mL of milk and stir until the dough comes together.
Drop spoonfuls onto a baking sheet and bake at 220°C (428°F) for 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm with butter.
description: Flaky and buttery biscuits loaded with sharp cheddar cheese and spicy jalapeños, perfect for a savory snack or breakfast.

name: Jamaican Plantain Porridge
author: System
method: Peel and slice 2 ripe plantains.
Blend plantains with 500 mL of milk until smooth.
Pour the mixture into a pot and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened, about 15 minutes.
Sweeten with 30 g of sugar and a pinch of nutmeg.
Serve hot, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
description: A traditional Jamaican breakfast dish, this creamy porridge made with ripe plantains is both nourishing and comforting.

name: Japanese Tofu Steak
author: System
method: Drain and press 400 g of firm tofu to remove excess water.
Slice the tofu into 1 cm thick steaks.
Pan-fry in 15 mL of sesame oil over medium heat until golden on each side, about 3 minutes per side.
Deglaze the pan with 30 mL of soy sauce and 15 mL of mirin, and simmer for 1 minute.
Serve the tofu steaks with the pan sauce and a sprinkle of chopped scallions.
description: Savory and simple tofu steaks, pan-fried to perfection and glazed with a light soy-mirin sauce.

name: Jersey Royal Potato Salad
author: System
method: Boil 500 g of Jersey Royal potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes.
Drain and while still warm, toss with 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of white wine vinegar, and 5 g of salt.
Add 50 g of chopped fresh chives and 50 g of sliced radishes.
Allow to cool to room temperature before serving.
description: A light and fresh potato salad using Jersey Royals, enhanced with the crunch of radishes and the onion-like taste of chives.

name: Juniper Berry Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: Simmer 300 g of baby carrots in water until just tender, about 7 minutes.
Drain and toss with a glaze made from 15 mL of honey, 5 crushed juniper berries, and 15 mL of butter.
Cook over medium heat for an additional 5 minutes until glazed.
Season with a pinch of salt and serve warm.
description: Sweet carrots enhanced with a unique juniper berry and honey glaze, a delightful side dish with a twist.

name: Jicama and Orange Salad
author: System
method: Peel and julienne 250 g of jicama.
Peel and segment 3 oranges, catching any juice and combining it with 15 mL of lime juice and 30 mL of olive oil to make a dressing.
Toss the jicama and orange segments with the dressing.
Chill for 30 minutes and serve garnished with chopped cilantro and toasted pumpkin seeds.
description: A refreshing and crunchy salad featuring jicama and sweet oranges, dressed with a citrusy homemade vinaigrette.

name: Jackfruit Vegan Tacos
author: System
method: Shred 500 g of canned young jackfruit.
Sauté in 30 mL of olive oil with 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves until the onion is soft.
Add 30 mL of BBQ sauce and 5 g of smoked paprika, cook for 10 more minutes.
Serve on corn tortillas with avocado slices and fresh salsa.
description: Smoky and hearty vegan tacos made with pulled jackfruit, a perfect meat substitute packed with flavor.

name: Jalapeño Mango Chutney
author: System
method: Peel and dice 2 ripe mangoes. Finely chop 2 jalapeños.
Combine mangoes, jalapeños, 50 g of sugar, 30 mL of vinegar, and a pinch of salt in a saucepan.
Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Cool and store in jars. Serve as a condiment with grilled meats or cheese.
description: A sweet and spicy chutney featuring tropical mangoes and fiery jalapeños, perfect as a versatile condiment.

name: Jasmine Tea Smoked Duck
author: System
method: Rub a whole duck with a mixture of 5 g of salt, 5 g of sugar, and 5 g of five-spice powder.
Fill a wok with a mixture of 100 g of rice, 50 g of sugar, 50 g of jasmine tea leaves, and heat until it starts to smoke.
Place the duck on a rack in the wok, cover, and smoke for 1 hour over low heat.
Serve sliced with hoisin sauce and pancakes.
description: Exquisitely smoked duck with the delicate aroma of jasmine tea, creating a unique and flavorful dish.

name: Jerusalem Artichoke and Leek Quiche
author: System
method: Slice 200 g of Jerusalem artichokes and 1 leek. Sauté in 30 mL of butter until soft.
Whisk together 3 eggs, 100 mL of cream, 50 g of grated Gruyère cheese, salt, and pepper.
Pour the egg mixture over the sautéed vegetables in a pre-baked pie crust.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes or until set.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A savory quiche combining earthy Jerusalem artichokes and sweet leeks, enriched with creamy Gruyère cheese.

name: Jumbo Lump Crab Cakes
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of jumbo lump crabmeat with 100 g of breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, 30 mL of mayonnaise, 15 mL of Dijon mustard, and 5 g of chopped parsley.
Form into 8 cakes and refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.
Pan-fry in 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat until golden brown on each side, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce.
description: Luxurious crab cakes made with jumbo lump crabmeat, lightly seasoned and pan-fried to a perfect golden crisp.

name: Japanese Soy Glazed Eggplant
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants into rounds.
Brush with a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL mirin, and 15 mL sake.
Grill or broil the eggplant slices until tender and slightly charred, about 5 minutes per side.
Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped scallions before serving.
description: Tender eggplant slices glazed with a savory soy sauce mixture, enhanced with the subtle sweetness of mirin and sake.

name: Jerk Shrimp and Pineapple Skewers
author: System
method: Marinate 400 g of shrimp in 30 mL of jerk seasoning paste for 1 hour.
Thread shrimp and chunks of pineapple onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until the shrimp are cooked through, about 6 minutes.
Serve with a side of coconut rice.
description: Spicy jerk-seasoned shrimp paired with sweet pineapple, grilled to perfection. A tropical and tasty combination.

name: Jordanian Mansaf
author: System
method: Simmer 1 kg of lamb chunks in a pot with 1 liter of water, 1 chopped onion, and spices for 1.5 hours until the lamb is tender.
Dissolve 200 g of jameed (dried yogurt) in 500 mL of the cooking broth, then pour back into the pot and simmer for another 30 minutes.
Serve the lamb over a bed of rice garnished with toasted pine nuts and chopped parsley.
description: A traditional Jordanian dish featuring tender lamb cooked in a unique jameed broth, served over fragrant rice.

name: Juicy Stuffed Jalapeños
author: System
method: Halve and deseed 12 jalapeños.
Mix 200 g of cream cheese with 100 g of grated cheddar and 50 g of chopped bacon.
Stuff the jalapeño halves with the mixture and wrap each with a slice of bacon.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes until the bacon is crispy.
Serve hot.
description: Creamy and spicy jalapeños filled with a rich cheese and bacon mix, wrapped in bacon for extra flavor.

name: Jamaican Banana Bread
author: System
method: Cream together 100 g of butter and 150 g of sugar.
Add 2 beaten eggs and 3 mashed ripe bananas.
Mix in 250 g of flour, 5 g of baking soda, and a pinch of salt.
Fold in 50 g of chopped walnuts and pour into a greased loaf pan.
Bake at 175°C (347°F) for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Cool and serve sliced.
description: Moist and flavorful banana bread with a hint of tropical Jamaican flair, enhanced with walnuts for a crunchy texture.

name: Japanese Ginger Pork
author: System
method: Slice 500 g of pork loin into thin strips.
Marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL sake, 10 g grated ginger, and 5 g sugar for at least 1 hour.
Heat 15 mL of vegetable oil in a skillet and sauté the pork until fully cooked, about 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice and pickled vegetables.
description: Tender slices of pork marinated in ginger and soy sauce, a quick and delicious Japanese-inspired dish.

name: Jerusalem Artichoke Dip
author: System
method: Peel and boil 300 g of Jerusalem artichokes until soft, about 20 minutes.
Blend with 100 g of cream cheese, 50 mL of sour cream, and salt and pepper to taste until smooth.
Stir in 5 g of chopped chives and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
Serve with vegetable sticks and crackers.
description: A creamy and smooth dip made from Jerusalem artichokes, paired with cream cheese and sour cream for a rich texture.

name: Jungle Juice Cocktail
author: System
method: In a large pitcher, combine 500 mL of fruit punch, 250 mL of orange juice, 250 mL of pineapple juice, and 120 mL of rum.
Add slices of various fruits such as oranges, lemons, and pineapples.
Chill for at least 2 hours to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve over ice in tall glasses.
description: A vibrant and fruity cocktail packed with a mix of juices and rum, perfect for a party or gathering.

name: Jumbo Stuffed Shells
author: System
method: Cook 24 jumbo pasta shells according to package directions.
Mix 500 g of ricotta cheese, 100 g of spinach, 1 beaten egg, 50 g of grated Parmesan, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of black pepper.
Stuff the cooked shells with the cheese mixture.
Pour 500 mL of marinara sauce into a baking dish, arrange the stuffed shells, and top with 100 g of shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes or until bubbly.
Serve hot.
description: Cheese and spinach stuffed pasta shells, baked in marinara sauce and topped with mozzarella cheese.

name: Japanese Chicken Yakitori
author: System
method: Cut 400 g of chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces.
Skewer the chicken pieces and season with salt.
Grill over medium heat, brushing frequently with a mix of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL mirin, 15 mL sake, and 5 g sugar, until cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
description: Traditional Japanese grilled chicken skewers, glazed with a sweet and savory sauce, perfect for a quick meal or appetizer.

name: Jerk Beef Stew
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of cubed beef brisket in 30 mL of vegetable oil in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 200 g of diced potatoes.
Stir in 5 g of jerk seasoning, 500 mL of beef broth, and bring to a simmer.
Cook covered for 2 hours or until the beef is tender.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh cilantro.
description: Hearty and spicy jerk-seasoned beef stew with tender potatoes and aromatic herbs, a comforting meal for any day.

name: Jalapeño Honey Glazed Salmon
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of honey with 15 mL of finely chopped jalapeños and 5 mL of soy sauce.
Place 4 salmon fillets on a baking sheet and brush with the jalapeño honey glaze.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with lime wedges and serve.
description: Sweet and spicy glazed salmon, with a hint of jalapeño heat, baked to flaky perfection.

name: Jamaican Spiced Corn Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 1 chopped bell pepper in 30 mL of coconut oil.
Add 400 g of fresh corn kernels, 1 chopped Scotch bonnet pepper, 500 mL of vegetable broth, and 200 mL of coconut milk.
Simmer for 20 minutes, then blend until smooth.
Reheat, adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, and serve hot with chopped chives.
description: A creamy and vibrantly flavored Jamaican-inspired corn soup, with a touch of heat from Scotch bonnet peppers.

name: Jelly Filled Doughnuts
author: System
method: Prepare dough by mixing 500 g of flour, 100 g of sugar, 10 g of yeast, 5 g of salt, 250 mL of warm milk, 1 beaten egg, and 50 g of melted butter.
Knead until smooth and let rise for 1 hour.
Roll out dough, cut into rounds, and spoon 15 mL of jelly into the center of half the rounds.
Top with the other half, seal edges, and let rise for 30 minutes.
Fry in 180°C (356°F) oil until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Roll in sugar and serve warm.
description: Sweet, fluffy doughnuts filled with jelly and dusted with sugar, a delightful treat for any time of day.

name: Juniper Berry Game Pie
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of mixed game meat (venison, rabbit, pheasant) in 30 mL of oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 300 mL of beef stock. Simmer for 1 hour.
Add 10 crushed juniper berries, 100 mL of red wine, and thicken with a flour-water paste.
Pour into a pie dish, cover with pie dough, and bake at 200°C (392°F) for 30 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: A hearty and rustic pie filled with tender game meat and flavored with juniper berries and red wine.

name: Jamaican Curry Goat
author: System
method: Marinate 1 kg of goat meat in a mixture of 30 mL curry powder, 5 g allspice, 5 cloves of minced garlic, and juice of 1 lime for 3 hours.
Brown the goat meat in a pot with 30 mL of oil. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 chopped tomatoes.
Cover with water and simmer for 2 hours until meat is tender.
Serve with rice and peas.
description: Authentic Jamaican dish featuring succulent goat meat slow-cooked with a robust blend of spices.

name: Jelly Bean Bark
author: System
method: Melt 300 g of white chocolate in a double boiler.
Pour the melted chocolate onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Sprinkle 100 g of assorted jelly beans over the chocolate.
Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. Break into pieces and serve.
description: A colorful and sweet treat, perfect for parties, featuring creamy white chocolate studded with vibrant jelly beans.

name: Japanese Udon Noodle Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, bring 1 liter of chicken broth to a boil. Add 200 g udon noodles and cook for 10 minutes.
Add 100 g of sliced mushrooms, 100 g of baby spinach, and 30 mL of soy sauce.
Simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions and a boiled egg halved.
description: A comforting and simple Japanese noodle soup with udon noodles, fresh vegetables, and a savory broth.

name: Jicama Watermelon Salad
author: System
method: Combine 200 g of jicama cut into matchsticks, 300 g of cubed watermelon, and 100 g of crumbled feta cheese in a bowl.
Drizzle with a dressing made from 30 mL of lime juice, 15 mL of honey, and 5 g of chopped mint.
Toss gently and chill before serving.
description: A refreshing and crunchy salad perfect for summer, combining the sweetness of watermelon with the mild flavor of jicama, accented with feta and mint.

name: Jerky Spice Rubbed Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork ribs with a mixture of 10 g smoked paprika, 5 g garlic powder, 5 g onion powder, and 10 g salt.
Wrap the ribs in foil and bake at 150°C (302°F) for 3 hours.
Unwrap, increase oven temperature to 220°C (428°F), and bake for an additional 20 minutes to crisp.
Serve with BBQ sauce on the side.
description: Slow-cooked pork ribs seasoned with a homemade jerky spice mix, finished in the oven for a crispy exterior.

name: Jumbo Shrimp Scampi
author: System
method: Sauté 400 g of jumbo shrimp in 30 mL of olive oil and 5 cloves of minced garlic until pink, about 3 minutes.
Deglaze the pan with 100 mL of white wine and add 15 mL of lemon juice. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Stir in 15 g of chopped parsley and 50 g of butter until the butter is melted.
Serve over cooked linguine and garnish with more parsley.
description: Garlic and lemon-infused jumbo shrimp served over linguine, a classic Italian-American seafood dish.

name: Japanese Miso Eggplant
author: System
method: Slice 2 large eggplants in half lengthwise. Score the flesh in a diamond pattern.
Brush with a mixture of 30 mL miso paste, 15 mL mirin, 15 mL sake, and 5 g sugar.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes or until tender.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
description: Rich and savory miso-glazed eggplant, a popular Japanese side dish that's both simple and delicious.

name: Jerk Chicken Pizza
author: System
method: Spread 200 g of jerk-seasoned chicken, pre-cooked and shredded, over a prepared pizza dough.
Top with 100 g of mozzarella cheese, 50 g of pineapple chunks, and 50 g of sliced red onions.
Bake at 220°C (428°F) for 15 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Drizzle with BBQ sauce before serving.
description: A spicy and sweet fusion pizza with jerk chicken and pineapple, perfect for a flavorful dinner.

name: Japanese Beef Bowl
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of thinly sliced beef in 30 mL of sesame oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté 1 sliced onion until translucent. Add the beef back to the pan.
Mix in 30 mL of soy sauce, 30 mL of sake, and 15 mL of mirin. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve the beef and onion mixture over steamed rice, topped with a fried egg and pickled ginger.
description: A traditional Japanese dish featuring savory beef and onions over rice, garnished with a fried egg for extra richness.

name: Jalapeño Cheddar Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, melt 30 g of butter. Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced jalapeños, sauté until soft.
Stir in 30 g of flour to form a roux. Gradually add 500 mL of milk and 250 mL of chicken broth, stirring continuously until thickened.
Add 200 g of shredded cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with crumbled bacon and extra jalapeño slices.
description: Creamy and spicy cheddar soup with a kick of jalapeño, topped with crispy bacon for a perfect comfort meal.

name: Jicama Slaw with Citrus Vinaigrette
author: System
method: Julienne 300 g of jicama, 100 g of carrot, and 100 g of red cabbage.
Whisk together 30 mL of orange juice, 15 mL of lime juice, 15 mL of honey, and 30 mL of olive oil for the dressing.
Toss the julienned vegetables with the dressing and let sit for 30 minutes to marinate.
Serve chilled, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: A crisp and refreshing slaw made from jicama, carrots, and red cabbage, dressed in a sweet citrus vinaigrette.

name: Jalapeño Cheddar Quiche
author: System
method: Prepare a pie crust in a 9-inch pan. Pre-bake at 190°C (375°F) for 10 minutes.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL of cream, 100 g of shredded cheddar cheese, 30 g of diced jalapeños, and 5 g of salt.
Pour the egg mixture into the crust and bake at 175°C (350°F) for 35 minutes, or until set.
Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
description: A spicy and cheesy quiche with jalapeños and cheddar, perfect for brunch or a light dinner.

name: Japanese Soba Noodle Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g of soba noodles according to package instructions, then rinse under cold water and drain.
Combine noodles with 100 g of sliced cucumber, 50 g of shredded carrots, and 50 g of sliced green onions.
Whisk together 30 mL of soy sauce, 15 mL of sesame oil, 15 mL of rice vinegar, and 5 g of sugar to make a dressing.
Toss the noodles and vegetables with the dressing and chill before serving.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve cold.
description: A refreshing and light salad featuring soba noodles and fresh vegetables, dressed in a tangy Asian-inspired sauce.

name: Jamaican Fried Plantains
author: System
method: Slice 4 ripe plantains into 1 cm thick rounds.
Heat 30 mL of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Fry plantain slices in batches until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt to serve.
description: Sweet and caramelized fried plantains, a popular Jamaican side dish that pairs well with both sweet and savory meals.

name: Jerk Pork Belly
author: System
method: Score 1 kg of pork belly and rub with 50 g of jerk seasoning.
Marinate for at least 4 hours in the fridge.
Roast in a preheated oven at 160°C (320°F) for 2.5 hours.
Increase heat to 220°C (428°F) and roast for an additional 30 minutes to crisp the skin.
Slice and serve with a side of coleslaw and fried dumplings.
description: Slow-roasted pork belly with a fiery jerk spice crust, delivering a rich and flavorful Caribbean experience.

name: Japanese Rice Balls
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of sushi rice according to package instructions and let cool slightly.
Wet hands and form rice into 12 small balls.
Make an indentation in each ball and fill with a mixture of 50 g of finely chopped cooked salmon and 15 g of finely chopped pickled plums.
Reshape to enclose the filling, then roll in 5 g of sesame seeds.
Serve at room temperature with soy sauce for dipping.
description: Traditional Japanese onigiri, or rice balls, filled with savory salmon and tangy pickled plums, wrapped in nori seaweed.

name: Juniper Spiced Venison Steaks
author: System
method: Crush 10 g of juniper berries and mix with 5 g of salt, 5 g of black pepper, and 2 g of dried thyme.
Rub the mixture onto 4 venison steaks.
Heat 15 mL of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the steaks for 5 minutes per side for medium rare.
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving with a side of roasted root vegetables.
description: Flavorful venison steaks enhanced with a juniper berry rub, offering a robust and earthy flavor.

name: Japanese Matcha Tiramisu
author: System
method: Whisk together 3 egg yolks and 50 g of sugar until pale and fluffy.
Fold in 250 g of mascarpone and 5 g of matcha powder.
Dip ladyfingers in a mixture of 100 mL of water and 15 g of matcha powder, then layer into a serving dish.
Spread the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers. Repeat layering and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Dust with additional matcha powder before serving.
description: A delightful twist on the classic Italian dessert using matcha green tea for a distinctive flavor and color.

name: Jalapeño Lime Grilled Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 30 mL lime juice, 15 mL olive oil, 1 minced jalapeño, and 5 g salt for 1 hour.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 7 minutes per side.
Serve with a fresh corn salsa made from 200 g of corn, 100 g of diced tomatoes, 50 g of diced red onion, and 15 mL of lime juice.
description: Zesty and mildly spicy grilled chicken perfectly paired with a vibrant and sweet corn salsa.

name: Korean Beef Bulgogi
author: System
method: Slice 500 g beef sirloin thinly. Marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 mL sesame oil, 10 g sugar, 20 g minced garlic, and 10 g grated ginger for at least 2 hours.
Heat a grill pan over high heat and cook the beef until browned and slightly charred, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve with steamed rice and garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
description: A popular Korean dish featuring thinly sliced beef marinated in a sweet and savory sauce, grilled to perfection.

name: Kale and Quinoa Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g quinoa according to package instructions. Let cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, 200 g chopped kale, 100 g diced apples, and 50 g crumbled goat cheese.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL apple cider vinegar, 5 g mustard, and salt to taste.
Toss the salad with the dressing and chill before serving. Garnish with 30 g toasted walnuts.
description: A hearty and healthy salad with nutty quinoa, fresh kale, sweet apples, and tangy goat cheese, dressed in a zesty vinaigrette.

name: Kashmiri Rogan Josh
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Add 500 g cubed lamb, brown all sides. Remove lamb and set aside.
In the same pot, add 2 crushed cardamom pods, 1 cinnamon stick, 5 cloves, and 1 bay leaf; fry for 1 minute.
Add 1 minced onion, cook until golden. Return lamb to the pot with 1 tsp Kashmiri chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric, and 1 tsp salt.
Add 500 mL water and simmer covered for 1 hour until lamb is tender.
Stir in 100 mL yogurt, cook for an additional 10 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander.
Serve with naan or rice.
description: A rich and aromatic Kashmiri dish, Rogan Josh features tender lamb in a complex sauce of Indian spices and yogurt.

name: Kiwi Spinach Smoothie
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 2 peeled kiwis, 100 g fresh spinach, 1 sliced banana, 200 mL apple juice, and a handful of ice.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately, garnished with a slice of kiwi.
description: A refreshing and nutritious smoothie made with fresh kiwis, spinach, and banana, blended with apple juice for a sweet touch.

name: Korean Kimchi Pancakes
author: System
method: In a mixing bowl, combine 200 g all-purpose flour, 300 mL water, and 1 tsp salt to make a batter.
Stir in 200 g chopped kimchi and 50 g sliced green onions.
Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Pour in batter to form pancakes, cook until the edges are crisp and golden, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve hot with a dipping sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL sesame oil.
description: Savory pancakes loaded with tangy kimchi and green onions, fried to crispy perfection.

name: Kale Caesar Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, toss 300 g chopped kale with 50 g grated Parmesan, 50 g croutons, and Caesar dressing to coat.
For the dressing, blend together 1 crushed garlic clove, 5 mL anchovy paste, 30 mL lemon juice, 5 mL Dijon mustard, 50 mL olive oil, and 20 g grated Parmesan until smooth.
Drizzle dressing over the kale, toss again, and serve topped with more Parmesan and croutons.
description: A hearty twist on the classic Caesar salad, using kale instead of romaine for a nutritional boost.

name: Kashmiri Pulao
author: System
method: In a large saucepan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 2 cardamom pods, 1 cinnamon stick, 3 cloves, and 1 bay leaf; sauté for 1 minute.
Add 300 g basmati rice and 600 mL water, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until rice is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Stir in 100 g mixed dried fruits (raisins, apricots, cashews) and 10 g saffron soaked in 15 mL warm milk. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and serve garnished with fresh mint.
description: A fragrant and colorful Kashmiri dish, this pulao is enriched with dried fruits, nuts, and saffron, offering a unique taste experience.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g cubed chicken breast in a mixture of 15 mL soy sauce, 15 mL hoisin sauce, and 10 mL sesame oil for 1 hour.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add chicken and marinade, cook until chicken is browned.
Add 100 g diced bell peppers, 50 g peanuts, and 5 g dried chilies. Cook for 5 minutes.
Mix in a sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL vinegar, 10 g sugar, and 5 g cornstarch dissolved in 15 mL water. Bring to a boil to thicken.
Serve hot garnished with sliced green onions.
description: A spicy, sweet, and savory Chinese dish featuring chicken, peanuts, and bell peppers with a rich sauce.

name: Korean Spicy Tofu Stew
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL sesame oil. Add 20 g minced garlic and 10 g grated ginger; sauté until fragrant.
Add 300 g cubed tofu, 500 mL vegetable broth, 100 g sliced mushrooms, and 50 g kimchi. Bring to a simmer.
Season with 30 mL soy sauce and 15 g gochugaru (Korean chili powder). Cook for 20 minutes.
Stir in 50 g chopped scallions and a handful of chopped cilantro before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
description: A hearty and spicy Korean stew featuring soft tofu with mushrooms and kimchi in a vibrant, flavorful broth.

name: Kale Pesto Pasta
author: System
method: In a food processor, blend 200 g chopped kale, 50 g almonds, 2 cloves garlic, 50 g grated Parmesan, and 100 mL olive oil until smooth.
Cook 400 g pasta according to package instructions, drain, reserving some cooking water.
Toss pasta with kale pesto, adding pasta water as needed to thin the sauce.
Serve with extra Parmesan and a drizzle of olive oil.
description: A vibrant and nutritious twist on traditional pesto, using kale and almonds, served with al dente pasta.

name: Kiwi Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Roll out 300 g pastry dough and fit into a tart pan. Prick the bottom with a fork.
Bake the crust for 20 minutes until golden. Let cool.
In a bowl, mix 200 g cream cheese with 50 g powdered sugar and 5 mL vanilla extract. Spread over the cooled crust.
Top with sliced kiwis and brush with 30 mL apricot jam for glaze.
Chill for 1 hour before serving.
description: A fresh and delightful kiwi tart with a sweet cream cheese filling and a crisp pastry crust, topped with bright kiwi slices.

name: Kofta Kebabs
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine 500 g ground lamb, 20 g minced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, 10 g chopped parsley, 5 g cumin, and salt and pepper.
Form the mixture into elongated kebabs around skewers.
Grill over medium heat for 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked through.
Serve with tzatziki sauce and flatbreads.
description: Savory Middle Eastern lamb kebabs, seasoned with herbs and spices, grilled to perfection.

name: Korean Kalbi
author: System
method: Marinate 800 g beef short ribs in a mixture of 60 mL soy sauce, 40 mL brown sugar, 30 mL sesame oil, 20 g minced garlic, 10 g grated ginger, and 30 mL rice wine for at least 3 hours or overnight.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side until nicely charred and cooked through.
Serve with steamed rice and a side of kimchi.
description: Tender and flavorful Korean BBQ ribs, marinated in a sweet and savory sauce and grilled to perfection.

name: Key Lime Pie
author: System
method: Mix 300 g graham cracker crumbs with 75 g melted butter and press into a pie dish.
Whisk together 400 mL condensed milk, 120 mL key lime juice, and 3 egg yolks until smooth. Pour into the crust.
Bake at 175°C for 15 minutes. Allow to cool, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
Top with whipped cream before serving.
description: A classic dessert with a tangy lime filling and a sweet, crumbly graham cracker crust, topped with fluffy whipped cream.

name: Kung Pao Tofu
author: System
method: Cube 400 g firm tofu and fry in 30 mL vegetable oil until golden. Set aside.
In the same pan, add 100 g diced bell peppers, 50 g peanuts, and 5 dried chilies; stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Add the tofu back to the pan with a sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL vinegar, 20 g sugar, and 10 mL sesame oil; cook for 5 minutes.
Thicken with a slurry of 5 g cornstarch and 15 mL water.
Garnish with green onions and serve with rice.
description: A spicy and savory vegetarian twist on the classic Chinese dish, featuring crispy tofu with peppers and peanuts in a bold sauce.

name: Kerala Fish Curry
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL coconut oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 20 curry leaves, and 3 sliced green chilies; sauté for 1 minute.
Add 1 chopped onion, 20 g minced garlic, and 10 g grated ginger; sauté until onions are soft.
Add 500 g chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric, and 1 tsp chili powder; cook until tomatoes break down.
Add 800 g cubed firm white fish and 200 mL coconut milk; simmer for 20 minutes.
